title: Warriors Forward Kevin Durant to Sign Two-Year Max Deal
description: Kevin Durant intends to open the N.B.A.s free agency period by telling the Golden State Warriors that he wants a two-year maximum contract with a player option to return to free agency in July 2019, according to two people familiar with his plans.

title: More Women Than Men: State Legislatures Could Shift for the First Time
description: Women are a quarter of state legislatures, but the gender balance could change in at least nine states.

title: 2018 N.B.A. Free Agency: Before LeBron James, Kevin Durant and Paul George Made Waves
description: Make sense of the start of N.B.A. free agency by thinking about it this way: The last few weeks have been the longest Christmas Eve ever, with trade and signing rumors popping up like stolen peeks in the presents closet. Christmas arrived in the wee hours of Sunday morning, but it didnt really begin until Santa Claus arrived  and this summer, like most summers, the bearded man everyone was waiting for is named LeBron James.

title: Sonny Gray Is Battered by Red Sox, Emphasizing Yankees Need for Rotation Help
description: The booing that thundered down upon Sonny Gray on Saturday night did not go unnoticed by that beleaguered starting pitcher. He heard it. He even understood it. Had he been sitting in the stands, he said, I probably would have booed me louder.

title: Quotation of the Day: War Robbed Him of His Family, Then His Eyes, Then His Love
description: If I had lost my eyes and had her hand, I would still be happy. But now I neither have eyes, nor her.

title: Corrections: July 1, 2018
description: SUNDAY REVIEW

title: Laura Mitchell, Oliver Tully
description: Laura Brooke Mitchell and Oliver James Tully were married June 30 at Olympias Valley Estate, an organic farm and events space in Petaluma, Calif. Corey W. Jacoby, a friend of the couple who was ordained by the American Marriage Ministries for this event, officiated.

title: Katherine Kohler, Anthony Shattuck
description: Katherine Ward Kohler and Anthony James Shattuck were married June 30 at their summer home at Lake Wesauking in Towanda, Pa. The Rev. Nicholas Cucchiaro, who was ordained by the Old Catholic Church, officiated.

title: Rebecca Jackson, Nicholas Beaird
description: Rebecca Harding Jackson and Nicholas Littlejohn Beaird were married June 30 at Fort Madison in Castine, Me. The Rev. Margaret Beckman, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated.

title: Margot Sanger-Katz, Daniel Friedman
description: Margot Sanger-Katz and Daniel Rukke Friedman were married June 30. Ruth J. Katz, a Universal Life minister and friend of the brides family, officiated at the couples home in Washington.

title: Mae Karwowski, Ryan Wesely
description: Mae Farrell Karwowski and Ryan Hunter Wesely were married June 30 in Provincetown, Mass. Kathryn OConnell Cleary, a celebrant affiliated with the Federation of Christian Ministries, officiated at the Provincetown Inn.

title: Julia von Trk, Bernd Delahaye
description: Julia Charlotte Wilhelmine Nienaber von Trk and Bernd Paul Delahaye were married June 30 by the Rev. Douglas T. King, a senior associate minister at Brick Presbyterian Church in New York, where the ceremony took place.

title: Elaine Driscoll, John Sorrell
description: Elaine McMillin Driscoll and John Byron Sorrell were married June 30 at Frenchs Point in Stockton Springs, Me. Paula D. Silsby, the former United States attorney for Maine, officiated.

title: Jayne Bernsten, Jarett Banks
description: Jayne Rose Bernsten and Jarett Fredric Banks are to be married July 1 at Society Hill Synagogue in Philadelphia. Rabbi Avi Winokur is to officiate. On Aug. 25, the couple are to have a second ceremony, led by Rabbi Michel Liebermann, at Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild, an art institute in Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat, France.

title: Sauda Bholat, Sufian Shahid
description: Dr. Sauda Esoof Bholat and Sufian Akther Shahid were married June 30 at the home of the brides parents in Hawthorne, Calif. Imam Ahmed Patel officiated.

title: Caroline Anderson, John Foley
description: Caroline Ann Anderson and John Thomas Foley were married June 30 in the Merrick Rose Garden in Evanston, Ill. Cindy Ciluffo, a friend of the couple, who was ordained a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated, assisted by Paul Giblin, a cousin of the groom.

title: This Weeks Wedding Announcements
description: When Jennifer Josten entered the Ph.D. program at Yale in the fall of 2005, Matthew Howard Robb was already in his fifth year there. He was so focused on writing his dissertation that when she made arrangements with him to borrow a poster from his advisers office to use in a class presentation, he didnt recognize it as an opportunity to get to know a fellow art scholar (nor was he inclined to let her take the poster out of the office, though she persisted and did indeed take it).

title: Vita Emery, Matthew Beaton
description: Victoria Gardner Emery and Matthew Stephen Beaton were married June 30. The Rev. April S. Blaine, a United Methodist minister, officiated at Strongwater Food and Spirits, a restaurant and events space in Columbus, Ohio.

title: Silvia Garcia, Roberto Cotto
description: Silvia Cecilia Garcia and Roberto Anthony Cotto were married June 29 at St. Josephs Roman Catholic Church in Astoria, Queens. The Rev. Vincent F. Miceli performed the ceremony.

title: Joanna Shalleck-Klein, Allon Kedem
description: Joanna Shalleck-Klein and Allon Shmuel Itzhak Kedem were married June 30 at Woodend Sanctuary, an events space owned by the Audubon Naturalist Society in Chevy Chase, Md. Rabbi Adam N. Rosenwasser officiated.

title: Amanda Kane, Jeffrey Rapp
description: Amanda Judith Kane and Jeffrey Joseph Rapp are to be married July 1 at Auberge du Soleil, a resort in Rutherford, Calif. Stanley E. Woodward Jr., a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister for this event, is to officiate.

title: Sarah Schrag, William Adler
description: Sarah Lerman Schrag and William Thomas Adler were married June 30 at Windy Hill Family Farm in Centreville, Md. The groom's sibling, Rachel Adler, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Molly Bryck, Yetta Kurland
description: Molly Sarah Bryck and Yetta G. Kurland were married June 30 at Indian Ridge, an events space in Highland, N.Y. Daniel P. Bryck, Ms. Brycks brother, who became a Universal Life minister for this event, officiated. Bridget B. Albright, a college friend of Ms. Kurland, took part in the ceremony, leading the couple in the exchange of rings.

title: Rachel Stern, Matthew DeJong
description: Rachel Gene Stern and Matthew Frederick DeJong are to be married July 1 at the Bridgeport Art Center in Chicago. Rabbi Ari Moffic is to officiate.

title: Erin Seims, Charles Anderson
description: Erin Kathleen Seims and Charles Alfonso Anderson were married June 30 in Northport, N.Y. The Rev. Peter C. Dooley, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Philip Neri Parish.

title: Susan Liu, William Sankey Jr.
description: Sifan Bo Liu and William Lee Sankey Jr. were married June 30 at Queen of All Saints Roman Catholic Church in Brooklyn. The Rev. Joseph A. Ceriello, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Ifeolu Babatunde, Barak Sered
description: Ifeolu Oladuni Babatunde and Dr. Barak Raphael Sered are to be married July 1 at the Bedford Village Inn, a hotel in Bedford, N.H. Kate Quarfordt, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, is to officiate.

title: Bryce Hall, Marshall Nannes
description: Marshall Everett Nannes and Bryce William Hall were married June 30 at the Carnegie Institution for Science, a research institution in Washington. Oliver Munn, a mutual friend who introduced the couple and became authorized as a temporary officiant by the District of Columbia Marriage Bureau, officiated.

title: Sarah Lengauer, Catherine Ratelle
description: Sarah Lengauer and Catherine Ann Ratelle were married June 28 in Washington. David Bell, a marriage officiant at the H. Carl Moultrie Courthouse, officiated. On July 13, the couple are to have a second ceremony led by Martha Ratelle Doyle, an aunt of Ms. Ratelle, at Hotel Schloss Leopoldskron in Salzburg, Austria.

title: Pallavi Thatai, Philip Law
description: Pallavi Thatai and Philip Cantin Law were married June 30 at St. Marys Parish in Banff National Park in Alberta, Canada. The Rev. Dan Stevenot, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Ana Silva, Phillip Hsu
description: Ana Kristina Silva and Phillip KohKwe Hsu were married June 30 at the Upper Montclair Country Club in Clifton, N.J. Phil Passantino, who was ordained by the Sanctuary of the Beloved, performed the ceremony.

title: Komal Patel, Kishore Padmaraju
description: Komal Rajendra Patel and Kishore Padmaraju were married June 26 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Joey Tai, a staff member in the New York City Clerks Office, officiated.

title: Denise Jones, Anthony Baker
description: Denise Michele Jones and Anthony Jerome Baker II were married June 29 in Atlanta. The Rev. Reginald W. Sharpe Jr., a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at Morehouse Colleges Danforth Chapel.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: A Baseball Rivalry and Recovery Boys
description: The Yankees-Red Sox rivalry is back. And stream a documentary series about opioid addiction recovery on Netflix.

title: Sponsors of Migrant Children Face Steep Transport Fees and Red Tape
description: LOS ANGELES  Marlon Parada, a construction worker in Los Angeles, already was worried when he got an urgent call from his cousin in Honduras, asking if he would agree to take in the cousins 14-year-old daughter. Shed been taken from her mother while attempting to cross the border and detained in Houston, he said. She couldnt be released unless a family member agreed to take her in.

title: Fox News Once Gave Trump a Perch. Now Its His Bullhorn.
description: In 2011, Fox News announced that a new guest would appear weekly on Fox & Friends, its chummy morning show. Bold, brash, and never bashful, a network ad declared. The Donald now makes his voice loud and clear, every Monday on Fox.

title: Criminal Groups Seek to Decide Outcome in Many Mexican Races
description: CHILPANCINGO, Mexico  His election campaign for state Congress was only hours old when he started to receive the threats. Sometimes they came by text, other times in phone calls, with an unidentified voice on the other end of the line.

title: Unwelcome Sound on Germanys Stages: Musicians Who Boycott Israel
description: BERLIN  The Scottish rappers Young Fathers have earned critical praise for their blend of hip-hop, electronica and gospel. They won Britains prestigious Mercury Prize for album of the year. Their sweaty, uplifting shows are in demand across Europe.

title: Mexicos Elections: What to Watch For
description: MEXICO CITY  The superlatives have abounded during the run-up to general elections in Mexico: The most important in years. The most potential voters. The largest ever.

title: Homes That Sold for $450,000
description: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region:

title: Thailand Cave Rescuers Report Progress in Search for Soccer Team
description: THAM LUANG CAVE, Thailand  Searchers trying to reach a dozen boys and their soccer coach in a flooded cave complex used huge pumps to reduce the water level, allowing divers to place guide ropes and air tanks along the route, officials said Sunday.

title: It Just Wasnt Meant to Be, Batman
description: Selina Kyle and Bruce Wayne, two of the most prominent citizens of Gotham City, were to be married at 6 a.m. on July 4. It was intended to be a quiet, intimate ceremony with just the judge and two witnesses atop the citys Finger Tower skyscraper. It was a moment that has been building since the couple first met in 1940. It was also not meant to be.

title: World Cup, ICE, Migrants: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Sikhs and Hindus Bear Brunt of Latest Afghanistan Suicide Attack
description: JALALABAD, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber struck a crowd of Afghan Sikhs and Hindus arriving to meet with President Ashraf Ghani on Sunday as he visited the eastern city of Jalalabad, an attack that killed at least 19 people and wounded 10 others, officials said.

title: That Roar You Heard Was From Russia. Its Team Sent Spain Packing.
description: MOSCOW  We have a saying in Russia, Stanislav Cherchesov told reporters from behind his fearsome mustache on Saturday afternoon.

title: Thousands Protest in Hong Kong on Anniversary of Handover to China
description: HONG KONG  Thousands of Hong Kong residents marched on Sunday to observe the 21st anniversary of the territorys return to China from Britain, a public demonstration of their dissatisfaction with the local government and their fears about the Chinese Communist Partys growing influence in the territory.

title: 10 Family Members Are Found Hanged in Home Near New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  Eleven members of a family were found dead at their home near New Delhi on Sunday, most of them hanged from the ceiling, blindfolded and gagged, the police said.

title: Neighbor Calls the Police on a 12-Year-Old Boy Mowing the Grass
description: In the video she streamed live on Facebook, Lucille Holt-Colden is effusive in her praise of 12-year-old Reginald Fields and his friends as they mow the front lawn of her Ohio home.

title: Overloaded Bus Plunges Into Gorge in India, Killing Dozens
description: NEW DELHI  At least 48 people were killed and a dozen more injured after an overloaded bus plunged into a gorge in northern India early Sunday, the police said.

title: Play It Again, Issam: In Casablanca, a Cafe Is Still a Cafe
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco  Some things get better as time goes by. Ricks Caf may be one of them.

title: The Fashion Closet, Seen From Inside and Out
description: The first thing we watch Plum Kettle (Joy Nash) do in Dietland is look in a mirror. She is blunt about how she sees herself: Fat. Its O.K. Im allowed to say it.

title: Has Trump Watched ICE Liberate Towns From the Grasp of MS-13? No.
description: In a series of tweets on Saturday, President Trump defended United States immigration authorities.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. It is Canada Day, Fte du Canada, celebrating the unification of Canada, Nova Scotia and New Brunswick in 1867, one dominion within the British Empire. Theyll go hard in Ottawa today, less so in Quebec, where its Moving Day. Either way, perhaps youd like to make some butter tarts?

title: Dont Hate Her. Shes Just the (Subway) Messenger.
description: O.K., bot, someone wrote back recently when Haley Dragoo answered him on Twitter, as if Ms. Dragoos message had been generated by a robot. She wasted no time setting him straight: No, Im a real person.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Close Look at Where Kids Live, Learn and Play
description: Jane Jacobs, the famed urban activist who thought deeply about the streets and spaces where we live, wrote of children: Their homes and playgrounds, so orderly looking, so buffered from the muddled, messy intrusions of the great world, may accidentally be ideally planned for children to concentrate on television, but for too little else their hungry brains require. Alexandra Lange quotes this thought from Jacobs in the introduction to her new book, The Design of Childhood: How the Material World Shapes Independent Kids. In Ms. Langes book, schools, playgrounds, toys and other habitual features of young peoples lives are closely examined: the origins of their design, their strengths and shortcomings, and their short-term and long-term effects on children. Below, Ms. Lange discusses Minecraft and Legos, her surprise at the feminist angle of her book and more.

title: 9 Wounded as Man Stabbed Children at a 3-Year-Olds Birthday Party, Police Say
description: A man armed with a knife attacked children attending a 3-year-olds birthday party at an apartment complex in Idaho on Saturday night, going on a stabbing rampage that wounded nine people, including six children, the police said.

title: Turmoil at Lincoln Center: Infighting, Money Troubles, Scrapped Projects
description: Looking forward to Lincoln Centers namesake festival this summer? Its been scrapped. Good luck finding the centers new Hall of Fame that was promised a few years ago: on the back burner. And those long-delayed plans to radically remake the home of the New York Philharmonic? Being rethought.

title: Officials Identify a Source in the Romaine Lettuce E. Coli Outbreak
description: The strain of E. coli bacteria that contaminated romaine lettuce and was tied to the deaths of five people was found in a tainted irrigation canal in Arizona, federal officials said on Thursday.

title: The Best TV Shows and Movies New to Netflix, Amazon and More in July
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our thrice-weekly newsletter here.

title: Trumps Travel Ban: How It Works and Who Is Affected
description: Almost obscured in the rancor over President Trumps immigrant crackdown at the southern border is the impact of his travel ban, upheld by the Supreme Court last week.

title: Amend This! How Would You Change the Constitution?
description: More than 11,000 amendments to the Constitution have been proposed since its ratification, but only 27 have become law  none since 1992. There has been much discussion about repeal of the Second Amendment, elimination of the Electoral College and adoption of the Equal Rights Amendment. As we celebrate the Fourth of July this week, we ask you what other changes you would like to see considered.

title: Review: A Conductor Sets Munichs Ashen Parsifal Aflame
description: MUNICH  Spring is here, an old knight declares in the final act of Wagners Parsifal. Yet wintry night never ends in the grim, ashen new production of the work which opened the Munich Opera Festival on Thursday. (It will be broadcast live at staatsoper.tv on July 8.)

title: Shootout Sunday: Croatia Follows Russias Lead and Wins on Penalty Kicks
description: It was a full day of penalty-kick drama at the World Cup, with Croatia advancing to the World Cup quarterfinals by outlasting Denmark in a shootout just hours after Russia had done the same to beat Spain in a huge upset. Combined, the two games offered a remarkable number of saves in one-on-one, high-wire confrontations.

title: Susan Collins, Pivotal Moderate, Says Hostility to Roe Would Sway Her Vote
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Susan Collins, a moderate Maine Republican whose vote could prove decisive in filling the Supreme Courts vacant seat, said on Sunday that she would not vote for a nominee who showed hostility toward Roe v. Wade, the landmark 1973 decision establishing a constitutional right to abortion.

title: In a Corruption Battle in Honduras, the Elites Hit Back
description: Ever since an international anticorruption commission in Honduras announced its first case against lawmakers last year, the panel has been under attack from the officials it is supposed to be investigating.

title: Woman Assaulted Black Boy After Telling Him He Did Not Belong at Pool, Officials Say
description: First, there was BBQ Becky.

title: Donald Ritchie, Record-Breaking Ultrarunner, Is Dead at 73
description: Donald Ritchie, one of the worlds top ultrarunners, who set more than a dozen records traversing distances better suited to an automobile than a human being, died on June 16 at his home in Lossiemouth, Moray, Scotland. He was 73.

title: Arvid Carlsson, Who Discovered a Treatment for Parkinsons, Dies at 95
description: Dr. Arvid Carlsson, a Swedish scientist whose discoveries about the brain led to the development of drugs for Parkinsons disease and earned him a Nobel Prize, died on Friday in Gothenburg, Sweden. He was 95.

title: Review: Laura Bush Killed a Guy Plumbs a First Ladys Mysteries
description: In November 1963, 17-year-old Laura Welch ran a stop sign and crashed into another car, killing its teenage driver. Such accidents dont usually end up on the animated series Family Guy, but that one did  because Laura Welch went on to marry George W. Bush and become first lady of the United States.

title: In a Blow to the Islanders, John Tavares Joins the Maple Leafs
description: John Tavares, an Islander his entire nine-year career and the team captain the past five seasons, has decided to go home. He signed a seven-year, $77 million contract on Sunday with the Toronto Maple Leafs that will bolster that club but leave the Islanders without the longtime face of their franchise.

title: Review: First Love for a Couple of a Certain Age
description: Edith and Harold, the solitary souls who become a pair in Charles Mees pleasingly jagged romantic comedy First Love, dont so much meet cute as meet curmudgeonly. Hes snoozing on a park bench when she happens along and wants to sit.

title: Miriam Griffin, Who Put Nero in a New Light, Dies at 82
description: Miriam T. Griffin was born in New York City but found her career an ocean away and 2,000 years in the past.

title: Thousands Across U.S. Protest Separations of Migrant Families
description: More than 700 demonstrations took place on Saturday across the United States and on the border with Mexico, organizers said.

title: Sicario: Day of the Soldado Earns $19 Million, Beating Expectations
description: The Summer of Josh Brolin swelters on.

description: The spring 2019 collection.

title: Australias Anti-interference Laws
description: The Australian government has passed far-reaching new laws that ban foreign interference in politics and mete out harsher punishments for the divulging of classified information. Officials contend the laws arent targeting any specific countries, but China has reacted unfavorably. China is Australias most significant trading partner.

title: Andy Murray Pulls Out of Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  The two-time champion Andy Murray withdrew from Wimbledon on Sunday, the eve of this years tournament, citing a persistent hip injury.

title: Instagram Account That Sought Harassment Tales May Be Unmasked
description: Since October, advertisers have been riveted by an anonymous Instagram account called Diet Madison Avenue, which solicited reports of sexual misconduct in the ad industry and published the names of alleged harassers. But now, the account has been deleted and its creators names could be made public through a defamation lawsuit brought by a man who claims Diet Madison Avenue posted false allegations about him that cost him his job.

title: Hard News. Angry Administration. Teenage Journalists Know What Its Like.
description: High schools across the country have pushed back this year against student journalists who have reported on sensitive subjects, like the reaction to school shootings and adolescent sexuality.

title: Merci Madame: Simone Veil Is Honored With Panthon Burial
description: PARIS  Some fainted in the scorching July heat on Sunday, and many more wept as Simone Veils coffin was carried up to the Panthon, Frances burial place for some of its most illustrious citizens.

title: Trump Attacks Democrats on Calls to Abolish ICE
description: BEDMINSTER, N.J.  President Trump has gone on the attack against Democratic lawmakers who have called for abolishing Immigration and Customs Enforcement, seeking to seize political advantage on an issue that has put him on the defensive for weeks and offer a winning message for Republicans facing a forbidding midterm election.

title: India, Thailand, Mexico: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Liliane Montevecchi, Tony Winner for Nine, Dies at 85
description: Liliane Montevecchi, the French-born actress, singer and dancer who won a Tony Award for her showstopping role as the producer in Nine, died on Friday at her home in Manhattan. She was 85.

title: In Yemen, a Pause in Fighting Raises Hopes for Peace Talks
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  When the United Arab Emirates began the battle last month to seize the strategic Yemeni port city of Al Hudaydah, Emirati officials were confident of a quick victory, brushing aside international warnings of a potential humanitarian catastrophe and boasting that their military and local proxy forces could oust the opposing Houthi rebels.

title: Heres Some Cryptocurrency. Now Please Use It.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  You may have seen the actor and part-time tech investor Ashton Kutcher present $4 million worth of digital coins called XRP to Ellen DeGeneress favorite charity on her talk show. Or maybe you saw Stephen Colbert announce a $29 million donation of XRP to schoolteachers on his late-night show.

title: In Hollywood-Style Jailbreak, French Convict Flees Prison
description: PARIS  A jailbreak of the kind usually dreamed up for Hollywood screenplays unfolded in real life on Sunday in France when a helicopter landed in a prison courtyard and masked men leaped out and spirited away a well-known criminal.

title: Givenchy: Fall 2018
description: The fall 2018 couture collection.

title: Supreme Court Labor Decision Wasnt Just a Loss for Unions
description: The Supreme Court decision striking down mandatory union fees for government workers was not only a blow to unions. It will also hit hard at a vast network of groups dedicated to advancing liberal policies and candidates.

title: Her Daughter in Tow, Serena Williams Welcomes the Pressure of Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Serena Williams won the Wimbledon singles title the last two times she played here, in 2015 and 2016. Two years ago, she also won the doubles event with her sister Venus for the sixth time.

title: Keep This Between Us
description: MONDAY PUZZLE   We dont keep a lot of secrets from each other, do we? You know about the Extremely Spunky Border terrier. You know about my partner, the Resident South African. You know Im a foodie. But Im certainly not going to tell you about how, when I was a child, I used to hide behind a chair in my parents living room when the Emergency Alert System ran tests on television because they terrified me. That would be TMI.

title: Trading David Bowie Cards
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Case of the Purloined Poultry: How ISIS Prosecuted Petty Crime
description: TEL KAIF, Iraq  The crime scene was Stall No. 200 in a market eight miles north of Mosul, Iraq.

title: Bulwark Against an Abortion Ban? Medical Advances
description: As partisans on both sides of the abortion divide contemplate a Supreme Court with two Trump appointees, one thing is certain: America even without legal abortion would be very different from America before abortion was legal.

title: Covering Beyonc and the Surprise Album Drop
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Emergency Rooms Run Out of Vital Drugs, and Patients Are Feeling It
description: CHICAGO  George Vander Linde tapped a code into the emergency rooms automated medicine cabinet. A drawer slid open and he flipped the lid, but found nothing inside.

title: If Congress Changes Food Stamp Requirements, Kids Will Go Hungry
description: What do you do when youre hungry? we asked Maylee, a 6-year-old girl. I go to bed and think about eating, she said.

title: 820 Children Under 6 in Public Housing Tested High for Lead
description: Even though the New York City Housing Authority has been under a microscope for flouting lead-paint safety regulations for years, the exact number of children residing in public housing poisoned by lead was never disclosed.

title: The Disney-Fox Deal Sails Through, a Bit Too Easily
description: The Department of Justice spent nearly two years investigating AT&Ts acquisition of Time Warner and bringing an ultimately unsuccessful lawsuit against the deal that involved two companies not directly in competition with each other. So it was stunning when the department announced on Wednesday  just six months after the deal was announced  that it had approved Disneys $71 billion purchase of the entertainment assets of 21st Century Fox, one of Disneys top rivals.

title: Your Credit Card Will Pay for the Next Recession
description: Every three months, a select group of Federal Reserve officials gets together to guess where the federal funds rate is headed. Thats the interest rate banks charge one another for overnight loans. Its important because its an economic cue ball, creating a knock-on effect for other interest rates.

title: Activist Investor Daniel Loeb Intensifies Pressure on Nestl to Reorganize
description: Daniel Loeb, the hedge fund mogul known for his aggressive investment stances, intensified pressure on Nestl on Sunday, calling on the board of the global food giant to split the company into three divisions.

title: As Bolton Says North Korea Could Disarm in a Year, Reality Lags Promises
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps national security adviser said on Sunday that North Korea could dismantle all of its nuclear weapons, threatening missiles and biological weapons in a year, a far more aggressive schedule than the one Secretary of State Mike Pompeo outlined for Congress recently, reflecting a strain inside the administration over how to match promises with realism.

title: Trumps Rage Junkies
description: It is truly a confounding time to be alive, to be an American.

title: As Its Stars Shone at the World Cup, P.S.G. Scrambled to Avoid Financial Punishment
description: MOSCOW  Edinson Cavani of Uruguay and Kylian Mbapp of France lit up the opening day of the World Cups knockout phase on Saturday, scoring two goals apiece to send their countries to the quarterfinals. On Monday, their Paris Saint-Germain teammate Neymar can join them there with Brazil.

title: Trumps Purple Family Values
description: In the months leading up to Donald Trumps election, I noticed a divide in how my acquaintances spoke about his family values  or lack thereof.

title: LeBron James Joining Lakers on 4-Year $154 Million Deal
description: After helping the city of Cleveland banish a championship curse that spanned 52 years, LeBron James has found his next challenge: Rescuing the Los Angeles Lakers from the most unsuccessful period in the storied franchises history.

title: For Puerto Rican Evacuees, a Journey Without End
description: Over the weekend, Yanitza Cruz and her family moved. Again. Twice, in fact, for the third and fourth times since Hurricane Maria swamped their home in a rural village in Puerto Rico last September.

title: South Koreas Enduring Racism
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Hundreds of desperate Yemenis fleeing civil war  more than 550  arrived on the South Korean island of Jeju and applied for asylum between January and May. In response, more than half a million South Koreans have petitioned President Moon Jae-in to turn away all refugees. Online platforms have become grounds for refugee-bashing. An actual anti-refugee demonstration took place on Saturday in downtown Seoul.

title: These Hosts Arent Done Partying
description: Russias upset victory over Spain in a penalty shootout on Sunday left fans of the host country stunned and ecstatic. Hours earlier outside Luzhniki Stadium, the revelry was more muted but still colorful.

title: Man Faces Arson Charge in Connection With Colorado Wildfire
description: The authorities arrested a Danish man they tied to the start of a destructive fire in Southern Colorado that has grown to more than 40,000 acres and forced hundreds of residents to flee their homes.

title: No Corrections: July 2, 2018
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, July 2, 2018.

title: Lpez Obrador, an Atypical Leftist, Wins Mexico Presidency in Landslide
description: MEXICO CITY  Riding a wave of populist anger fueled by rampant corruption and violence, the leftist Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador was elected president of Mexico on Sunday, in a landslide victory that upended the nations political establishment and handed him a sweeping mandate to reshape the country.

title: The Affair Season 4, Episode 3 Recap: Playing the Savior
description: All right, so, let me get this straight. She was married to you, and then she cheated with you, and then she left you for you, and then she cheated on you with you, and then she had your baby, but then said it was your baby. Did I get that right?

title: Germanys Merkel Seemed to Get a Reprieve Over Migrants. It Didnt Last.
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany thought she had fended off a mutiny within her own conservative alliance after returning from marathon talks with fellow European leaders on Friday with an agreement on how to handle migration.

title: In Denmark, Harsh New Laws for Immigrant Ghettos
description: COPENHAGEN  When Rokhaia Naassan gives birth in the coming days, she and her baby boy will enter a new category in the eyes of Danish law. Because she lives in a low-income immigrant neighborhood described by the government as a ghetto, Rokhaia will be what the Danish newspapers call a ghetto parent and he will be a ghetto child.

title: Quotation of the Day: For Help From Danish State, a Demand: Give Us Your Children
description: Nobody should tell me whether or how my daughter should go to preschool. Or when. Id rather lose my benefits than submit to force.

title: Denmark, Merkel, Russia: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Stuck in Soccer Limbo, in the Shadow of the World Cup
description: MOSCOW  An odd thing happened in December when soccer fans in Crimea, the disputed Black Sea peninsula annexed by Russia from Ukraine in 2014, began trying to buy tickets to the World Cup.

title: Dell to Return to Public Markets With Stock Deal
description: When Michael S. Dell took his namesake technology company private in 2013, he said that doing so would give him the freedom to prepare it for a future that stretched well beyond personal computers.

title: Whats on TV Monday: The Rape of Recy Taylor and Strangers
description: Nancy Buirskis documentary on Recy Taylor airs on Starz. And on Facebook Watch, Strangers is back for a second season.

title: Bostons David Price Knocked Around by Yankees Once Again
description: David Price trudged from the mound to the dugout, down the steps and straight into the visitors clubhouse at Yankee Stadium. All around him, the jeers and boos of two fan bases cut through the steamy air, but Price gave no visible reaction.

title: The Lakers Got Their Man. (Thats What the Lakers Do.)
description: Fans of the Los Angeles Lakers can be forgiven if they are not exactly bowled over by the news that LeBron James, a once-in-a-generation talent, decided to join their team. After all, they have been watching this scenario play out since the late 1960s.

title: Roger Federer Sheds Nike Swoosh for Uniqlo, Then Wins Match
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Roger Federer won Wimbledon for a record eighth time last year, which meant on Monday, following tradition, he for the eighth time played the first match on Centre Court on the tournaments first day.

title: Philippine Mayor Who Shamed Drug Suspects Is Killed During Flag Ceremony
description: MANILA  A mayor in the Philippines known for parading drug suspects through his town was fatally shot during a flag-raising ceremony on Monday morning, the police said.

title: 5 Cheap(ish) Things to Get You Started With Trail Running
description: Tired of running on blacktop and sidewalks, especially as the summer sun beats down? I have an idea: try trail running.

title: Mexico Elections: 5 Takeaways from Lpez Obradors Victory
description: MEXICO CITY  After 18 years of establishment politics, Mexicans decided on Sunday that enough was enough, electing the leftist candidate Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador as president in a landslide victory in an election of firsts.

title: China Warns Its Tourists: Beware Gun Violence in America
description: HONG KONG  China has warned its citizens about traveling to a foreign country with highly frequent gun violence.

title: Finally, Some Answers on the Effects of Medicaid Expansion
description: The Medicaid logjam appears to be breaking.

title: Can the A.C.L.U. Become the N.R.A. for the Left?
description: On the morning of Friday, June 22, the American Civil Liberties Union won a major Supreme Court decision in Carpenter v. United States, which was possibly, at least in terms of pure jurisprudence, the most important case argued before the court this past session. It was a landmark ruling that changed the future of digital privacy in America, but news of the win was only the second most important thing happening at the A.C.L.U. offices that day. At 3 p.m., a conference call was scheduled to discuss the more than 2,000 children whose fates were tied to another A.C.L.U. suit against the government.

title: Wedge Salads Dont Need Gussying, Just the Proper Assembly
description: It has been a hard year for romaine. A national food-poisoning outbreak tied to the lettuce this winter sickened hundreds of people across 35 states and killed five. The threat has passed, but the sting lingers. Romaine, for many households, is still a tough sell. In mine, commodity iceberg, that old crunchy friend, has lately been in ascendance, and wedge salads have been the order of the day: pale green-white triangles drizzled in pale white-blue dressing, with crumbles of bacon and bright red pops of cherry tomato, and pricks of green chive strewn across the top. The crunch of it, the bright colors, the sweet and salt seem to please the children. Adults, too.

title: Bob Dylan and Will Smith: Childrens Authors?
description: Kids too young to read generally have their books selected for them by adults, and we tend to gravitate toward favorite characters from our childhoods, which often means our parents childhoods: Madeline, Babar, Curious George and the rest of the time-tested gang. But where can a book-buying relative  a boomer whos nostalgic for his younger days, say  turn when Sophia and Jackson already own all the classics?

title: Is the National Mood the One in Polls or the One Online?
description: Nobody looks in the mirror and sees an archetype. The world may define you as a millennial or a Trump voter or a Star Wars bro, but inside your own head, you are you  an individual with thoughts, emotions and experiences as particular as your fingerprints. The only problem is that you are not, from many perspectives, quite unique in the way you think you are: Much of the time, your feelings are shared by so many millions of people that you are merely another face in the crowd. Your anger or indignation or gleeful schadenfreude is only one drop in a great countrywide wave of it. Like it or not, you are part of a national mood.

title: Meet the Personalities Behind These German Office Plants
description: Udo will soon be going to primary school, but Anna can already read. Doreen likes to party, and Irmfried is disoriented.  Of course, Udo is a rubber plant (or, ficus elastica); Anna, a heartleaf philodendron; Doreen, a ponytail palm; and Irmfried, a succulent. But to the German photographer Frederik Busch, these plants have no less personality than their human counterparts.

title: Preventing Suicide Among College Students
description: This column is a plea to all current and future college students and their families to deal openly and constructively with emotional, social and academic turmoil that can sometimes have heartbreaking  and usually preventable  consequences.

title: Make T Something | Laila Gohar
description: The culinary artist creates something in less than one hour  using a particularly sticky mystery ingredient.

title: Endless Gaming May Be a Bad Habit. That Doesnt Make It a Mental Illness.
description: The World Health Organization last month added internet gaming disorder to its manual of psychiatric diagnoses, and the reaction was, shall we say, muted.

title: America Has Gone Off the Rails. Steven Brill Sees Ways to Get It Back on Track.
description: TAILSPIN The People and Forces Behind Americas Fifty-Year Fall  and Those Fighting to Reverse It By Steven Brill Illustrated. 441 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $28.95.

title: Hurry Up and Get a Divorce? For the Rich, Theres an Incentive
description: WASHINGTON  For the wealthiest Americans, there may never be a better time to get divorced.

title: Cuomos Buffalo Billion: Is New York Getting Its Moneys Worth?
description: BUFFALO  More than six years ago, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced his bold vision for New Yorks second largest and perhaps longest-suffering city.

title: If Demographics Are Destiny, Why Cant Democrats Win This Denver District?
description: AURORA, Colo.  In the fast-changing political battleground that is suburban Denver, Somali families dine on goat soup and fish fritters in a onetime Chinese restaurant where golden dragons still guard the doorways.

title: A Food Artists Surprisingly Low-Key Recipe (That She Eats With Her Hands)
description: In One Good Meal, we ask cooking-inclined creative people to share the story behind a favorite dish they actually make and eat at home on a regular basis  and not just when theyre trying to impress.

title: The Balancing Act of Arches
description: As always, I arrived too late. The time to be here, the real sweet spot? I missed it. Try a good half-century ago, I was told by locals, before the place was discovered by the outside world, back when it was still Arches National Monument and not yet a designated park, just a dusty backwater in southeast Utah inhabited by a few old cowboys, desert castaways, Latter-Day seekers, and a handful of tourists whod perhaps made a wrong turn somewhere. The roads  a pure, unpaved hell  tended to discourage folks. Fifty, maybe 60, people a day made the four-mile drive from the highway to the front gate, where many simply turned around and headed back the way they came. (By contrast, 4,000 visitors now amount to a slow day at Arches.)

title: A Glasgow Architects Masterpiece Is Damaged, but Not His Magic
description: I can still remember the day in 2014 when I learned that the architect Charles Rennie Mackintoshs Glasgow School of Art  a spectacular landmark widely considered his masterpiece  had caught fire; a fluke accident that started when a hot projector ignited gases from a students spray foam canister.

title: Trumps Ancestral Village Abounds With His Relatives. Few Admit a Link.
description: KALLSTADT, Germany  Herbert Trump did not want to talk about it. Neither did Ilse Trump. Ursula Trump, who runs the Trump bakery in the next village, eventually relented, palms upturned, and sighed: You cant choose your relatives, can you?

title: The Things They Carried: Items Confiscated From Migrants in the Last Decade
description: For Tom Kiefer, they were symbols of humanity.

title: Delivering Amazon Packages to the Top of the World
description: LEH, India  Perched high in the Himalayas, near Indias border with China, the tiny town of Leh sometimes seems as if it has been left behind by modern technology. Internet and cellphone service is spotty, the two roads to the outside world are snowed in every winter, and Buddhist monasteries compete with military outposts for prime mountaintop locations.

title: Mexico, LeBron James, World Cup: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A President of Paradox for Mexico
description: MIAMI  In a landslide vote on Sunday, Mexicans elected Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador as their next president. AMLO, as he is known, has been labeled populist, leftist, authoritarian and nationalist. Yet hes also been called a pragmatist and a fiscal conservative. Who is AMLO and what kind of president is he apt to be? All of the above is the correct answer.

title: Stocks Tumble in Europe on Trade Worries and German Political Uncertainty
description: European stocks followed Asian markets lower on Monday, on fears that worsening trade disputes between the United States and other countries, as well as political uncertainty in Germany, could hurt global economic growth.

title: What if Trumps Nativism Actually Hurts Him?
description: President Trumps short-lived family separation policy extended the hard line on immigration he promoted during his presidential campaign. Many analysts believe that this strategy helped him win the election by politicizing latent nativist sentiment among white Americans. At his rallies, Mr. Trump consistently propounded a view of immigrants as criminals and miscreants, not to mention a cause of unemployment and wage stagnation among native-born citizens. As president, he has continued to use dehumanizing language in reference to immigrants, words like vermin, infest and animals. On Sunday, he dared Democrats to push for the abolition of the Immigration, Customs and Enforcement agency, claiming that if they pursued the idea, they would never win another election.

title: Listen to The Daily: Susan Collins on Roe v. Wade and the Next Justice
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: New York Today: A Sweaty Start to Summer
description: Good morning on this boiling Monday.

title: Chuck Schumer: Our Rights Hang in the Balance
description: Justice Anthony Kennedys retirement has created the most important vacancy on the Supreme Court in our lifetimes. Whoever fills Justice Kennedys seat will join an evenly divided court with the ability to affect the laws of the United States and the rights of its citizens for generations. Enormously important issues hang in the balance: the right of workers to organize, the pernicious influence of dark money in politics, the right of Americans to marry who they love, the right to vote.

title: The Myth of Corporate Americas Short-Term Thinking
description: American companies, according to their critics, are so focused on making quick profits that they have abdicated building for the long term. That idea has captivated policymakers, commentators and even some leading business executives.

title: DealBook Briefing: Dell Plans to Go Public, Again
description: Good Monday. Want this in your inbox every morning? Sign up here.

title: Schiaparelli: Fall 2018
description: The fall 2018 couture collection.

title: Quartz, Atlantic Medias Business News Start-Up, Is Sold to Japanese Firm
description: Atlantic Medias business news site built for the digital age has turned into a good bit of business itself.

title: Brazils Joy Is Mexicos Heartbreak in World Cup Knockout
description: SAMARA, Russia  There are no curses, Mexico Coach Juan Carlos Osorio had insisted, no reasons to be superstitious about the teams apparent inability, one World Cup after another, to advance to the quarterfinal round. There are simply good game plans, he said, and good players.

title: A Ring Lures the Conductor Gianandrea Noseda to Zurich
description: Like many courtships, this one was sealed with a ring.

title: Merkel, to Survive, Agrees to Border Camps for Migrants
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel, who staked her legacy on welcoming hundreds of thousands of migrants into Germany, agreed on Monday to build border camps for asylum seekers and to tighten the border with Austria in a political deal to save her government.

title: California Today: The Big Decisions Voters Face This November
description: Good morning.

title: Iris Van Herpen: Fall 2018
description: The fall 2018 couture collection.

title: Susan Collins Tends to Her Image
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive the newsletter each weekday.

title: Shopping for Nesting Tables
description: What is the point of nesting tables? One way to think of them is as side tables with superpowers.

title: How to Measure a Straight Line in Google Maps
description: Q. Google Maps gives the mileage between places based on driving directions on the available highways, but is there a way to calculate the distance between two towns as the crow flies?

title: LeBron James to the Lakers: Theres Much to Unpack Here
description: Perhaps youve seen the stunning statistic thats been making the N.B.A. rounds. If not: LeBron James is about to somehow become the sixth player among the top eight scorers in league history to play for the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: What the Heck Is That?: TAU (Lepton)
description: TAU is the Greek equivalent of the letter T, and while most people might recognize it from the Greek alphabet or on the door of a fraternity or sorority house, it is also a designation for certain elementary, negatively charged particles.

title: Already at Movie Theaters Near You: Ticket Subscriptions
description: MoviePass, the subscription-based movie ticket service, is struggling to stay afloat. But the payment model it has popularized appears to be here to stay.

title: Ode to Summer
description: Good morning. I almost wish we were butterflies and livd but three summer days, John Keats wrote to Fanny Brawne during their courtship  1818, 1819, lots of letters and poems and locks of hair exchanged. Three such days with you I could fill with more delight than 50 common years could ever contain.

title: Trump Interviews 4 Supreme Court Prospects in Rush to Name Replacement
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump interviewed four candidates on Monday to take Justice Anthony M. Kennedys place on the Supreme Court as the White House raced to meet the presidents promise to announce a replacement for the retiring justice early next week.

title: This Summer, Smell Like Fruit Salad
description: Lets be honest about it: The desire to walk around smelling like a fruit basket is, at its core, an embarrassing one. Its almost prelapsarian, this physical yearning to not only eat the ripe apple but also to rub it all over your skin.

title: Stanley Cavell and the American Contradiction
description: Within hours of the death of the influential American philosopher Stanley Cavell last week, major newspapers and journals published obituaries highlighting the unusual eclecticism of his work. The Times, for example, wrote that Cavell found heady ideas not only in the works of great thinkers of the past but also in romantic comedies from Hollywood. And The Washington Post called Cavell a onetime jazz pianist who traded music for philosophy but maintained an abiding interest in the arts, mining screwball comedies, Shakespearean dramas and postwar new music for philosophical insights.

title: Why Amazons Push Into Prescription Drugs Isnt a Guaranteed Success
description: When Amazon announced last week that it was buying the online pharmacy PillPack, it sent stocks of drugstore companies like Walgreens and Rite Aid tumbling, as investors worried that the retail behemoth would soon upend the pharmacy market.

title: New York City Considers New Pay Rules for Uber Drivers
description: New York City regulators are moving toward significantly raising wages for drivers for Uber and other ride-hailing apps. The step would make New York the first major American city to establish pay rules to grapple with the upheaval caused by ride-hailingcompanies that has decimated the yellow cab industry and left many drivers in financial ruin.

title: How Lpez Obrador Can Turn His Victory Into Mexicos Triumph
description: MEXICO CITY  The third time is the one that counts is a famous Mexican saying that Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador repeated often during his recent presidential campaign. Those words carried him to win with 53 percent of the vote, according to a quick count carried out by the National Electoral Institute.

title: In Zimbabwe, the Enduring Fear of Single Women
description: When Zimbabwe holds  general elections on July 30, its first after the ouster of Robert Mugabe in November, only four of the 23 presidential candidates will be women. The opposition to President Emmerson Mnangagwa is marred by infighting between two factions within the leading opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change-Tsvangirai, which was founded and led by the former prime minister and trade union leader Morgan Richard Tsvangirai until his death from cancer in February.

title: Conservatives, Dont Put Too Much Hope in the Next Justice
description: Late in his life, Justice Antonin Scalia of the Supreme Court sighed wistfully to an interviewer that his victories were damn few. He was right. While Justice Scalia was best known for his originalism and textualism, the most distinctively conservative feature of his jurisprudence was to accord great weight in adjudication to longstanding customs and traditional social practices. That approach has had at best limited influence in the many cases decided by the Supreme Court involving hotly contested cultural issues like same-sex marriage and abortion rights.

title: Give Your Seltzer a Refresh
description: This summer Ive seen a proliferation of seasoning syrups for drinks, in fruit and floral flavors. Some new nonalcoholic ones that tickled my taste buds are from W&P. Called Spritz Syrups, theyre for a glass of bubbly, a carbonated cocktail or a mocktail. They come in elderflower, fragrant with an intriguing note of bitterness; grapefruit, properly citric and mellowed with honey; and Italian, for that Negroni variation, scented with orange, lemon and spices. Instructions suggest using half an ounce (a tablespoon) in a drink.

title: Light as Air and Filled With Flavor
description: Undaunted by naysayers who insisted that it was impossible to make a meringue with a filling, Maria Umana began fashioning them two years ago in McLean, Va. Her Sweet Whispers are crisp, yet airy little cookies with key lime, passion fruit, blackberry or raspberry preserves tucked inside; more flavors are on the way. Theyre excellent to serve with summer fruit desserts.

title: Add Fire to Your Fourth of July Cocktail
description: Do not be fooled by the alluring touch of tropical fruit sweetness in Ming River Baijiu, a Chinese spirit now sold in the United States. There is fire in this drink. Baijiu, which is the worlds best-selling alcohol by volume, is made from sorghum and produced in traditional pot stills around China. Ming River is made in Sichuan Province. Baijiu is starting to show up more frequently in cocktails, so you may as well add a bottle to the home bar. Try it with tonic and lime, or with a splash of grapefruit liqueur.

title: Farm to Cheese Board
description: Too many cooks? Hardly. Teamwork has led to a commendable new cheese: Bone Char Square, initially developed by the chef Dan Barber to serve at Blue Hill at Stone Barns. The cow and goat milks for the cheese come from Old Chatham Sheepherding Company, the resulting cheese is aged at Crown Finish Caves in Brooklyn and Saxelby Cheesemongers is making it available. The ash covering each square is from the carbonization of bones used at Blue Hill for making stock. The cheese has a satiny texture, an earthy bouquet and a mild flavor with a distinctive goaty aftertaste.

title: Review: An Operatic Locavore Consumes the English Countryside
description: LEWES, England  Stefan Herheim sets his new production of Debussys Pellas et Mlisande, which opened at the Glyndebourne festival on Saturday and runs through Aug. 8, in a location startlingly close by: a room in the countryside manor house here where the festival takes place.

title: Venice, Without the Tourists
description: Taste the flavors of Venice at home, with the help of an alluring new cookbook. The author Skye McAlpine shares pantry tips and guides you through dishes that exploit the sea, the market and the nearby fields. Simple pastas dressed with vegetables, fennel au gratin, typically soupy risottos, a zucchini and mint frittata, and peaches in amaretto syrup are some standouts, and her fig-and-mascarpone cake, and pine nut-and-custard tart are first-rate. The author has lived in Venice almost all her life and throughout the book she gives you an idea of what thats all about: Buy only what you can carry because you do not have a car, something New Yorkers also appreciate.

title: A Simple Way to Settle a Great Debate
description: Like clam chowder, lobster rolls come with regional allegiances. The Maine style requires a mayonnaise-based salad; Connecticut prefers chunks of lobster basted with melted butter. Both are sold ($19 each) at the summertime lobster cart stationed outside Oceana restaurant in Midtown. Bill Telepan, the executive chef, infuses his melted butter and mayonnaise with the flavor from the lobster shells. But Id say that for taste, the Connecticut entry edges out my usual favorite with mayonnaise. The stand also sells a lobster salad ($25), lemonade, chips and chocolate cookies, along with iced tea and iced coffee.

title: Michael Cohen Hints at Cooperating With Federal Investigators. Or Does He?
description: When Michael D. Cohen, President Trumps longtime personal fixer, sat down with Good Morning America for his first interview since federal agents raided his office in April, he said it was a step toward reaching his ultimate goal of resolution.

title: How Many Teenage Girls Deliberately Harm Themselves? Nearly 1 in 4, Survey Finds.
description: Up to 30 percent of teenage girls in some parts of the United States say they have intentionally injured themselves without aiming to commit suicide, researchers have found.

title: Christian Dior: Fall 2018
description: The fall 2018 couture collection.

title: Giant Hogweed: A Plant That Can Burn and Blind You. But Dont Panic.
description: The nasty effects of touching a giant hogweed  its sap can scar, burn and blind if you come in contact with it  have inspired frightening headlines after the recent discovery of the first confirmed population of the plant in Virginia.

title: Serena Williams Solves the Wimbledon Wind; Sloane Stephens Does Not
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Returning to Wimbledon should evoke happy memories for Serena Williams, a seven-time champion here.

title: Tesla Achieves a Key Weekly Goal for Producing Its Model 3
description: Tesla says it has reached a manufacturing milestone, producing more than 5,000 Model 3 sedans in a week. Now the electric-car maker must prove its not a one-time achievement.

title: Harvey Weinstein Faces New Sex Assault Charges in Manhattan
description: The movie producer Harvey Weinstein, already accused by prosecutors of sexually assaulting two women in Manhattan, has been indicted on additional charges that he forced a third woman to have sex with him. One of the new charges, predatory sexual assault, carries a maximum sentence of life in prison.

title: Review: Conflict Reaches Across the Decades and the Aisle
description: Heres a fairy tale for a partisan age. Once upon a time there was a beautiful conservative princess. One day she met a liberal. She went to his rally and then to his room. She followed her heart. She changed her party.

title: World Cup 2018: Belgium Shocks Japan With Stunning Rally
description: ROSTOV-ON-DON, Russia  Belgium arrived at the World Cup as dark horses, bringing both a roster bulging with talent and question marks about its mental toughness. Could this be the group to power through the knockout rounds and avoid falling by the wayside like the talented yet ultimately doomed Belgian teams of past World Cups?

title: God Bless America: 100 Years of an Immigrants Anthem
description: The 5-year-old and his family had traveled thousands of miles to escape. When they finally arrived on American soil, free from the marauders who had burned their house to the ground, the boy was placed in a holding pen with his brother and sisters, while immigration officials decided their fate.

title: In Baby Teeth, Links Between Chemical Exposure in Pregnancy and Autism
description: If you are a parent worrying through pregnancy, or maybe trying to make sense of your childs neurodevelopmental problems, you arent always glad to see another story about a new study looking at possible environmental risk factors. From pesticides in the food to phthalates in the plastics to pollutant particles in the air, so many different exposures have been linked to problems in the developing fetal brain that parents can sometimes feel both bewildered and, inevitably, at fault for failing or having failed to take all possible precautions.

title: Lyft Follows Uber Into Bike-Sharing Lane, Buying Owner of CitiBike
description: Lyft competes with Uber for ride-hailing customers. Now it is following its rival into bike-sharing, as the companies move to diversify the kinds of transportation services they offer.

title: Soccer Team Is Found Alive in Thailand Cave Rescue
description: MAE SAI, Thailand  The scrawny boys were huddled on the floor of the cave when the British divers emerged from the murky water.

title: A Sleeping Beauty Hopes Hibernation Is the Answer to All Lifes Problems
description: The unnamed heroine of Ottessa Moshfeghs new novel, My Year of Rest and Relaxation, is a kind of brand ambassador for ennui. She is tall and thin and blond and pretty and young (her own words) and dislikes nearly everyone and everything, as if she has rolled a condom onto her heart.

title: The Online Gene Test Finds a Dangerous Mutation. It May Well Be Wrong.
description: Dr. Joshua Clayton, a 29-year-old radiology resident at Baylor University Medical Center in Dallas, wanted to learn about his ancestry. So he sent a sample of his saliva to 23andMe, the genetic testing company.

title: Review: 9 Brave Students and the Shame of Little Rock
description: The headlines whisk us into the painful past, before the performance even begins. With white lettering on a black background, as if were looking at old news clippings on microfiche, theyre projected huge on the set at the Sheen Center: a facade of Little Rock Central High School.

title: In Los Angeles, Where the Rich and the Destitute Cross Paths
description: As homelessness has exploded, the haves and the have-nots meet on streets, at beaches and in libraries, challenging a citys sense of itself.

title: Ask Yourself This: What Burdens Is That Other Person Carrying?
description: I was in the airport when I found out that the mother of one of my best friends had just died quite suddenly. She was at dinner with a friend, felt sick and was dead within a few hours.

title: Jacqueline Kennedys Notes for Dallas Are Found, Starting a Quiet Tug of War
description: Many people fantasize about a valuable piece of history emerging unexpectedly out of a trunk. For Gil Wells, something like that happened in the summer of 2015.

title: A Vows Feature Spoiled a Comic Book Ending, and You Werent Happy
description: What responsibility, if any, do journalists have not to spoil plots for our readers? What is the role of a headline or news alert for a story that contains such a secret?A Vows feature this past weekend by George Gene Gustines, a senior editor at The Times who writes about the comic book industry, gave away the climax of a nearly 80-year-old relationship between Batman and Catwoman, days before the latest issue of the Batman series goes on sale. The plot twist is contained in issue No. 50 of Batman, published by DC Entertainment and set to go on sale at 12:01 a.m. July 4. (Read the feature here, but beware: The headline includes the spoiler.)

title: Drakes Scorpion Is a Streaming Giant
description: If there was any doubt before, it is now official: Drake is the king of streaming music.

title: Review: A Tour Through the Hyperactive World of John Zorn
description: When looking at John Zorns hyperactive release schedule on Tzadik, the record label he runs, its easy to feel overwhelmed.

title: Ralph & Russo: Fall 2018
description: The fall 2018 couture collection.

title: For the First Time, Drake Runs From His Feelings
description: Drake breaks character only once on his new 25-song, 90-minute double album Scorpion. It comes on the last track, March 14, which addresses at length the fact that the 31-year-old superstar is now a father.

title: Another Delay at the Airport: Snacks
description: When I was standing in the security line three weeks ago at Newark Liberty International Airport en route to Paris, I heard two Transportation Security Administration officers ask passengers to remove any food from their carry-ons and place it in a bin. Its a new policy, one officer said. Anything edible must now be screened separately.

title: Where to Go for South Jersey Berries
description: Here are some small farms to visit in South Jersey, where blueberries are generally in season until the end of July. For other farms, search visitnjfarms.org.

title: In the Shadow of the Blueberry Titans, Smaller Growers Thrive
description: HAMMONTON, N.J.  Jeanne Lindsay often apologizes for the semi-wild state of her pick-your-own blueberry patch, which she runs on the farm her in-laws started in 1941.

title: U.S. Softens Demand That Countries Stop All Iran Oil Imports
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration is softening its earlier  demand that countries like China, India and Turkey end all imports of Iranian oil by Nov. 4, as a top State Department official on Monday said the United States would allow reduced oil flows, in certain cases.

title: Things to Consider in Picking a Supreme Court Justice
description: To the Editor:

title: Can Airport Workers Pull Out of a Financial Nosedive?
description: You could say America is heading toward a poverty-based economy. Less-skilled workers are paid as little as employers can get away with, so the products and services they produce will be as inexpensive as possible, so other insufficiently paid workers can afford them.

title: The Value of Older Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: The Opium War and the Humiliation of China
description: IMPERIAL TWILIGHT The Opium War and the End of Chinas Last Golden Age By Stephen R. Platt Illustrated. 556 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $35.

title: Facebook Isnt Silicon Valleys Only Problem
description: Over the past several months, there has been an onslaught of alarming news about Facebooks collection and sharing of users personal data. The resulting public scrutiny of Facebook is well deserved. But as we scramble to understand the societal harms caused by one Silicon Valley behemoth, we mustnt turn a blind eye to those instigated by the rest of the technology industry.

title: Funeral Parties
description: To the Editor:

title: Wynton Marsalis Provokes Again With Head-Scratching Ever Fonky Lowdown
description: Welcome to The Month in Live Jazz, a column highlighting three standout performances from the past month on stages across New York City.

title: Bomb Rattles an Afghan Minority So Small No One Is a Stranger
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In downtown Kabul, from a large mural painted on blast walls at the end of a busy shopping street, the piercing eyes of Komal Singh, now a fourth grader, peer out at the narrow junction.

title: Couple Is Charged in Plot to Bomb Iranian Opposition Rally in France
description: PARIS  A Belgian husband and wife of Iranian origin have been charged with plotting to bomb a rally held last week in France by an exiled Iranian opposition group, the Belgian authorities said on Monday.

title: Man Arrested in Cleveland Terror Plot After F.B.I. Sting
description: An Ohio man who had expressed support for Al Qaeda and a desire to kill American soldiers and told an undercover agent that he wanted to attack a Fourth of July parade in Cleveland was arrested on Sunday, the authorities said.

title: This Tweet Captures the State of Health Care in America Today
description: A nightmarish accident on a Boston subway platform on Friday  described in gory detail by a local reporter, Maria Cramer, as it unfolded and quickly retweeted by thousands is one you might expect to see in an impoverished country.

description: Penn & Teller: Fool UsWhen to watch: Monday at 8 p.m., on the CW.

title: What Do I Owe My Sociopathic Sibling?
description: My sibling, who is my only living relative, is currently incarcerated. The crimes committed were quite serious, involving major breaches of trust but not violence.

title: When Sports Betting Is Legal, the Value of Game Data Soars
description: Every weekend during soccer season in Britain, security personnel find them in stadiums, tapping furiously at their phones or talking nonstop into a mic  mysterious customers often wearing hoodies to conceal earpieces and their identity. While focused with unwavering intensity on the action of the game, they show none of the engagement and excitement of the ordinary fans around them.

title: Man Who Waved Gun and Yelled Womp Womp Arrested at Immigration Rally
description: An Alabama man who yelled womp womp and waved a gun at people protesting the separation of migrant families appeared in court on Monday on charges of reckless endangerment and menacing, officials said.

title: Malta Cracks Down on a Humanitarian Ship That Carried Migrants
description: ROME  On Monday, it was Maltas turn to get tough on immigration in Europe.

title: Youth Soccer Team Found in Cave in Thailand
description: The 12 boys and their coach had been trapped in a flooded cave for more than a week.

title: She Was Declared Dead and Moved to the Morgue. Then She Was Heard Breathing.
description: CAPE TOWN  At the scene of a recent car wreck on a dark South African road, an ambulance crew found a woman with severe injuries and no sign of a pulse or breath, and they pronounced her dead. She was taken to a mortuary and placed in one of the refrigerators  until several hours later, when someone noticed that she was breathing.

title: Russia Relaxes, for a Moment, to Let Soccer Fans Rejoice
description: MOSCOW  Under normal circumstances, a single Muscovite can hold a sign on a sidewalk without a parade permit. But if another person turns up, it becomes an illegal gathering and the police can make arrests.

title: Giambattista Valli: Fall 2018
description: The fall 2018 couture collection.

title: Fires Ravage Western U.S.
description: Thousands of acres have been destroyed and hundreds of people have evacuated after fast-moving wildfires tore through California, Colorado, New Mexico and Utah.

title: After Capital Gazette Shooting, Readers Reflect on Their Community Newspapers
description: Newspapers in small towns across America are fighting to remain profitable and relevant in the digital age. Their valor took center stage last week, when news broke Thursday of the mass shooting at the Capital Gazette in Annapolis, Md.

title: Trump Warns NATO Allies to Spend More on Defense, or Else
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has written sharply worded letters to the leaders of several NATO allies  including Germany, Belgium, Norway and Canada  taking them to task for spending too little on their own defense and warning that the United States is losing patience with what he said was their failure to meet security obligations shared by the alliance.

title: ABC Parts Ways With Investigative Reporter Brian Ross
description: Brian Ross, the chief investigative correspondent for ABC News, is leaving the network seven months after he botched a report involving President Trump and the Russia investigation, a mistake that led to a rebuke from the White House and concern about self-inflicted damage by news organizations already facing scrutiny.

title: Coffee Drinkers May Live Longer
description: Drinking coffee is associated with lower mortality rates, and a new study suggests that caffeine is not responsible for the effect.

title: Cold Books for Hot Days
description: Its hot out there, especially if you live in the Midwest or on the East Coast, both sizzling through an epic summer heat wave. So stay in the air conditioning, keep yourself hydrated and  if you can  cool down with one of these books, which are all set in extremely cold places. Who knows  reading about blizzards, snow drifts, howling Arctic winds and sleet storms might be even more bracing than a dip in the pool or a glass of iced tea.
