description: Dear Diary:

title: Trooper Is Killed Answering Call to Home of School Principal
description: The principal of a rural school shot and killed a New York State trooper who had been summoned to the mans home by a 911 call early Monday morning, the authorities said.

title: Annapolis Shooting Suspect Wanted to Kill Every Person in Newsroom, Letter States
description: The man suspected of fatally shooting five people in an Annapolis newsroom last week sent a letter to the Capital Gazettes lawyer announcing that he planned to go there with the objective of killing every person present, a copy of the letter shows.

title: Paris Beckons as a Fare War Turns Europe Into a Bargain
description: Forget Yellowstone. Right now, you can buy a ticket to travel from New York to Paris in August  on a major American airline  for under $500.

title: Review: Sorry to Bother You, but Can I Interest You in a Wild Dystopian Satire?
description: Stick to the script. Thats the first rule at the telemarketing firm where Cassius Green, an Oakland striver-slash-stoner, finds a job. Sales reps are supposed to start with Sorry to Bother You, which is the title of Boots Rileys movie about Cassiuss rise, fall and bizarre sideways bounces. Mr. Riley is not sorry at all. If youre not bothered  also tickled, irked, mystified and provoked  then youve fallen asleep on the job.

title: The New Normal: Wildfires Roar Across the West, Again
description: GUINDA, Calif.  As a roaring fire engulfed the hillside above him, Capt. Mark Bailey leaned on his shovel and guarded against embers leaping to the unburned side of the road above this small Northern California town. Weve got a lot of work to do, he said on Monday.

title: A 50-Year-Old Japanese Baseball Record Unites Two American Pitchers
description: Pitching has long been the pride of Japanese baseball. It is the only skill recognized with an annual award that predates its American counterpart. The Sawamura Award was first bestowed on Japans best pitcher in 1947, nine years before Don Newcombe of the Brooklyn Dodgers won the first Cy Young Award.

title: Brawl Mars FIBA Qualifier Between the Philippines and Australia
description: It was not quite The Malice at the Palace, but a brawl at a FIBA World Cup qualifier game on Monday was one of the crazier scenes in recent basketball history, with haymaker punches and folding chairs thrown, wild kicks attempted, and 13 players eventually being ejected.

title: Trumps Taking Us From Temper Tantrum to Trade War
description: In one way, Donald Trumps attack on our foreign trade partners resembles his attack on immigrants: in each case, the attack is framed as a response to evildoing that exists only in his imagination. No, there isnt a wave of violent crime by immigrants, and MS-13 isnt taking over American towns; no, the European Union doesnt have horrific tariffs on U.S. products (the average tariff is only 3 percent).

title: Mexicos President-Elect on Trump
description: Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador, who was elected in a landslide on Sunday, has sharply criticized the Trump administrations policies on immigration and trade.

title: The New President of Mexico
description: Trump considers his new neighbor.

title: Mexico Delivers Another Defeat to the Status Quo in Latin America
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexicos presidential election, which has brought the party that governed the country for more than 70 years to the point of ruin, was the latest in a string of blistering defeats for incumbent parties across Latin America.

title: What Will It Cost to Fix New Yorks Public Housing?
description: The New York City Housing Authority is responsible for maintaining tens of thousands of apartments, which house one in 14 New Yorkers. But its 2,413 buildings are on average more than 60 years old, and they are plagued with leaky roofs, mold, broken elevators and faulty heating systems.

title: Lawyers for Neo-Nazi to Defend Alex Jones in Sandy Hook Case
description: Alex Jones, an online conspiracy theorist who claims the Sandy Hook massacre that killed 20 children and six adults was a hoax, has hired lawyers representing a founder of the neo-Nazi Daily Stormer website to defend him against defamation claims brought in Connecticut by families of seven Sandy Hook victims.

title: Gillian Lynne, Choreographer of Cats, Is Dead at 92
description: Gillian Lynne, a renowned British ballerina who, after turning to choreography, created the sinuous dances in Andrew Lloyd Webbers Cats, which became the longest-running musical in Londons West End and on Broadway, died on Sunday in London. She was 92.

title: The Gender War Is On! And Fake
description: Years ago, people used to believe that gender equality would produce gender similarity. That is to say, people used to believe that as women and men enjoyed more equal opportunities and earned similar pay, men and women would see the world in similar ways.

title: Facebook Faces Broadened Federal Investigations Over Data and Privacy
description: WASHINGTON  Facebook said on Monday that it faced an expansion of federal investigations into its sharing of user data with the political consulting firm Cambridge Analytica, with more government agencies inquiring about the matter and examining the social networks statements about the episode.

title: 3-Year-Old Dies After Mass Stabbing at Her Birthday Party, Authorities Say
description: A 3-year-old girl who was among nine people stabbed at her birthday party in Idaho over the weekend has died from her injuries, the police said on Monday.

title: Trump and Mexicos New Leader, Both Headstrong, Begin With a Good Conversation
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump reached out to Mexicos new populist president-elect on Monday in an early, but potentially short-lived, show of dtente, saying the two leaders engaged in a good conversation about border security and the North American Free Trade Agreement.

title: Court Blocks Trump Administration From Blanket Detention of Asylum Seekers
description: In another blow to the Trump administrations policies on immigration, a federal court on Monday blocked the systematic detention of migrants who have shown credible evidence that they were fleeing persecution in their home countries.

title: Former E.P.A. Aide Says Pruitt Asked Her to Help Find Work for His Wife
description: WASHINGTON  Samantha Dravis, the former policy chief at the Environmental Protection Agency, told a congressional committee that Scott Pruitt, the administrator, asked her to help find his wife a job as a fund-raiser at the Republican Attorneys General Association, according to two people familiar with the interview.

title: Quotation of the Day: Mexican Vote Is Latest Rejection of the Status Quo in Latin America
description: There is a desperate search for someone who vows to do the right thing, and people are electing leaders who show up waving a magic wand.

title: A Netflix Experiment Gives Deserving Comics Their 15 Minutes
description: So many stand-up specials are released these days that its easy to miss how radically the art form has evolved.

title: A New Path in Mexico
description: One hopes that Mexicos elimination by Brazil from the World Cup soccer tournament on the day after he was elected president will not prove to be a bad omen for Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador, the leftist who rode a wave of popular outrage over Mexicos corruption and violence to a landslide victory. But the prospects of a populist who makes as many promises as AMLO, as the president-elect is commonly known, are even harder to predict than a tournament as filled with surprises as this World Cup.

title: Women Might Save America Yet
description: Erin Gabriel was already pretty busy before Donald Trump was elected president. All three of her children are autistic, and her youngest, an 8-year-old girl named Abby, is also deaf, blind and nonverbal, and suffers from seizures. She has like 17 specialists, Gabriel, 39, told me. She does multiple therapies every week. Gabriels husband is a pilot, and until a few years ago he had a job that took him away from home as many as 20 days a month.

title: Corrections: July 3, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: DeMarcus Cousins Gives the Warriors a Fifth All-Star
description: The Los Angeles Lakers LeBron James honeymoon lasted only one day  thanks to the Golden State Warriors.

title: Baseball, Colloquially
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Its the height of baseball season, and I know this primarily because the Resident South African has all of the televisions, radios and available device screens tuned to sports channels at all times. All except for my work laptop, which I keep locked and hidden away, so that I dont accidentally publish the New York Yankees scores instead of a crossword column.

title: 52 Places to Go: Iceland
description: Visit Iceland in virtual reality with The New York Times 52 Places Traveler, Jada Yuan, and the Frugal Traveler Lucas Peterson, as they tour the countrys breathtaking landscapes and bond over the joys, and difficulties, of solo traveling.

title: White House Twitter Account, in Rare Broadside, Attacks 2 Democratic Senators Over ICE
description: WASHINGTON  The White House used its official Twitter account on Monday to attack two Democratic senators who oppose President Trumps immigration agenda, falsely equating their criticisms of Immigration and Customs Enforcement with support for criminals and murderous gangs.

title: Archbishop Philip Wilson Is Sentenced for Sexual Abuse Cover-Up in Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The highest-ranking Catholic official to have been found guilty of concealing sexual crimes against children was sentenced to 12 months in detention by an Australian court on Tuesday.

title: Fly Ball Escapes Aaron Judges Glove, and a Win Eludes the Yankees
description: If the Yankees and the Atlanta Braves managed to keep their current form, it would not be entirely surprising for those two teams to find themselves battling for a World Series title this October.

title: Move Over, Lenin: Make Room for the Computer Keyboard
description: YEKATERINBURG, Russia  Strolling around the center of town before the Senegal-Japan World Cup match last week, Ilya Panasenko, 25, an accountant from Moscow, was startled to come across a massive qwerty keyboard resting by the side of the Iset River.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: The Comedy Lineup and The Purge
description: A new Netflix series features up-and-coming comics. And two films in the Purge franchise are on FX.

title: The Political Earthquake About to Hit Germany
description: The next few weeks may well bring the biggest political earthquake to hit Germany in a generation: the collapse of the center-right coalition between the Christian Democrats and their sister party in Bavaria, the Christian Social Union. What seems to be a minor disagreement over asylum law between Chancellor Angela Merkel of the Christian Democrats and Horst Seehofer, the interior minister and head of the C.S.U., in fact exposes a growing rift between a national party trying to hold down the center and a powerful regional party drifting to the right.

title: During the World Cup, Read These 3 Books About Soccer
description: As the World Cup moves on to the next stage of the competition, here are three books that explore the history of soccer and what it means to players and fans.

title: How Britain Went to War With China Over Opium
description: HONG KONG  In 1840, Britain went to war with China over questions of trade, diplomacy, national dignity and, most importantly, drug trafficking. While British officials tried to play down the illicit origins of the conflict, opponents gave it a name that made the link quite clear: the Opium War.

title: Susan Meiselas: Breaching Boundaries in Photography
description: Susan Meiselas, who joined Magnum Photos in 1976, is also the president and co-founder of the Magnum Foundation.  Born in 1948 and starting as a teacher in the South Bronx, she went on to produce a definitive chronicle of Nicaraguas Sandinista revolution. More recently, she has led the foundations efforts to nurture a new, diverse generation of photographers. Her books include Carnival Strippers, Nicaragua, and Prince Street Girls. In the last year, she has also been the subject of two books, Susan Meiselas: Mediations (Damiani) and Susan Meiselas: On the Frontline (Thames & Hudson). She spoke with James Estrin about her career. The conversation has been edited for clarity and length.

title: Shirley Manson: The First Time I Cut Myself
description: I didnt know I was a cutter until the first time I chose to cut. I didnt even know it was a thing.

title: 9 Toys That Keep Kids Learning
description: What can you do to help your kids play happily this summer while still learning and building skills?

title: Dead of AIDS and Forgotten in Potters Field
description: The bodies reached Hart Island on a ferry like all the others, in spare wooden boxes and bound for ignominious mass interment off the coast of the Bronx where New York City buries its unclaimed dead by the hundreds in long, shallow trenches.

title: French and Swiss Museums to Share a Czanne With a Murky Past
description: The family of Paul Czanne and the museum in Switzerland that holds the controversial art collection of Cornelius Gurlitt have settled a dispute over the ownership of a majestic landscape by the artist, Montagne Sainte-Victoire, painted in 1897.

title: A Lemony Breakfast Cake That Tastes Like a Roman Holiday
description: The recipe for the cake that knocked me off my breakfast routine is the one that got away. I should have tried to wangle it after the first time I had it. Or the second. Or the third. But I didnt. I probably didnt think Id miss it. Or maybe I just wasnt thinking. A long weekend in Rome can give you that domani feeling. Nothing seemed urgent there.

title: Summers Most Style-Savvy Movie Is a Cartoon
description: Forget Edna Mode  that is, if you can.

title: Cynthia Nixon. Parent. Activist. Governor?
description: It was the fall of 2001 and Sex and the City was a hit on HBO, when Cynthia Nixon went to her first education rally. Her oldest child was starting kindergarten at a public school in Manhattan, and  she saw how budget cuts were affecting the school. She protested, lobbied legislators in Albany, and went on a statewide bus tour to talk about the need for more money.

title: The Terms on a Food Label to Ignore, and the Ones to Watch For
description: If your head starts spinning when trying to make healthy and budget-friendly food choices, youre not alone. Take a look around your local grocery store and youll find a slew of confusing terms. Organic. Non-G.M.O. Low-sugar. Superfood.

title: How to Throw Out a Ceremonial First Pitch
description: If you wish to avoid chagrin, practice, says John Thorn, the official historian of Major League Baseball. Two decades ago, Thorn was invited to throw out a first pitch at a minor-league game. The ball bounced before reaching the catcher. It was the mound that got me, says Thorn, who still finds himself mentally replaying that one ungainly lob. If youve never thrown off a mound, dont: The elevation will mess up your aim. Instead, stand in front of it, which also shortens the distance to home plate from 60 feet 6 inches to around 50 feet, increasing the odds that your ball will make it to the catcher.

title: Horse and Writer: What to Read to a Recuperating Pet
description: Dear Match Book,

title: When Health Insurance Prices Rose Last Year, Around a Million Americans Dropped Coverage
description: Last year, as insurance prices rose by an average of just over 20 percent around the country, people who qualified for Obamacare subsidies hung onto their insurance. But the increases appear to have been too much to bear for many customers who earned too much to qualify for financial help.

title: Letter of Recommendation: The Totally Football Show With James Richardson
description: Now that the World Cup in Russia is more than half over and the prospect of waiting another four years for the tournament to come round again is stretching out ahead of me like a Siberian steppe, I have begun to feel pre-emptive nostalgia for the games that remain. On the one hand, I badly want to know how this story will end. On the other, I want to go on enjoying the tingling suspense, the anxious happiness, of not knowing.

title: The Big Business of Becoming Bhad Bhabie
description: Adam Kluger had a plan to save music. It was 2008: Piracy was up, streaming hadnt taken off and the physical album had long been eclipsed by the digital single. On top of that, it was the middle of the recession; industry people were looking for ways to make up their losses. Kluger was a fast-talking 22-year-old in Los Angeles with a dream of a product he called brand dropping. Rappers were constantly name-checking products  why not get the brands to pay for placement in a verse?

title: The 52 Places Traveler: On an Icelandic Road Trip, Mossy Moonscapes and More
description: Our columnist, Jada Yuan, is visiting each destination on our 52 Places to Go in 2018 list. This dispatch brings her to Iceland, where she shared a car and a column with Lucas Peterson, our Frugal Traveler columnist; it took the No. 34 spot on the list and is the 20th stop on Jadas itinerary.

title: The Woman Whose Hair Frightens Iran
description: THE WIND IN MY HAIR My Fight for Freedom in Modern Iran By Masih Alinejad Illustrated. 400 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $28

title: Cruises Are So Uncool They Are Cool
description: Its the final day of this seven-night cruise and I am sitting in my moderately messy balcony stateroom aboard the Celebrity Summit finishing the last bites of a room service cheeseburger, bags as yet unpacked for tomorrow mornings disembarkation, the vast undulating North Atlantic just over my starboard shoulder.

title: New & Noteworthy
description: A CARNIVAL OF LOSSES By Donald Hall. (Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, $25.) Hall, who died on June 23, left behind a rich collection of poetry that earned him a National Medal of the Arts and a term as poet laureate of the United States. In his last memoir, he writes of life as he approached 90, with all its joys (like solitude or the ability to speak ones mind fully) and its losses (like the death of his wife, the poet Jane Kenyon). THE BATTLE FOR PARADISE By Naomi Klein. (Haymarket, paper, $9.95.) Hurricane Maria left more than destruction in its wake. There is now a brewing political conflict over how to rebuild Puerto Rico, the subject of Kleins investigation in this slim book. On one side are what she calls the disaster capitalists looking for a profit, and on the other, local communities. THE WILLIAM H. GASS READER By William H. Gass. (Knopf, $40.) A doorstop that celebrates the life of the experimental writer, this collection brings together over 50 examples of Gasss work  essays, criticism, short stories and novels. All heady and mysterious. TRANS LIKE ME By CN Lester. (Seal Press, paper, $16.99.) A British transgender rights activist and singer-songwriter, Lester uses these witty essays to help undermine some persistent myths. For example, Lester finds a long history of the use of they to describe a person who doesnt fit into one gender or another, with examples dating to Shakespeare and Jane Austen. LACKS SELF-CONTROL By Roy Sekoff. (Big A, $25.) Sekoff was the founding editor of The Huffington Post and here writes of a life of mischief and high jinks, from a teenage visit to a Times Square porn store to his attempt to nab a tissue containing Oprahs tears.

title: An ICE Raid Leaves an Iowa Town Divided Along Faith Lines
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, Iowa  In the days after immigration agents raided a dusty concrete plant on the west side of town, seizing 32 men from Mexico and Central America, the Rev. Trey Hegar, pastor of the First Presbyterian Church, got into an impassioned argument on his Facebook page.

title: Amid Growing Uproar, Poland to Remove 27 Supreme Court Justices
description: WARSAW  First Polands governing party labeled her and her fellow judges communists and obstructionists. Next it took control of the Constitutional Tribunal, which reviews the constitutionality of legislation. Then it co-opted the body responsible for selecting new judges.

description: For a designer and an actor with a modern house in California, a second home had to be the opposite: a creaky stone house with a sense of history.

title: In the Hudson Valley, a Home With Centuries Worth of Stories
description: Most of the time, Jeffrey Doornbos and Caroline Diani live in a breezy, low-slung 1950s house in Santa Barbara, Calif. So when they began looking for a second home on the East Coast, they wanted something entirely different  a creaky stone farmhouse with a weighty sense of history.

title: Malaysias Ex-Leader, Najib Razak, Is Charged in Corruption Inquiry
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  Najib Razak, the former prime minister of Malaysia who was ousted in an election two months ago, was charged by anticorruption officials on Wednesday, after his arrest in an investigation involving billions of dollars diverted from a state investment fund.

description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines  and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

title: 9 Reads Almost as Satisfying as Taking a Vacation
description: Summer is the season of wanderlust. Even if youre sprawled on a beach towel under the sun and near a body of water, were willing to wager that for the shortest moment, youve had thoughts of icicles and cooling northern winds  or, at least, of an air-conditioned room. Here, weve rounded up some of Ts most transportive stories for those who need a break from their surroundings, or from the news cycle.

title: How to Detox Your Scalp for Healthier Hair
description: At his Paris salon, the French colorist Christophe Robin spends a lot of time examining his clients roots, and has observed a universal truth: Healthy hair, he says, starts with a healthy scalp. But this often overlooked zone is a prime spot for buildup  from styling products, natural oils and sweat  which can suffocate the follicle, says Robin, and lead to dull, flat hair and breakage. A solution embraced by many experts is the scalp detox.

title: Jersey City Makes a Statement With Fireworks Over the Hudson
description: JERSEY CITY  Sometime around sunset on July 4, the national anthem will start to play, setting off a carefully choreographed fireworks display above the Hudson River. The production clocks in at 20 minutes and 30 seconds (give or take a few seconds) and includes thousands of individual fireworks launching from barges on the river.

title: Trump Orders Flags to Half-Staff for Capital Gazette Victims, in Apparent Reversal
description: President Trump on Tuesday ordered the American flag to be lowered to half-staff to honor the victims of last weeks mass shooting at the Capital Gazette newsroom in Annapolis, Md.

title: A Watchers Guide to the New York City Fireworks
description: See how 75,000 shells become the nations largest Fourth of July display.

title: A Choreographer Unafraid of Masterpieces Takes on T.S. Eliot
description: First Bach, now T. S. Eliot. Pam Tanowitz has developed a habit: choreographing to masterpieces.

title: Review: Man-Made and Natural Music Merge on a Steamy Sunday
description: KATONAH, N.Y.  Sunday afternoon was steamy, with temperatures in the 90s and thick humidity. But that didnt deter 60 intrepid percussionists and about 700 curious music lovers from attending a free performance of John Luther Adamss outdoor work Inuksuit at Caramoor, the summer music festival here.

title: Can a Stronger Congress Check the Supreme Court?
description: As we await President Trumps nomination to replace Justice Anthony Kennedy on the Supreme Court, it is worth reflecting on the unique role that Justice Kennedy played in American life.

title: New York Times Reassigns Reporter in Leak Case
description: Ali Watkins, the New York Times reporter whose email and phone records were secretly seized by the Trump administration, will be transferred out of the newspapers Washington bureau and reassigned to a new beat in New York, The Times said on Tuesday.

title: What to Do on the 4th of July in N.Y.C.
description: Happy Fourth of July! If you are already out of town, thanks for still reading this. But if you are in the city with no plans, here we are!

title: With a Sniff and a Signal, These Dogs Hunt Down Threats to Bees
description: JARRETTSVILLE, Md.  Cybil Preston stretched her bare hands into a noisy beehive and pulled out a frame of honeycomb, its waxy cells filled with nectar, its surface alive with bees.

title: The World Cups Hot New Accessory Comes With a Few Questions
description: MOSCOW  The must-have accessory at the 2018 World Cup is a passport-sized badge of honor that, for many fans, symbolizes the fulfillment of a lifetimes ambition.

title: Lets Reconnect With Our Streets
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Not too many years ago, I was having dinner with my in-laws in Orange County, Calif. My mother-in-law was complaining about her new neighbors, an all-too-common pastime for any resident of a gated community with an HOA. The neighbors crime? They let their children play in our cul-de-sac, she lamented. Everyone knows streets are for cars.

title: Trump Officials Reverse Obamas Policy on Affirmative Action in Schools
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration said Tuesday that it was abandoning Obama administration policies that called on universities to consider race as a factor in diversifying their campuses, signaling that the administration will champion race-blind admissions standards.

title: Its Time for a Chemistry Lesson. Put on Your Virtual Reality Goggles.
description: There was a time when biochemists had a lot in common with sculptors. Scientists who had devoted their lives to studying a molecule would building a model, using metal and a forest of rods to hold up the structure of thousands of atoms. Slow work, but at the end you really know the molecule, said Michael Levitt, who shared the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2013.

title: Adam Levines Leather Jacket Was Stolen. Twice.
description: Adam Levine, the lead singer of Maroon 5 and a star coach on The Voice, is the new face of the Yves Saint Laurents new mens fragrance Y. When hes not behind the mic or in front of the camera, the 39-year-old swears that his day-to-day look in Los Angeles is all about comfort. Here are some of his favorite items right now.

title: That Other Japanese Embassy, on 52nd Street
description: Since Restaurant Nippon opened 55 years ago, it has introduced many New Yorkers to Japanese cuisine. Today, it still has the power to surprise.

title: The Restaurant That Became Japans Unofficial Ambassador
description: Remember sukiyaki?

title: England Shakes Its Shootout Curse and Saves Its World Cup
description: MOSCOW  Of course it went to penalties. It always goes to penalties.

title: A Tinder Moment, a Gift From OkCupid and a Bumble Officiant
description: Before their wedding last November at a seaside resort outside Ogunquit, Me., Farah and Michael Walsh were finalizing their guest list. Of the 200 people on their A-list of invitees, one name stood out: OkCupid.

title: Dog Afraid of Fireworks? What Dog Owners Say Works for Them
description: BUDAPEST  Is your dog afraid of fireworks?

title: Austria Could Be the Next E.U. Country to Tighten Its Borders
description: BERLIN  Hours after Chancellor Angela Merkels conservative bloc agreed to measures that would tighten Germanys southern border, Austrian leaders announced plans on Tuesday for similar actions that would further threaten Europes system of free movement.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Reality
description: To the Editor:

title: Petra Kvitova, a Wimbledon Favorite, Loses in the First Round
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In pulling off one of the most emphatic upsets of the first round of Wimbledon, Aliaksandra Sasnovich lived out one of her favorite adages about the egalitarian nature of her sport.

title: Israel Penalizes Palestinians for Payments to Prisoners and Martyrs
description: JERUSALEM  Israel will begin withholding funds from the Palestinian Authority to penalize it for paying stipends to Palestinian prisoners in Israel, their families and the families of Palestinians killed or wounded in confrontations with Israelis.

title: Review: In Fireworks, Second Chances, but No Magic
description: Marketed as a project from a producer of Your Name  Japans highest-grossing film of 2016  Fireworks, as anime features go, plays more like a slot-filler than a movie destined to set the sky ablaze. (The movie credits two directors in different capacities: Akiyuki Shinbo as chief director and Nobuyuki Takeuchi as director.) Though the premise is taken from a live-action television film, the story seems well suited to the free-form possibilities of animation. The unrealized potential makes the rote line style and stagnant backdrops seem all the blander.

title: Want to Know More About GLOW Season 2? Heres What to Read
description: The Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling are, to quote AC/DC, back in the ring to take another swing. In the second season of GLOW, which came to Netflix Friday, were back with the thespian-turned-wrestler Ruth Wilder (Alison Brie); her friend-turned-rival, Debbie Eagan (Betty Gilpin); and their curmudgeonly director, Sam Sylvia (Marc Maron), as the league prepares to shoot its first season.

title: Judge Orders Extension of FEMA Aid for Puerto Rican Storm Evacuees
description: MIAMI  The Federal Emergency Management Agency must continue to pay for temporary housing for Puerto Ricans displaced by Hurricane Maria for another 20 days, a federal judge ordered on Tuesday, another short reprieve for hundreds of families who have been unable to return to their homes.

title: Why the World Cup Needs Music
description: This was part of Offsides, a newsletter on the broader issues and hidden stories around the World Cup.

title: Review: On Staten Island, The First Purge Rages
description: Having bypassed the previous three Purge movies  in which, once a year, Americans are free to murder, rape and pillage with impunity  I came to their prequel, The First Purge, with virgin eyes and zero expectations. But even the most ardent fan could find its bluntness uncomfortably timely: In our build-that-wall moment, a story about a government-sponsored plan to cull poor minorities feels less like political satire than current-affairs commentary.

title: In Yellow Submarine, the Graphic Novel, the Blue Meanies Are at It Again
description: Yellow Submarine, the 1968 animated fantasy inspired by the music of the Beatles, is returning to theaters on Sunday for a limited time to celebrate its 50th anniversary. After that milestone comes another: the Aug. 28 release of a Yellow Submarine graphic novel, by the cartoonist Bill Morrison.

title: When Reporting on Mail-In Genetic Testing Comes Home
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: The Best Movies and TV Shows New to Netflix Australia in July
description: Every month, Netflix Australia adds a new batch of movies and TV shows to its library. Here are the titles we think are most interesting for July, broken down by release date. Netflix occasionally changes its schedule without giving notice.

title: Radical Democrats Are Pretty Reasonable
description: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortezs upset primary victory has produced a huge amount of punditry about the supposed radicalization of the Democratic party, how its going to hurt the party because her positions wont sell in the Midwest (and how well would Steve Kings positions sell in the Bronx?), etc., etc.. But I havent seen much about the substance of the policies she advocates, which on economics are mainly Medicare for All and a federal job guarantee.

title: An Outdoor Outpost of Tulum, in Hudson Square
description: Forget those rooftops and consider a densely planted sprawl for that outdoor experience. Most of a 24,000-square-foot Hudson Square lot has been given over to Gitano NYC, a semi-tented Mexican bar and restaurant with tables, sofas and lush greenery that can accommodate 450 diners and drinkers. Its a seasonal, New York version of Gitano in Tulum, Mexico, and in the fall, the founder and co-owner, James Gardner, and his partners plan to move it to some other warm destination. Theres a preliminary menu until next week, when the chef, Yvan Lemoine, will offer a full dinner menu that includes chicken and suckling pig feasts for the table. Mr. Lemoines outdoor kitchen is equipped with wood-fired grills on which he is turning out intriguing grilled avocados and asparagus, and pork belly carnitas. Green ceviche, lettuce wraps with chorizo and the inevitable guacamole are also served, most of them on little wooden boards and in stone bowls. A series of marquee guest chefs, starting with Mads Refslund, formerly at Noma in Copenhagen and Acme in New York, will collaborate on the menus. Soon there will be a clothing boutique, an urban farm and herb garden tended by schoolchildren, and a meditation area with a reflecting pool. The portable bathrooms, the kind usually set up for film divas, are luxurious.

title: Jupiter & Okwess Turn Congo Turbulence Into Ferocious Grooves
description: Jupiter Bokondji Ilola, now 54, didnt choose a comfortable path. As the son of a diplomat from Zaire, now the Democratic Republic of Congo  a country long ravaged by poverty, corruption and civil war  he spent much of his childhood in Tanzania and East Germany, and he could have pursued an education in Europe. Instead he left his family as a teenager to live in Kinshasa, the capital, and began working as a musician.

title: Alan Dershowitz Says Marthas Vineyard Is Shunning Him Over Trump
description: It was not the sort of complaint likely to draw public sympathy, and it did not.

title: A (Mostly) Gay, Celebrity-Filled Party Returns to the Bowery
description: Beige is back. For 17 years, this Tuesday night party at the Bowery Bar and Grill was an essential stop on the gay-fashion-downtown night life circuit. It was a place where celebrities, models and Page Six habitus bumped booties and spilled vodka cranberries alongside striving artists and handsome pleasure seekers. But it ended in 2011, as the Bowery was beset by luxury real estate.

title: Yelp Cant Be Ordered to Remove Negative Posts, California Court Rules
description: The California Supreme Court ruled on Monday that Yelp, the local search and reviews site, did not need to remove negative comments posted by a user, in a case closely watched by the industry for its implications for online free speech.

title: What Is ICE and Why Do Critics Want to Abolish It?
description: WASHINGTON  Over the past several weeks, protesters, Democratic lawmakers and candidates, and even some federal agents have demanded an end to the government agency known as ICE, railing against President Trumps immigration policies, which have produced heart-wrenching images of migrants being stopped at the southwestern border.

title: Discussion Questions for Pachinko
description: Our July pick for the PBS NewsHour-New York Times book club, Now Read This is Min Jin Lees historical novel Pachinko. Become a member of the book club by joining our Facebook group, or by signing up to our newsletter. Learn more about the book club here.

title: Old School Italian in Queens: Red Sauce, Yes; Cellphones, No
description: The facade of Il Triangolo, a wedge of a restaurant in north-central Queens at the sharply angled intersection of Corona Avenue and Junction Boulevard, isnt much broader than the door. But the entryway opens to a space that widens in both directions, like arms extended for a hug. This is a gesture not atypical for the owner, Mario Gigliotti, who usually greets guests, Welcome to my home.

title: R.I.P. Warped Tour. At Least We Still Have Vans.
description: The Vans Warped Tour  the music festival that has crossed the country each year since 1995, and is frequently called a punk rock summer camp  is on its last run.

title: A Spring Market With Few Bright Spots for Sellers
description: Springtime in Manhattan was far from sunny for home sellers, as inventory increased, prices continued to decline and sales volume dropped to its lowest level in nine years, according to new market reports.

title: Toxic History, Poisoned Water: The Story of Flint
description: From the start, the people of Flint, Mich., knew something was wrong with the water coming out of their taps  it was brown and orange, visibly full of particles, frothy and foul-smelling. Their hair started falling out, and showers left their bodies burning with red welts. Their plants and pets began to die. On a hot day, children playing in the spray of a water hydrant were streaked with coffee-colored liquid.

title: Philippe de Baleine, Editor and Worldly Writer, Dies at 96
description: PARIS  Philippe de Baleine, a prominent French journalist and magazine editor who pursued a parallel career as a prolific author, often writing under a pseudonym, died on June 7 at his home in Paris. He was 96.

title: At Graduation, a Son in the Limelight and a Father in the Shadows
description: Two pieces of big news came at the end of May to the home of Roni Lezama and his father, Carlos.

title: Why the Supreme Court Opening Could Affect Gay Marriage as Well as Abortion
description: In the week since Justice Anthony M. Kennedy announced his retirement, the future of Roe v. Wade has dominated the conversation among both liberals and conservatives, becoming a flash point in the partisan battle over President Trumps pick to fill the seat.

title: The Supreme Temptation of Amy Coney Barrett
description: Theres little that President Trump loves more than cementing his supporters adoration of him while making his foes squirm. Nominating Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court would do both. Shes not just a staunch conservative over whom Republicans and Democrats would wage a familiar fight. Shes the prompt for an all-out culture war.

title: What Edmund White Thinks You Should Read
description: THE UNPUNISHED VICE A Life of Reading By Edmund White 223 pp. Bloomsbury. $28.

title: At 9 He Lost His Mom to Gang Violence. At 12 He Lost His Dad to Trumps Immigration Policies.
description: When Brayan was 9 years old, in 2016, his mother was brutally raped and murdered in Honduras. Her body was found in a septic tank. When Brayan saw her in the coffin, she was so disfigured that he couldnt recognize her. She had been seven months pregnant. Thats when his nightmares began, his fear of the dark. His mothers boyfriend had abused her and was arrested in the killing, but he claimed it was a gang killing and was set free. He threatened Brayan and his father, Jos, so Jos vowed to bring Brayan to safety in the United States. The opportunity to travel there safely arrived this year.

title: What Alec Baldwin Taught My Son About Political Activism
description: What do you want your sign to say? I asked my son. We were walking home from the art supply store with a bag of foam-core board, brushes and tempera paint; the next day we were going to march against President Trumps policy of separating and detaining undocumented immigrant families, many of whom had crossed the border seeking political asylum.

title: Why New Zealand Is Furious About Australias Deportation Policy
description: On the night of Sept. 11, 2015, security cameras in a prison in Goulburn, a city southwest of Sydney, recorded a final, desperate act.

description: Even before President Trumps new Supreme Court nominee is announced, a fight over the choice is raging on social media.

title: Not All Incivility Is Equal
description: To the Editor:

title: Killing of African Giraffe Sets Off Anger at White American Savage Who Shot It
description: The dead giraffe is curled up on the ground in souvenir photographs. The American woman who killed it during a guided hunt in South Africa is nestled in the curve of the animals long neck, clutching her long gun and pointing at the sky in gratitude.

title: Despite State Blessing, Marijuana Dispensaries Face Local Rancor
description: Finding a place to house a medical marijuana dispensary is rarely an easy task, but MariMed Advisors, which specializes in developing cannabis businesses, encountered especially aggressive pushback working for a client in Annapolis, Md., last year.

title: Away From the Bay: Alternatives to San Francisco
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Mary-Louise Parker, Resounding in The Sound Inside
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass.  Its pretty easy to stun an audience into the kind of silence about which people say, You could hear a pin drop. Just a well-timed slap will do it.

title: Prosecutor Who Oversaw Michael Cohen Inquiry Leaves Government
description: The federal prosecutor who supervised the investigation of Michael D. Cohen, President Trumps longtime personal lawyer, has left the government and will be joining the law firm Davis Polk & Wardwell, the firm said.

title: Lots of Successful Women Are Freezing Their Eggs. But It May Not Be About Their Careers.
description: Freeze Your Eggs, Free Your Career, announced the headline of a Bloomberg Businessweek cover story in 2014. It was the year that Facebook and then Apple began offering egg freezing as a benefit to employees. Hundreds of think pieces followed, debating the costs and benefits of postponing procreation in the name of professional advancement.

title: This Republican Always Shows Up. That May Not Be Enough This Fall.
description: STERLING, Va.  Representative Barbara Comstock consistently attends Eid festivals at the Adams Center, one of the largest mosques in the United States. When a young Muslim earns his Eagle Scout Award, she is there reliably, bearing an American flag as a gift.

title: By His Absence, Zlatan Ibrahimovic Makes Sweden Stronger at the World Cup
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  Sweden was tired of waiting and wondering by April. The public had long since made its feelings on the matter clear in a survey: Two-thirds of the country thought it was a bad idea. Swedens coach, Janne Andersson, claimed he was not considering it, anyway.

title: Thailand, NATO, Malaysia: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Irena Szewinska, Champion Polish Sprinter, Is Dead at 72
description: Irena Szewinska, a sprinter and long jumper who won seven medals in five Olympic Games, tying an Olympic womens record and becoming a national hero in Poland, died on Friday at a hospital in Warsaw. She was 72.

title: Nigeria Captain Played Key World Cup Match Hours After Learning His Father Was Kidnapped
description: John Obi Mikel, the captain of Nigerias World Cup soccer team, played in his teams final, crucial match against Argentina last week hours after finding out kidnappers were holding his father hostage, he revealed on Tuesday.

title: Modern Love: My Back-Seat View of a Great Romance
description: This week on the podcast, Chlo Grace Moretz reads Rachel Monroes story of true love observed from afar (and up close).

title: Chlo Grace Moretz Reads My Back-Seat View of a Great Romance
description: This week on Modern Love: The Podcast, Chlo Grace Moretz reads My Back-Seat View of a Great Romance. Its a story of fearless forbidden love observed from afar  and briefly up close  that underscores the authors reservations about her own relationship.

title: Jackie Kennedys Packing List for Texas, Chic and Poignant
description: Jackie Kennedys recently resurfaced packing list for the fateful autumn trip to Texas she took with her husband, President John F. Kennedy, contains plenty of interest for fashion historians.

title: Owls See the World Much Like We Do
description: Owl eyes are round, but not spherical. These immobile, tubular structures sit on the front of an owls face like a pair of built-in binoculars. They allow the birds to focus in on prey and see in three dimensions, kind of like humans  except we dont have to turn our whole heads to spot a slice of pizza beside us.

title: Monsoon Flooding Kills 6 in Pakistani City
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The worst monsoon rains in decades killed six people in the Pakistani city of Lahore on Tuesday, submerging much of the area under water, stranding people inside their homes and leaving most neighborhoods without power.

title: Mining Tycoon, Once Brazils Richest Man, Is Sentenced to 30 Years in Prison
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Eike Batista, an oil and mining tycoon who just years ago was on a quest to use his vast fortune to turbocharge Brazils growth, was sentenced to 30 years in prison this week on charges of paying more than $16.5 million in bribes.

title: New Era for Bike-Share in New York: Dockless and Electric Bikes
description: Citi Bike has been the only bike-share option in New York City for the last five years.

title: Trump Voters May Be the Biggest Losers From Trumps Auto Tariffs
description: BRUSSELS  President Trump has complained about seeing too many German cars on Fifth Avenue, and threatened heavy tariffs on the companies that produce them. There is a good chance, though, that those Mercedes-Benzes and BMWs were not only made in the United States, but made by workers who voted for Mr. Trump.

title: Obamacare Is Proving Hard to Kill
description: As health insurers across the country begin filing their proposed rates for 2019, one thing is clear: The market created by the Affordable Care Act shows no signs of imminent collapse in spite of the continuing threats by Republicans to destroy it.

title: Probiotics May Be Good for Your Bones
description: A probiotic supplement could be good for your bones, a new study suggests.

title: Barnes & Noble Fires C.E.O. Without Severance but Doesnt Explain Why
description: Barnes & Noble fired its chief executive, Demos Parneros, for violating the companys policies, the company said on Tuesday without specifying the policies.

title: Imran Awan, Ex-Congressional I.T. Worker, Pleads Guilty to Bank Fraud
description: A former technology worker for the House of Representatives accused of data theft by conservative news outlets pleaded guilty on Tuesday to an unrelated charge of making false statements on a loan application.

title: The East Has Fallen Off the N.B.A. Map
description: News Alert: N.B.A. Commissioner Adam Silver has announced the dissolution of the leagues Eastern Conference on grounds of terminal lack of competitiveness and profound irrelevance.

title: Alfred Alberts, Unsung Father of a Cholesterol Drug, Dies at 87
description: Alfred W. Alberts, a largely unknown hero behind the first cholesterol-lowering statin approved in the United States, died on June 16 in Fort Collins, Colo. He was 87.

title: A Record $2.5 Trillion in Mergers Were Announced in the First Half of 2018
description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines  and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

title: Are False Statements Enough to Prove Fraud?
description: Frauds usually start with some type of deception that leads victims to hand over their money. But what if false statements are not enough to prove a person engaged in a scheme to defraud?

title: Place Your Bets on the New Millennial Pink
description: For such a cuddly color, millennial pink has a surprisingly tight grip on the fashion world, holding the de facto title of It hue for three years (at least). But evidence suggests that its stubbornly photogenic reign may be nearing an end. Does this mean that a new age is upon us, one where all colors live in harmony and are appreciated equally? In the immortal words of Cher Horowitz: as if! Fashion loves a (sartorial) dictator, and so naturally the industry has already started to look for a suitable heir. Here, four experts make the case for the shades that will dominate in the years to come. Which one gets your vote?

title: For Tennis Players, Numbers in Antidoping Program Dont Add Up
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Serena Williams expressed no qualms about antidoping officers showing up unannounced to collect urine and, on occasion, blood samples. She wasnt even bothered when it happened twice in the same week in the lead-up to this years French Open. It was like T.S.A. searches at the airport  a minor inconvenience of her high-flying tennis career.

title: Lights of the George Washington Bridge
description: Dear Diary:

title: NATO, Scott Pruitt, Supreme Court: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Silicon Valleys Giants Take Their Talent Hunt to Cambridge
description: CAMBRIDGE, England  When you step off the train here and walk into the city square outside the railway station, you will not see the spires of Kings College Chapel or the turrets atop the Trinity Great Court. The University of Cambridge is still a cab ride away. But you will see a stone and glass office building with a rooftop patio. This is where Amazon designs its flying drones.

title: Poland Purges Supreme Court, and Protesters Take to Streets
description: WARSAW  Polands government carried out a sweeping purge of the Supreme Court on Tuesday night, eroding the judiciarys independence, escalating a confrontation with the European Union over the rule of law and further dividing this nation. Tens of thousands took to the streets in protest.

title: In a Fox-Inspired Tweetstorm, Trump Offers a Medley of Falsehoods and Misstatements
description: WASHINGTON  The string of insults, misstatements, exaggerations and outright falsehoods emanating from the White House began just after sunrise.

title: Where American Politics Can Still Work: From the Bottom Up
description: LANCASTER, Pa.  Last week I wrote about why political parties across the industrial world are fracturing from the top down. Today Im writing about the political units that are working. On this Fourth of July, if you want to be an optimist about America, stand on your head. The country looks so much better from the bottom up.

title: Forget The Parades. Protest This Fourth of July.
description: How do you celebrate Independence Day? A cookout? Maybe take the kids to a parade?

title: Dershowitzs Defense of Trump Is Costing Him Friends
description: Alan Dershowitz, a professor emeritus at Harvard Law School, has frequented conservative cable news networks to defend President Trump. He says friends on Marthas Vineyard are shunning him for it.

title: My Whole Heart Is There
description: Yeni Gonzlez left her home in rural Guatemala in mid-May. Days later, she crossed the United States border, by night, with her three young children. They were picked up by Border Patrol, she said, and taken to a detention center near Yuma, Ariz.

title: An Unusual Jailbird Is Found at Rikers Island: A Snowy Owl
description: It is not often that New Yorkers are graced with the sight of a snowy owl, especially in the middle of a July heat wave.

title: America Started Over Once. Can We Do It Again?
description: President Trump plans to announce his second Supreme Court nominee on Monday, which also happens to be the 150th anniversary of the ratification of the 14th Amendment.

title: How Should Antitrust Regulators Check Silicon Valleys Ambitions?
description: The Justice Department has said that the United States District Courts ruling in favor of AT&Ts bid to acquire Time Warner will harm consumers.

title: Sexual Abuse Accusations at Ohio State Could Tar Powerful Republican
description: A news report on Tuesday accusing Representative Jim Jordan of ignoring accusations of sexual abuse as a wrestling coach at Ohio State University has left a cloud over the powerful congressman as conservative activists put him forward as potentially the next speaker of the House.

title: On Marthas Vineyard, a Frosty Summer for Alan Dershowitz
description: CHILMARK, Mass.  For years, Alan Dershowitz, the lawyer and professor emeritus at Harvard Law School, has been a garrulous fixture in this handsome, gray-shingled town on Marthas Vineyard. He holds court from a rocking chair on the porch at the Chilmark General Store, drinking coffee and greeting fellow regulars. He strolls down Lucy Vincent Beach, gabbing on his cellphone along the way.

title: Jack Socks Season-Long Struggles Continue at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Last November in London, Jack Sock beat two top-five players to reach the semifinals of the ATP Finals, a tournament for which only the top eight men qualify. He had earned a spot in the field with a stunning victory at the Paris-Bercy Masters event a week before, launching himself into the top 10 for the first time.

title: Corrections: July 4, 2018
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day: Who May Suffer the Most From Auto Tariffs? Trump Voters
description: What is going to play out in the industry is higher costs, lower employment and a massive disruption that could ultimately result in an economic downturn for the country.

title: Two Judges Exemplify the Choice Trump Faces in a Supreme Court Pick
description: WASHINGTON  One is a creature of Washington with two Yale degrees, a ticket-punching rsum that includes stints in the Justice Department, the Bush White House and a federal appeals court, where he has written some 300 opinions.

title: 2 Men Plead No Contest in Oakland Ghost Ship Fire That Killed 36
description: Two men associated with a warehouse fire in Oakland, Calif., that killed 36 people almost two years ago pleaded no contest to involuntary manslaughter on Tuesday and will each face several years in prison, prosecutors said.

title: Reserved Trump Celebrates Two Passions: Military and Golf
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W.Va.  President Trump celebrated the service of military members and the talents of professional golfers on Tuesday in a reserved speech that, but for the presidential seal on the lectern and a few improvised flourishes, offered little deviance from the standard pre-dinner remarks at a signature sporting event.

title: Annual Greeting
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  A brief one today, as I will be invoking this annual greeting with some guests. I also wish my readers in the United States a happy and peaceful holiday.

title: Yankees Display Their Flaws, but Still Beat the Braves
description: When a team owns the second-best record in baseball in early July, leads the league in home runs and has yet to lose more than three games in a row, one needs to dig deep to find reasons to be critical of it.

title: Mets Lose Again as They Plod Toward the Trade Deadline
description: TORONTO  This Mets team has players of all ages either hurt or underperforming. Their off-season acquisitions have not panned out. Their rookie manager has looked at times like, well, a rookie. The general manager stepped down last week because of a recurrence of cancer but acknowledged he was unlikely to return.

title: The Times at Gettysburg, July 1863: A Reporters Civil War Heartbreak
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Fireworks and Captain America
description: Watch fireworks in New York or Washington. And choose between three Americans: Steve Rogers, Harry Callahan and Chiron.

title: The New Season of GLOW Is Even Better Than the First. Except for One Thing.
description: Spoilers for Season 2 of GLOW follow.

title: Lakeith Stanfield Is Playing Us All
description: LOS ANGELES  When Lakeith Stanfield was 20 and working at a marijuana grow house, he concluded that the plants in his care were conscious beings he was exchanging ideas with. That this realization came when he was really high didnt make it less lasting or less real. Mr. Stanfield loves plants, feels for them, because, he said, they are a pure life, and they do not talk, and laments that his busy work schedule prevents him from keeping any at home. I travel too much, he said in a recent interview here, and I dont want to put plants through that.

title: Polands Supreme Court in Disarray After Judges Defy Purge
description: WARSAW  Surrounded by cheering supporters, Polands top Supreme Court justice took a defiant stand on the courthouse steps here Wednesday morning, hours after the government purged the tribunal. She vowed to keep fighting to protect the Constitution and the independence of the nations courts.

title: Wang Jian, Co-Founder of Chinese Giant HNA, Dies in France

title: What 8 Thirsty Scenesters Wore to the Broken Shaker Bar
description: The lines form at 4:30 p.m. The Broken Shaker, which opened last month on the roof of the  Freehand Hotel near Gramercy Park in New York, has been a magnet for finance bros, fashion kids and tourists. Based on the original in Miami Beach, the bar transplants an aesthetic thats part haute hippie, part tiki to the middle of the concrete jungle. We joined the line on a recent Wednesday to see for ourselves.

title: Exercise May Aid in Weight Loss. Provided You Do Enough.

title: How to Keep Up With the World Cup if You Cant Watch Live
description: The World Cup only happens every four years, so its particularly painful when you cant catch the big games. Maybe youre stuck in meetings at work all day, or maybe your time zone just isnt compatible with Russias. You can still enjoy those games after theyve aired, as long as you avoid spoilers.

description: Age: 26

title: Being Poor Can Mean Losing a Drivers License. Not Anymore in Tennessee.
description: Millions of Americans have had their drivers licenses taken away not because they got drunk and got behind the wheel, or because they caused an accident and hurt someone: They lost their licenses because they were too poor to pay court costs or traffic fines, which can run into hundreds and sometimes thousands of dollars.

title: 5 Summer Programs for Teens That Teach Empathy Through Community Service

High school plays out under a social media microscope, one that parents and young people can find difficult to free themselves from and focus instead on whats really important. To help expand their childrens horizons, boost their empathy and make a difference in their communities, parents (and teens eager to change the world) have several summer programs with community service elements to choose from.

title: Some Contractors Housing Migrant Children Are Familiar to Trumps Inner Circle

title: Captain America No. 1, by Ta-Nehisi Coates, Annotated
description: Captain America enjoys a rarefied position in the superhero pantheon. Since his 1940 debut (in which he punches Adolf Hitler in the face), Captain America has been defined as the quintessential patriot. In stories that have riffed on divisive political moments  Watergate, the War on Terror  the Captain, also known as Steve Rogers, has emerged as a complex man, one willing to question the direction his country takes.

title: Access to Literacy Is Not a Constitutional Right, Judge in Detroit Rules

I bet him I could walk across Main Street naked at 6 p.m. and nobody would see it, he recalled. And the proof that I was right is that no video of that has ever shown up on YouTube. Downtown, he said, was freakin desolate.

title: Why Made in China 2025 Will Succeed, Despite Trump
description: China will succeed in building a powerful technology industry that will rival the United States, even if President  Trump starts a trade war to stop it. The reason can be found on the fourth floor of a nondescript factory in a city once famous for cheap manufacturing and prostitution.

title: Committing to a Dog Is Hard. This Place Lets You Just Flirt.

It is on a cul-de-sac in the Fifth Ward neighborhood, across from Morton Park, and about a mile west of the Breakers, convenient to shops and restaurants.

title: The Handmaids Tale Season 2, Episode 12: Ball and Chain
description: You dont see a lot of warm colors on The Handmaids Tale, a show in which columns of harsh white light are always slanting into dark and shadowy chambers. But Postpartum, the penultimate episode of Season 2, opens with a closeup of baby Holly in the bath, her peachy skin illuminated by golden sunshine. The bliss ends quickly, as the face of the woman bathing her enters the frame. Its Serena, looking uncharacteristically happy. Hollys name is Nicole now. And her real mom is at the Red Center, hooked up to a giant breast pump.

title: The Los Angeles Dance Scene. Yes, There Is One.

title: Criminal Convictions Behind Them, Few Have Had Their Records Sealed
description: Carlos grew up in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn in the 1990s, then a rough-and-tumble neighborhood where he struggled to stay out of trouble. He later moved with his wife and two children to the South Bronx, where he made a career as a taxi driver.

title: Great Barrier Reef Imperiled as Heat Worsens Die-Offs, Experts Say
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Scientists have again sounded the alarm about Australias imperiled Great Barrier Reef, saying that by the 2030s it could see devastating mass bleachings as often as every two years unless greenhouse gas emissions are drastically reduced.

title: Happy Independence Day!
description: Good morning. Our Rachel Wharton traveled to the southernmost part of New Jersey to report on some of the small farmers who are growing heirloom blueberry varietals there, just across the road from the mammoth producers who dominate the East Coast blueberry game. It is an engaging report on a beautiful part of the world, and absolutely worth your time to read, if only because it may spur you to cook a blueberry pie today, to celebrate America.

title: When It Comes to Politics, Be Afraid. But Not Too Afraid.
description: The philosopher Martha C. Nussbaum wants Americans to get in touch with their feelings; not in a fit of self-indulgence but as a righteous act of civic duty. In The Monarchy of Fear: A Philosopher Looks at Our Political Crisis, she writes against a (mostly male) tradition of philosophical and political thinking that minimizes emotions as merely a source of irrationality and embarrassment.

title: For Hope in Trumps America, I Read Sojourner Truth
description: I have been feeling so much despair that, even as a media scholar, Im often tempted to avoid the news.

title: Review: Ant-Man and the Wasp Save the World! With Jokes!
description: Marvel Studios likes to supersize everything  its heroes, blowups, runtimes, opening theaters, market share and so on. In its world of over-muscled giant slayers, the wee superhero Ant-Man (Paul Rudd) has proved an anomaly because, even when he expands from ant-size to giant, he remains a regular guy, one of lifes little people. Thats still very much the case in Ant-Man and the Wasp, an engaging goof that resists bludgeoning you with bigness and instead settles for good vibes and jokes. Look! Up in the sky! Its a bird! Its a plane! [Squints.] Its a surprisingly enjoyable summer romp!

description: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Nellie Bowles, a technology reporter in San Francisco, discussed the tech shes using.

title: Rhino Embryos Made in Lab to Save Nearly Extinct Subspecies
description: If you had asked Thomas Hildebrandt a decade ago whether the northern white rhinoceros could be saved, his answer would have been grim. The rhinos numbers had dwindled to single digits, and the few remaining individuals all had severe reproductive issues.

title: Andrs Cantor Thinks Everything Sounds Better in Spanish (Especially Gooool)
description: Andrs Cantor, the Telemundo commentator most famous for bellowing goooool! at each World Cup score, has a couple of rituals before every broadcast. He starts by blowing through a straw, as if it were a trumpet, to the tune of the United States national anthem to loosen up his vocal cords. He drinks water to hydrate and sets some honey nearby to soothe the throat when necessary.

title: Why Lang Langs Return Is a Big Deal for Classical Music
description: For more than a year, the pianist Lang Lang has been largely out of commission with an injured left arm  a major loss, since he is one of classical musics biggest and most bankable stars. Google the phrase superstar concert pianist, and Mr. Langs name pops up right away. He played during the televised opening ceremony of the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing and jammed with Metallica at the 2014 Grammy Awards.

title: Orlando Bloom and Aidan Turner Are Drenched in Blood in London

Wait until you get a load of Aidan Turner tenderly cradling a cats mangled corpse in The Lieutenant of Inishmore, which opened on Wednesday at the Nol Coward Theater in a river of stage blood.

title: Henry Butler, Quintessential New Orleans Pianist, Is Dead at 69

title: The Art of Staying Cool: 10 Cant-Miss Summer Shows in New York
description: Time can be uncooperative; schedules go askew. And New York Citys a busy town. One of the big regrets we art critics feel as the season winds down is about the museum shows we didnt review, the ones that got caught in the midyear pileup of openings across the city. As a partial remedy, were looking at 10 of those brilliant strays now. In every case, late notice is no reflection at all on the merits of the exhibitions. Blame it on the embarrassment of riches, of which theyre a part. And when summer weather turns sultry, museums can be very cool places to be. Youll find Wayne Thiebauds Ice Cream Cones waiting for you at the Morgan Library & Museum  and Snowman, by Peter Fischli and David Weiss beating the heat in MoMAs Sculpture Garden. HOLLAND COTTER

Trump Foundation as little more than a checkbook for payments from Mr. Trump or his businesses to nonprofits, regardless of their purpose or legality.

title: What Trump Doesnt Get About Conservatism
description: I have devoted a substantial part of my intellectual life to defining and defending conservatism, as a social philosophy and a political program. Each time I think I have hit the nail on the head, the nail slips to one side and the hammer blow falls on my fingers.

title: To Hackers, Were Bambi in the Woods
description: If youre worried about terrorism, heres a bigger threat to lose sleep over: an all-out cyberattack.

title: Parenting Lessons From the World Cup
description: PARIS  I consider it a credit to my independence of spirit that despite being married to a journalist who covers soccer and raising several young soccer fanatics, Ive managed to absorb practically nothing about the sport. I can sit alongside them as they hoot and moan at players on TV, then still ask, after an hour, Wait, are Spain the red ones? (Similarly, when I played softball as a kid, Id forget whether Id just batted and run to first base or whether I was the first baseman.)

title: Statue of Liberty Climber Upends Holiday for Thousands
description: The authorities cleared visitors from the Statue of Liberty on the Fourth of July after a woman protesting the Trump administrations immigration policies climbed onto its base and refused to come down. About three hours later, police officers followed the woman onto the statue and took her safely into custody.

title: The Legacy of Monticellos Black First Family
description: Plantation wives in the slave-era South resorted to willful blindness when their husbands conscripted black women as sexual servants and filled the household with mixed-race children who inevitably resembled the master. Thomas Jeffersons wife, Martha, was several years dead when he set off on this path, fathering at least six children with Marthas enslaved black half sister, Sally Hemings. The task of dissembling fell to the remaining white Jeffersons, who aided in a cover-up that held sway for two centuries and feigned ignorance of a relationship between Jefferson and Hemings that lasted nearly four decades.

title: How Trump Went From Fire and Fury to Dismissing North Korean Nuclear Advances
description: WASHINGTON  When the North Koreans were shooting off missile tests and detonating new, more powerful atomic bombs last year, President Trump responded with threats of fire and fury and ordered the military to come up with new, if highly risky, pre-emptive strike options.

title: Quotation of the Day: New York Asians Say Citys Blind Spot Leaves Them Overlooked
description: This clich of, If youre not at the table, youre on the menu really felt like it rang true.

title: Immigrants Take Oath at Monticello, Feeling the Weight of the Past
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  Just before 9 a.m. on the Fourth of July, the gong on Monticellos roof rang, silencing the crowd that had gathered to celebrate those vowing to uphold and protect the ideals of the United States.

title: Max Fuchs, G.I. Cantor in Historic Battlefield Service, Is Dead at 96
description: Max Fuchs was a rifleman in the First Infantry Division when it came ashore at Omaha Beach, the bloodiest sector of the D-Day invasion of Normandy, on the morning of June 6, 1944.

title: At Wimbledon, Married Women Are Still Mrs.
description: WIMBLEDON, England  It was another win at the All England Club on Wednesday for Serena Williams  or, as she is known here, Mrs. Williams.
