title: As Inflation Rises, Its Even Harder to Get a Raise
description: The economy is not yet there for many Americans.

title: Consumer Bureau Official Who Sued Trump to Step Down and Drop Her Suit
description: An Obama-era official at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau who argued that she  and not President Trumps budget director  should have been handed temporary control of the agency announced on Friday that she was stepping down.

title: In Russias Archives, a Soccer History Cloaked in Contradictions
description: MOSCOW  Each dossier holds close to 300 sheets of paper, so thin they are almost transparent, some filled with precise, clipped handwriting, others with symmetrical rows of type. Some contain allegations and accusations, but most are transcripts of interrogations carried out at the height of Stalins Great Terror by the feared agents of the secret police.

title: Man Labeled ID Adam Is Fired After Calling the Police on a Black Woman at Pool
description: A white North Carolina man was fired after he demanded identification from a black woman at a private community pool on the Fourth of July and called the police when she refused.

title: Open Thread: Lets Talk About the Fourth of July
description: Hello and happy (late) Fourth of July. Hopefully, most of you got some time off the stop and watch the fireworks.

title: Spurs Guard Tony Parker Leaving for Charlotte Hornets
description: The first high-profile defection from the San Antonio Spurs this off-season was not the disgruntled All-Star forward Kawhi Leonard but instead their long-serving point guard, Tony Parker.

title: Drug Use. Corruption. Scandal. Theres an Ugly Side to the Beautiful Game.
description: Musa Okwonga, a poet, activist and author of two books on football, answered questions on Reddit this week about the off-the-pitch issues around the World Cup and some of the most exciting matches. Mr. Okwonga is no novice. His ties to the beautiful game started generations before his birth in England, when his grandfather coached the Ugandan national team.

title: You Can Hitch a Ride to Rockaway Beach, but Will It Be Open? Maybe.
description: In late May, Mayor Bill de Blasio dropped a pre-summer bombshell: A treasured stretch of beach in the Rockaways would be closed indefinitely because of heavy erosion.

title: Picking Berries, Playing Cards, Jumping in the Bay: The Canada Letter
description: Last week, we asked you to share images and memories from your cottages (or camps or cabins). Ian is supposed to be on vacation this week at his cottage so I  Toronto bureau chief of The Times and die-hard Georgian Bay cottager  got to sort through the responses, vicariously traveling to serene spots around the country. Here is a sampling, lightly edited:

title: Migrants, Scott Pruitt, World Cup: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Robbery Suspect Wounds Detective Pursuing Him Before Being Shot by Officers
description: A man wanted in connection with an armed robbery shot a New York City warrants detective in the leg on Friday morning in Brooklyn as the detective pursued him, the police said, before officers returned fire and shot the man in the forearm.

title: Trump Starts a Trade War, but the Path to Success Remains Unclear
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and China hit each other with punishing tariffs on Friday as the two nations tipped into a long-feared trade war that is only expected to escalate.

title: We Will Never Abolish ICE, Pence Says as He Slams Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  Calling Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials American heroes, Vice President Mike Pence doubled down on the Trump administrations defense of the maligned agency on Friday and demanded that Democrats end their irresponsible push to disband it.

title: What to Know About the Trapped Thai Boys
description: When 12 soccer players and their coach went missing in the Tham Luang cave in Chiang Rai Province in northern Thailand on June 23, many feared they would never emerge alive from the flooded depths of the geological complex.

title: Mickey Mouse Works His Magic in China
description: The crush at the entrance to Shanghai Disneyland was particularly chaotic, even for China. Squeezed and jostled, I cursed under my breath.

title: Holocaust Denier in California Congressional Race Leaves State G.O.P. Scrambling
description: A Republican congressional candidate in a reliably blue California district managed to capture nearly a quarter of votes cast in the states open primary last month  just after the state Republican Party caught wind of his anti-Semitic comments and rescinded its automatic endorsement.

title: Democrats: Do Not Surrender the Judiciary
description: With Republicans controlling the Senate and the judicial filibuster dead, the Democrats odds of denying President Trump a second Supreme Court appointment are slim. Barring some unforeseen development, the president will lock in a 5-to-4 conservative majority, shifting the court solidly to the right for a generation.

title: In Corruption Retrial, Dean Skelos Takes Stand in Own Defense
description: Dean G. Skelos, once one of the most powerful players in New York State government, unexpectedly took the stand in his own defense on Friday during the retrial of a federal corruption case that two years earlier had resulted in a five-year prison sentence.

title: Prosecutors Dropping Remaining Charges Against Trump Inauguration Protesters
description: WASHINGTON  The United States attorneys office for the District of Columbia is dismissing the remaining cases against protesters arrested on the day of Donald J. Trumps inauguration, ending a legal battle that began more than a year and a half ago.

title: In Two Summits, a Moment of Truth for Trump
description: President Trumps next two summits, first with NATO allies in Brussels, then with Russias President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki, Finland, will either restore American global leadership or kill it off, depending on how he plays our hand.

title: Jenrry Mejia, Barred for Life in 2016, May Return to the Mets Next Season
description: Jenrry Mejia, the Mets closer who became the first player in Major League Baseball to be barred for life for using performance-enhancing drugs, has been conditionally reinstated.

title: Shifting Strategy, Trumps Lawyers Set New Conditions for Mueller Interview
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps lawyers set new conditions on Friday on an interview with the special counsel and said that the chances that the president would be voluntarily questioned were growing increasingly unlikely.

title: They Came Here to Serve. But for Many Immigrants, the Army Isnt Interested.
description: Recruit Zhang, an immigrant from China, joined the United States military on the promise that enlisting would lead to American citizenship. He swore an oath to uphold the Constitution and was handed an Army T-shirt. But, after two years of delays, there came a sudden discharge that has left him reeling.

title: Ralph Paige, Champion of Black Farmers, Dies at 74
description: Ralph Paige, a nationally prominent advocate for black farmers who fought to save their land and to win them financial compensation for what they contended were years of government discrimination, died on June 28 in Atlanta. He was 74.

title: In Making His Second Supreme Court Pick, Trump Has a Model: His First
description: WASHINGTON  All four of President Trumps candidates for the Supreme Court are white, middle-aged federal appeals court judges with reliably conservative legal records.

title: Scott Pruitts Rocky Relationship With His Aides Set the Stage for His Fall
description: Want the latest climate and environment news in your inbox? You can sign up here to receive Climate Fwd:, our email newsletter.

title: Trumps New Targets: Immigrants in the Military
description: This month is the 70th anniversary of President Harry Trumans executive order to end discrimination in the military according to race, color, religion or national origin. Attaining equality for all has always been slow going, but Trumans order  signed during Jim Crow  is a reminder that the military has often led the way in promoting civil rights.

title: Record Breaking or Not, Trump Crowds Get Elton John on Repeat
description: President Trump does not express much affection for celebrities, which is unsurprising considering how many of them have vocally, even profanely, repudiated his policies.

title: Democratic Socialism Is Dem Doom
description: A political novice who calls herself a democratic socialist wins an unexpected Democratic Party primary victory, and now political taxonomists are racing to explain just what the term means. Heres my definition: political hemlock for the Democratic Party.

title: Jim Jordan Is Defiant as Allegations Mount, and Supporters Point to Deep State
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Jim Jordan is facing the kind of slowly percolating scandal that would bring down other politicians in other times, as new accusers step forward by the day to say the wrestling coach turned politician was aware of sexual misconduct at Ohio State University but did nothing to stop it.

title: Quotation of the Day: Trade War Rises, and Trump Plan Remains a Puzzle
description: Trump is treating trade policy as though it were a real estate deal, where the goal is to beat your opponent, step on his throat and humiliate him.

title: Corrections: July 7, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: What Stars Do
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE    Ryan McCartys puzzle today, personally speaking,  is a distillation of the adage that you cant make all of the people (or any of the people, in our case) happy all of the time.  He debuts several entries, including a phrase that I hold dear to my heart (and use ad nauseam, probably) and one that I will never use  just filling it in made me nauseous.  But the rest was great!  And to return to the heart, please be sure to check out the constructor notes today, of all days.

title: Super Polluting Trucks Receive Loophole on Pruitts Last Day
description: WASHINGTON  In the final hours of Scott Pruitts tenure as administrator, the Environmental Protection Agency moved on Friday to effectively grant a loophole that will allow a major increase in the manufacturing of a diesel freight truck that produces as much as 55 times the air pollution as trucks that have modern emissions controls.

title: Put to a Test Against Toronto, the Yankees Sonny Gray Records Another Loss
description: TORONTO  Sonny Gray stood in the visitors clubhouse at Rogers Centre late Friday night going over what had happened a few hours before. He mentioned a walk here, a bad pitch there and several dubious pitches in between.

title: Inside the Thailand Cave: The Obstacles That Rescuers Faced
description: Divers navigated flooded passages, with some openings as small as 3 feet wide, to rescue the soccer team.

title: Steve Ditko, Influential Comic-Book Artist Who Helped Create Spider-Man, Dies at 90
description: Steve Ditko, a comic-book artist best known for his role in creating Spider-Man, one of the most successful superhero properties ever, was found dead on June 29 at his home in Manhattan, the police said on Friday. He was 90.

title: Paul Manafort Seeks to Move Criminal Trial Hundreds of Miles From Washington
description: Lawyers for Paul Manafort are seeking to delay one of his criminal trials and move the location away from Washington, where they say the bias against their client is so great that a fair trial would be impossible, according to court documents filed in federal court on Friday.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: You Were Never Really Here and Bill Maher
description: Joaquin Phoenix plays a hit man with a cause in You Were Never Really Here. And a new stand-up special by Bill Maher airs on HBO.

title: North Korea Criticizes Gangster-Like U.S. Attitude After Talks With Mike Pompeo
description: PYONGYANG, North Korea  North Korea accused the Trump administration on Saturday of pushing a unilateral and gangster-like demand for denuclearization and called it deeply regrettable, hours after Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said his two days of talks in the North Korean capital were productive.

title: Plan to Exhume Franco Renews Spains Wrestle With History
description: SAN LORENZO DE EL ESCORIAL, Spain  After celebrating Mass last month, congregants here at the Valle de los Cados basilica walked to the back of the altar to pay homage to Francisco Franco, the Spanish dictator who is buried here.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. Have you found your summer rhythm yet? Does it include a walk through the woods, a swim in the ocean or a nap in the air-conditioning? However youre spending your days, take a minute to read some amazing journalism.

title: A Pittsburgh-Area Restaurant That Trades Fussy for Fun
description: A 15-foot man guards the entrance to U.S. Steels lone remaining Pittsburgh plant, smiling as he bends a rail with his bare hands. Joe Magarac is to steelworkers what Paul Bunyan is to lumberjacks; the plaque on this statue of him claims Joe was born in an ore mine, never slept, and ate hot steel like soup, and cold ingots like meat.

title: The Changing Face of Romance Novels
description: Growing up in Minnesota, Helen Hoang suffered from crippling social anxiety and struggled to make friends. She found refuge in romance novels, frothy stories that allowed her to experience intense feelings that were clearly spelled out on the page, always with the promise of a happy ending. It was like I found a pure, undiluted drug, she said.

title: Oprah, Is That You? On Social Media, the Answer Is Often No.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Kip Moore, a country music singer-songwriter with hits like Beer Money and Hey Pretty Girl, has had some disturbing experiences with fans lately.

title: Alan Dershowitz Is Enjoying This
description: CHILMARK, Mass.  This is what McCarthyism evidently looks like on Marthas Vineyard.

title: The Selfie That Dares to Go There
description: It was Thanksgiving, and Matt Silver was sitting around a table with his family when his 24-year-old girlfriend texted. It was the first time wed been apart, he said. A full-frontal bare vulva popped up on his screen; he fumbled and the phone landed faceup under his 10-year-old cousins chair. (He retrieved the phone with his foot.)

title: Bomba: The Enduring Anthem of Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico  Drummers beat the goatskin covers of rum barrels while a singer led a chorus in call and response. A dancer emerged from the crowd, tipping an imaginary hat to the lead drummer. Its a gesture that says the bomba has begun.

title: High-Skilled White-Collar Work? Machines Can Do That, Too
description: One of the best-selling T-shirts for the Indian e-commerce site Myntra is an olive, blue and yellow colorblocked design. It was conceived not by a human but by a computer algorithm  or rather two algorithms.

title: Japan Reels From Heavy Rains; Dozens Killed and Millions Urged to Evacuate
description: TOKYO  Record torrential rains across western and central Japan unleashed flooding and landslides in several residential areas, killing dozens and triggering weather warnings in four districts of the country.

title: The Forgotten Figure Behind Daytona International Speedway
description: By 1949, Bill France Sr. could tell that the famous stock-car races on the hard-packed sands of Daytona Beach, Fla., would soon be impractical.

title: How Staffing Fluctuates at Nursing Homes Around the United States
description: The number of workers at more than 14,000 nursing homes across the nation varies drastically.

title: England Takes Another Step Toward Bringing It Home
description: SAMARA, Russia  There was little here to please the aesthetes, nothing much to arouse the adrenaline junkies.

title: This Italian Town Once Welcomed Migrants. Now, Its a Symbol for Right-Wing Politics
description: MACERATA, Italy  At the end of his shooting rampage as the police closed in, Luca Traini climbed the steps of a Fascist-era monument, wrapped himself in an Italian flag and straightened his arm in a Fascist salute.

title: How to Lose a Trade War
description: Trumps declaration that trade wars are good, and easy to win is an instant classic, right up there with Herbert Hoovers prosperity is just around the corner.

title: Teachers, How Do You Connect Your Curriculum to Current Events and Issues?
description: Update, Aug., 2018: Thank you to the 44 teachers who shared ideas with us for the feature When School Gets Real: Teachers Connect Classroom Lessons to Current Events.

title: A Fatal Flaw as Trump Tries to Remake Health Care: Shortcuts
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration is on a losing streak in court cases challenging its efforts to abruptly change health care policy, but the naming of a new Supreme Court justice could alter the trajectory on some of the most controversial cases, from funding Planned Parenthood to mandating contraceptive coverage.

title: Two Monthly Poetry Readings for an Audience of One
description: Beth Jamie Feingold and Daisy Anna Freund were married July 7 at Churchtown Dairy, a biodynamic farm in Hudson, N.Y. Jill S. Schneiderman, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated in a ceremony with Jewish traditions.

title: Its Almost Like a Ghost Town. Most Nursing Homes Overstated Staffing for Years
description: ITHACA, N.Y.  Most nursing homes had fewer nurses and caretaking staff than they had reported to the government for years, according to new federal data, bolstering the long-held suspicions of many families that staffing levels were often inadequate.

title: How Much Water Does It Really Take to Wash a Sidewalk?
description: Q: I live in a small, family-owned brownstone on the Upper West Side. Every day, the doormen from the large co-op adjacent to our building water down the sidewalk area for at least 20 minutes. The deluge of water pools, flooding in front of the neighboring buildings. There is no time for it to dry before the next mornings washing, and there is no way to push it down the block with all the debris and cars in the way.  Is there anything we can do to stop this?

title: From Fighting Injustice to Facing Death Row: The Bizarre Case of Pastor Glasgow
description: DOTHAN, Ala.  A Google search will show that Pastor Kenneth Glasgow first made news in 2001 as the former crack addict and prison inmate who was fretted over by his older half brother, the Rev. Al Sharpton Jr.

title: 10 Recipes Readers Love
description: This weekend, make Sam Siftons wedge salad, David Taniss summer pasta (above) or any of the top dishes of the week. Click the 10 Most Popular Recipes collection below for more recipes.

title: When a Baby Is an Everyday Reminder of Rohingya Horror
description: KUTUPALONG, Bangladesh  In the refugee camp, Noor never got enough to eat so she mistook the fluttering feeling in her abdomen for hunger. But when it became the more insistent push of a fetus, the teenager could not ignore the sensation any longer.

title: A Week After Novichok Exposure, 2 Britons Lives Hang in the Balance
description: LONDON  Two British citizens remained in critical condition on Saturday, breathing with the assistance of ventilators and surrounded by the worlds leading experts on Novichok poisoning, their odds of survival being closely tracked by Britain and Russia.

title: Another Day, Another Upset at Wimbledon: No. 1 Simona Halep Falls
description: WIMBLEDON, England  As the top seed at Wimbledon and reigning French Open champion, Simona Halep was always going to be a focus of attention.

title: Saving Turtles in Bali, Egg by Precious Egg
description: LEGIAN, Indonesia  The people of Bali have long been of two minds about endangered sea turtles. Some want to save them. Some want to eat them.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC   Todays puzzle is a quip, really, about the inking business, the one thats more dangerous and necessary than tattooing  cartoonery.   Its an excerpt from a book by Cullen Murphy, the son of John Cullen Murphy, the artist who illustrated the Prince Valiant cartoon starting at the very beginning of the 1970s (that strip has existed since 1937, executed by a succession of artists).  At one point father (drawing), son (scripting) and daughter (coloring) contributed to the strip, which conjures up a cozy household of comic nerds.  But, as the book reveals, they were merely one cell in a massive, co-supportive hive of comic artists in Fairfield, County, Conn.

title: I Cant Believe It Really Happened: Remembering Manzanar
description: I first read the word Manzanar when I was about 8 years old. It was in a book that a teacher gave me as a parting gift when my family left San Francisco for Upper Arlington, Ohio. In case you ever feel alone, she said.

title: Russia Finally Falls, Leaving a Trail of Admirers and Doubters
description: SOCHI, Russia  It was only a couple of minutes to midnight, and Miroslav Romaschenko did not want to leave. As Croatias players bounced around in ecstasy and as Russias collapsed, disconsolate, onto their backs, the losing teams assistant manager sat down, frozen in place on the Fisht Stadiums turf.

title: Miles Mikolas Took a Wild Journey to the Cardinals Rotation
description: As the only major leaguer ever to go by the first name Miles, the St. Louis Cardinals Miles Mikolas has a fitting career itinerary: He had to travel many thousands of miles to land on the doorstep of the major league All-Star Game.

title: Its a Terrible Vote: Red-State Democrats Face an Agonizing Supreme Court Choice
description: WASHINGTON  Democratic senators running for re-election in Trump Country face an agonizing choice over President Trumps coming Supreme Court nominee: Vote to confirm the pick and risk demoralizing Democratic voters ahead of the midterm elections, or stick with the party and possibly sacrifice their own seats  and any chance at a Democratic majority in 2019.

title: The Supreme Court Show
description: In Supreme Court nominations, as in other things, Donald Trump is the master of lifting veils and making subtext text. Normally a president facing a Supreme Court vacancy makes a big show of seeking out the Most Qualified Nominee and insisting that the process should be all about rsums rather than mere politics. Meanwhile, beneath that surface everyone understands that a nomination battle can be as political as any election, with sex and race and looks and charisma mattering as much as judicial acumen.

title: Trump Should Just Give People Money
description: The Trump administration, Republicans in Congress and conservative governors across the country want the government to be simpler, smaller and more effective  unless, that is, the government is dealing with the poor.

title: Do Poor People Have a Right to Health Care?
description: The 16 Kentuckians who recently won a lawsuit challenging the legality of Medicaid work requirements include a law student with a rare heart condition, a mortician with diabetes, a mother of four with congenital hip dysplasia and a housekeeper with rheumatoid arthritis. Its a mixed bunch, united by two grim facts: They live at or below the federal poverty level, and theyre caught in the cross hairs of a debate over what society owes its neediest members.

title: For Whom the Trump Trolls
description: WASHINGTON  Donald Trump was profoundly affected by watching his older brother, Freddy, die from alcoholism at 43.

title: Americas Craft Beer Diplomacy
description: American beer is such an appealing and enduring notion  the wholesome drink of the countrys founders, baseball, summer barbecues  that its easy to forget it had to be invented.

title: Seriously, Juice Is Not Healthy
description: Obesity affects 40 percent of adults and 19 percent of children in the United States and accounts for more than $168 billion in health care spending each year. Sugary beverages are thought to be one of the major drivers of the obesity epidemic. These drinks (think soda and sports drinks) are the largest single source of added sugars for Americans and contribute, on average, 145 added calories a day to our diets. For these reasons, reducing sugary beverage consumption has been a significant focus of public health intervention. Most efforts have focused on sodas.

title: The Mets Are Missing Two Big Things: Wins and Yoenis Cespedes
description: So much has been missing from this Mets season  health, athleticism, consistency and, most important, wins. But there is something else: the star outfielder Yoenis Cespedes, the teams most dynamic hitter.

title: Progressive Populism Can Save Us From Trump
description: The recent primary upset of Joe Crowley, the fourth-ranking Democrat in the House, by Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, showcased the electoral strength of her platform, which included single-payer health insurance and tuition-free college and trade school. But soon afterward, Nancy Pelosi, the House minority leader, and Tammy Duckworth, a Democratic senator from Illinois, dismissed Ms. Ocasio-Cortezs success as strictly a local phenomenon.

title: Russia Was My Obscure Interest. Now Everyone Is Paying Attention.
description: Russia has been in the news a lot lately. You may have noticed. It invaded Ukraine, doped the Russian Olympic team, meddled in the American elections and apparently released a deadly nerve agent in the English countryside. On top of all that, it seems to have cast a spell on our otherwise supercilious president, Donald Trump, causing him to throw caution to the wind and set up a one-on-one meeting with President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki, Finland, this month.

title: Del Monte Vegetables Linked to Outbreak That Has Sickened More Than 200, Officials Say
description: More than 200 people have been infected by an intestinal parasite after reportedly eating vegetables from Fresh Del Monte Produce vegetable trays, the federal authorities said.

title: If You Could Amend the Constitution
description: To the Editor:

title: Officer Who Fired Stun Gun at Unarmed Black Man Will Not Be Suspended
description: A Pennsylvania police officer who was recorded using a Taser on an unarmed black man in a widely shared video will not be fired or suspended, officials said.

title: Insider Attack Kills U.S. Service Member in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An American service member was killed and two others were wounded in southern Afghanistan on Saturday in what officials described as an apparent insider attack.

title: Egypt Sentences Lebanese Tourist to 8 Years in Prison for Facebook Video
description: An Egyptian court sentenced a Lebanese tourist to eight years in prison on Saturday after she posted a video tirade on her Facebook page that Egyptian authorities claimed had insulted the country and its leader.

title: Person / Place / Thing
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE   Well, my brain was poached by the heat this week, and what was left uncooked was completely mesmerized by the Thailand cave rescue. So I was relieved to see a puzzle today that wasnt rocket science to me; you may feel different, which is fine, as theres no such thing as universally easy on the weekends.

title: Record Heat in Southern California, and an Ominous Start to Wildfire Season
description: LOS ANGELES  After a temperate early summer and a balmy Fourth of July, Southern California residents abruptly found themselves in a caldron of triple-digit temperatures and wildfires this weekend.

title: Health Insurers Warn of Market Turmoil as Trump Suspends Billions in Payments
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration said Saturday that it was suspending a program that pays billions of dollars to insurers to stabilize health insurance markets under the Affordable Care Act, a freeze that could increase uncertainty in the markets and drive up premiums this fall.

title: Elon Musk Thinks a Mini-Submarine Could Help in Thai Cave Rescue
description: Engineers from companies led by Elon Musk, the billionaire known for outside-the-box ideas like his aspiration to colonize Mars, were en route to Thailand on Saturday to offer their expertise to help rescue 12 boys and their soccer coach from the Tham Luang cave in northern Thailand.

title: Wimbledon Has a New Doubles Event: Tennis and the World Cup
description: WIMBLEDON, England  One notable result on Saturday was enough for the tennis fans at No. 1 Court. They had just watched Hsieh Su-wei topple the top-seeded Simona Halep in a 2-hour 20-minute, third-round match at Wimbledon that bled into the start of Englands World Cup quarterfinal match against Sweden 2,000 miles away in Samara, Russia.

title: Corrections: July 8, 2018
description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: For the Yankees, a Win Ends With Concerns About Aroldis Chapman
description: TORONTO  The Yankees attention initially focused on the left-hander who threw the first pitch of Saturdays game here, but a few hours later it shifted to the lefty who was supposed to throw the last.

title: McConnell Tries to Nudge Trump Toward Two Supreme Court Options
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader, told President Trump this past week that Judges Raymond M. Kethledge and Thomas M. Hardiman presented the fewest obvious obstacles to being confirmed to replace Justice Anthony M. Kennedy on the Supreme Court, according to Republican officials briefed on the conversation.

title: Quotation of the Day: When a Baby Is a Daily Reminder of Rohingya Horror
description: Do you think they have a pill for sadness? I would like to have that pill after the baby is born.

title: Devora Kaye, Aidan Thomas
description: Devora Shiri Kaye and Aidan King Thomas were married July 6 at the Barn at Liberty Farms, an events space in Ghent, N.Y. Christopher W. Arp, friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for this event, officiated.

title: Danielle Wainer, Paolo Di Marco
description: Danielle Wainer and Paolo Di Marco Gmez were married July 3 at the city clerks office in Manhattan. Shunya Togashi, a staff member of the New York City clerks office, officiated.

title: Lisa Hill, Theodore Ellis
description: Lisa Ann Hill and Theodore Reuben Ellis were married July 7 at Onteora Mountain House, an events space in Boiceville, N.Y. Marilyn J. Hill, the brides aunt who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: This Weeks Wedding Announcements
description: Beth Jamie Feingold sent Daisy Anna Freund an initial hello on the dating app Tinder in February 2015. They soon realized they were kindred spirits, at least when it came to advocacy for making a better food system.

title: Samantha Green, Andrew Tieniber
description: Samantha Lindsey Green and Dr. Andrew David Tieniber were married July 7 at the Morris Arboretum of the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia. Cathryn Lavery, a cousin of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Emily Salander, Felipe Maci
description: Emily Neal Salander and Felipe Pantin Maci were married July 7 at the Rhode Island Country Club, an events space in Barrington, R.I. Deanna Pantin Parrish, the grooms sister, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Kate Christobek, Luke Jepsen
description: Kate Emily Christobek and Luke Joseph Jepsen were married July 6 in New York. Bishop Robert Baker, an uncle of the groom, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola, a Roman Catholic church.

title: Khanh Le, Matthew Sedensky
description: Khanh Thuy Le and Matthew Gerald Sedensky were married July 7 at the Andaz Peninsula Papagayo Resort in Guanacaste, Costa Rica. Marcelo R. Galli, a justice of the peace in Costa Rica, officiated.

title: Kathleen McGuirk, Miles Skorpen
description: Kathleen Rose McGuirk and Miles Erik Skorpen were married July 7 at Triple S Ranch, a resort in Calistoga, Calif. Timothy Calkins, an uncle of the groom who was ordained by the American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Tess Reed, Samuel Dippo
description: Teresa Alexandra Reed and Samuel James Dippo were married July 7 at the Alta Lodge, a hotel in Alta, Utah. Judge Patricia A. Millett of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, for whom the bride served as a law clerk from 2015 to 2016, officiated. On Aug. 18, the Rev. Raymond P. Allender, a Roman Catholic priest, will lead a ceremony at St. Agnes Church in San Francisco.

title: Danielle Marshak, Evan Feinberg
description: Danielle Jacqueline Marshak and Evan Nathaniel Feinberg were married July 5 at the Candlewood Inn, an events space in Brookfield, Conn. Cantor Deborah Katchko-Gray officiated.

title: Edlyn Yuen, Jordan Christopher Pisarcik
description: Edlyn Rosanne Yuen and Jordan Christopher Pisarcik were married July 7 at the Church of the Immaculate Conception in Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Benny Prado, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Michelle Preston, Brian Kim
description: Michelle Lynn Preston and Brian Dongwon Kim were married July 7 at the Manhattan Penthouse, an event space in New York. Matthew Hoying, a Universal Life Church minister, officiated.

title: Lauren Elmets, Christian Spencer
description: Lauren Elizabeth Elmets and Christian Joseph Spencer were married July 7. The Rev. Jesse L. Vaughan performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Cathedral in Sacramento.

title: Susie Saavedra, Jose Feliz
description: Susie de Los Angeles Saavedra and Jose Luis Feliz were married July 6. The Rev. Daniel P. Kane, a priest of the Catholic Diocese of One Spirit, officiated at the Army Navy Country Club in Arlington, Va.

title: Elyse Feldman, Andrew Berman
description: Elyse Jean Feldman and Andrew Brian Berman were married July 7 at the Mansion at Natirar, an events space in Gladstone, N.J. Rabbi Matthew Gewirtz officiated.

title: David Allison, Clayton Critcher
description: David Donlan Allison and Clayton Roger Critcher were married July 7 at the deLorimier Winery in Geyserville, Calif. Mr. Critchers mother, Adrienne Pendery Critcher, became an affiliate of the American Marriage Ministries to preside at this event.

title: Melanie Pettit, Vihar Parikh
description: Melanie Katherine Pettit and Vihar Kiran Parikh were married July 6. The Rev. Philip A. Gates, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the chapel at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville. On July 7, the couple had a traditional Hindu ceremony, led by Pandit Sanjay Pathak, in Garden IX, also at the University of Virginia.

title: Lillian Newman, Jonathan Weinberg
description: Lillian Jennifer Newman and Jonathan Michael Weinberg were married July 7 at the Ritz-Carlton Bacara in Santa Barbara, Calif. Rabbi Evan Goodman officiated.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Sharp Objects and Snowden
description: A dark mystery from Marti Noxon, Gillian Flynn and Jean-Marc Valle debuts on HBO. And Oliver Stones most recent conspiracy thriller is on Amazon.

title: A Transgender Director Who Defies Genres (to Frances Confusion)
description: PARIS  No one quite knows what to do with Phia Mnards work. Is it theater? Is it dance? The Avignon Festival lists her latest creation, Saison Sche (Dry Season), which will have its premiere there, in another category altogether, the vague-sounding Indiscipline.

title: Pompeo Sharpens Tone on North Korea: The World Is a Gangster
description: TOKYO  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo shot back at North Korean officials for characterizing American diplomatic behavior as gangster-like, saying on Sunday that if that was true, then the world is a gangster.

title: Yet Another Book Takes on Impeachment: This Time, the Case Against
description: Alan Dershowitz has had a prolific publishing career: Over the past 36 years, the legal scholar and frequent television commentator has written 37 books, at the breakneck pace of roughly a book a year.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1,500,000
description: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region:

title: Foreign Belly Dancers? Egyptians Shake Their Heads (and Hips)
description: CAIRO  When undercover police officers in Egypt swooped on an upscale nightclub on the Nile last spring and arrested a Russian belly dancer, the focus of their investigation was her costume  and what, if anything, lay beneath it.

title: Fields of Green
description: HAMMONTON, N.J.  On the biggest soccer weekends, the players come from New Jersey, Canada and beyond, their noses pressed flat against car and bus windows as they marvel at the sea of fields and the even larger panorama beyond: acres of lush, green, pristine grass.

title: This Is No Time for Liberal Despair
description: The fight over President Trumps second Supreme Court nominee is going to feel frustrating for Democrats. Not long after stealing one Supreme Court seat, Republicans will have a chance to fill a second and move the court further to the right.

title: Battle Against Time: Japan Floods Leave Dozens Seeking Rescue
description: TOKYO  Record rainfall continued to batter Japan on Sunday, with millions of people being urged to leave their homes because of the risk of flooding and landslides that have already killed dozens.

title: Ethiopia and Eritrea, Longtime Foes, Meet for Peace Talks
description: For the first time since a brutal border war in the late 1990s left a violent rift between Ethiopia and Eritrea, leaders of the two nations embraced on an airport tarmac on Sunday, hinting at a new era for the two countries.

title: North Korea, World Cup, Supreme Court: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Opposition to Breast-Feeding Resolution by U.S. Stuns World Health Officials
description: [Like the Science Times page on Facebook. | Sign up for the Science Times newsletter.]

title: 3 YouTube Travel Adventurers Die in Waterfall Accident in Canada
description: Three social media stars who made a living traveling the world and chronicled their experiences online died last week after an accident at Shannon Falls, about 35 miles north of Vancouver, British Columbia.

title: New Yorks Emergency Food Program Gets More Funding, but Will It Be Enough?
description: At $24.7 million, the funding for an emergency food program represents a tiny fraction of New York Citys $89 billion budget.

title: Do You Like Dogs Playing Poker? Science Would Like to Know Why
description: If youve ever wondered whether the title on a work of abstract art  say Blue No. 2  influences how you feel about it, youll be intrigued by a new study from the University of Pittsburgh. Researchers there found that people prefer works with straightforward titles like Curved Lines or Dots of Color to those with figurative titles like Ice Dancing or Sabotage.

title: 4 Team Members Are Out of Thailand Cave, With 9 to Go
description: This page is no longer being updated. Go here for the latest news on the cave rescue. The Times has reporters on the scene and will be providing updates regularly.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. I was hoping to capture the joys of eating breakfast, Dorie Greenspan wrote in her On Dessert column in The Times this week, alongside her recipe for a Roman breakfast cake (above). She did just that. If you bake her cake today and eat it tomorrow morning with a strong coffee and a newspaper before you, itll turn you into Gregory Peck or Audrey Hepburn or both, if only for a few moments before you start the awful commute.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: The Many Costs and Confusions of Chronic Illness
description: It is unclear when I got the disease, Porochista Khakpour writes in her new memoir, Sick. Doctors have mostly pinpointed somewhere in the 2006 to 2009 range, but Ive had doctors who think Ive had it since childhood. The ailment is late-stage Lyme disease, and Ms. Khakpours attempts to treat it have often left her exhausted and troubled, questioning both her fortitude and her sanity. In Sick, she recounts the ongoing physical, emotional and financial challenges she faces. Ms. Khakpour, the author of two novels (Sons and Other Flammable Objects and The Last Illusion), talks below about the difficulty of composing a memoir, the direct style in which she chose to write it and more.

title: In Colombian Death Ranch Case, Some Fear Prosecution Will Be Buried
description: SANTA ROSA DE OSOS, Colombia  One witness told prosecutors about the corpses floating in a river on the ranch.

title: XXXTentacion Signed $10 Million Album Deal Before His Death
description: A few weeks before he was shot and killed last month, the 20-year-old rapper XXXTentacion was on the phone with the record executive who had taken the first chance on him, hammering out a contract for his much-anticipated next release.

title: Manhattan District Attorney Demands Access to Police Records
description: The Manhattan district attorneys office is locked in a battle with the New York Police Department over electronic access to disciplinary records of officers and investigative reports that prosecutors contend they need to catch bad arrests earlier in criminal proceedings.

title: Thai Soccer Team Is Rescued, and Everybody Is Happy
description: The harrowing operation to rescue a group of 12 boys and their soccer coach from a flooded cave in Thailand took 18 days and dozens of divers.

title: Trump Very Close to Supreme Court Decision, but May Wait Till Final Hours
description: BERKELEY HEIGHTS, N.J.  President Trump sought to mine a last bit of drama from his decision on a Supreme Court nominee on Sunday, saying he might need to extend the process well into Monday, just hours before he is scheduled to announce the pick in a prime-time address.

title: Review: Pam Tanowitzs Four Quartets Hits Poetic Heights
description: In her new staging of T.S. Eliots poems Four Quartets, the choreographer Pam Tanowitz has created dance theater of the highest caliber. This had its world premiere on Friday at Bard Colleges Fisher Center for the Performing Arts. After one viewing, on Saturday night, Im inclined to call this the most sublime new dance since Merce Cunninghams Biped (1999).

title: Judge Orders Brazil to Release Ex-President Lula, Setting Off Legal Uproar
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A judge in Brazil ruled on Sunday that former President Luiz Incio Lula da Silva be released from prison while he continues to appeal a corruption conviction, an unexpected decision that touched off an immediate legal and political uproar.

title: Legal Marijuana Is Coming to Canada. Investors Catch the Buzz.
description: CHESTERVILLE, Ontario  Inside garage-sized containers at one end of a cavernous warehouse in a former Nestl factory south of Ottawa are rows of marijuana plants stacked atop each other, basking in the unearthly glow of grow lights.

title: Emmanuelle Seigner, Polanskis Wife, Rejects Academy Invitation
description: The French actress Emmanuelle Seigner rejected an invitation to join the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Sunday in response to the organizations expulsion of her husband, Roman Polanski.

title: Onstage, the New Gay Agenda Involves Cake and Not Getting Fired
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass.  In 2012, Jack Phillips, a Colorado baker, citing a religious objection to same-sex marriage, declined to make a wedding cake for David Mullins and Charlie Craig. It took six years for the resulting case to be resolved  and then only narrowly  by the Supreme Courts decision in Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission last month.

title: Four Underground Rescue Efforts That Riveted the World
description: After two weeks of huddling in a flooded cave in northern Thailand, several of the 12 boys who were trapped with their soccer coach have been rescued in a harrowing extraction that could take days to complete.

title: Republicans and Democrats Face Leadership Struggles as House Returns
description: WASHINGTON  The House returns from its July Fourth recess this week in a state of remarkable uncertainty, with both Democrats and Republicans facing open questions about their leaders futures and neither party sure about which will be in control after Novembers elections.

title: Review: Lang Lang, Classical Musics Superstar, Returns Quietly
description: LENOX, Mass.  Lets just get this out of the way: There was no sign that Lang Lang, the superstar pianist and patron saint of sold-out gala concerts, was in pain on Friday night as he sailed through his first major performance since injuring his left hand over a year ago.

title: Ant-Man and the Wasp Is Marvels 20th Box-Office No. 1 in a Row
description: Even Marvels smallest characters pack a hefty punch. Ant-Man and the Wasp made $76 million at the domestic box office in its opening weekend, a figure that landed on the low side for the Disney-Marvel cinematic universe but still towered over all other releases this weekend.

title: Inside Chinas Dystopian Dreams: A.I., Shame and Lots of Cameras
description: ZHENGZHOU, China  In the Chinese city of Zhengzhou, a police officer wearing facial recognition glasses spotted a heroin smuggler at a train station.

title: Dutertes Beastly War on Drugs
description: Two more mayors in the Philippines were assassinated this month, bringing the total to at least 10 mayors killed since President Rodrigo Duterte took office in 2016. The slayings are believed to be political and related to Dutertes endorsement of extrajudicial killing connected to his policies aimed at curbing the countrys drug trade. Its estimated that more than 20,000 people have been killed in relation to the drug war to date.

title: Moguls Rub Shoulders in Idaho, and China Releases Trade Numbers
description: Some of the biggest moguls in technology and media  including Mark Zuckerberg of Facebook, Timothy Cook of Apple and Rupert Murdoch of 21st Century Fox  are expected to be in Sun Valley, Idaho, this week for an annual conference run by the investment bank Allen & Company. The gathering, which starts on Tuesday, is expected to focus on the intensifying consolidation in the media sector, and it could be the hatching ground for the next big takeover, conceived in the hallways of the resort between panel discussions.

title: The English Patient Wins Best of Man Booker Prize
description: LONDON  The English Patient, the wartime love story by Michael Ondaatje, won the Golden Man Booker Prize here on Sunday night.

title: Amazon Is Used to Promote White Supremacist Merchandise and Views, Report Says
description: Two nonprofits are criticizing Amazon for allowing its platforms to spread white supremacy and racism, identifying in a report how shoppers can buy onesies for babies stamped with alt-right images, Nazi-themed action figures and anti-Semitic books and music.

title: Plugging the Drug-Supply Gap
description: To the Editor:

title: A New Policy on Race in College Admissions
description: To the Editor:

title: Well Always Have Casablanca
description: To the Editor:

title: On Deciding to Have Children, or Not
description: To the Editor:

title: After Roy Halladays Death, Teenagers Turn Grief Into History
description: CLEARWATER, Fla.  Calvary Christian High Schools Nolan Hudi couldnt believe what he was seeing on Twitter. Someone had replied to a picture of him flying with Roy Halladay with a wish that the former major league pitcher would rest in peace.

title: Ugly Albany on Display in Federal Trials and Pension Ruling
description: ALBANY  Alleged payoffs. A taxpayer-paid pension despite disgrace. Keeping donations from your sworn enemies.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Many Still Missing as Record Rainfall Floods Japan
description: Officials have urged more than three million people to evacuate their homes.

title: Jacob Zumas Son Facing Charges in Bribery Scandal
description: CAPE TOWN  For years he seemed untouchable, protected by his family and business partners against allegations of severe graft.

title: HBO Must Get Bigger and Broader, Says Its New Overseer
description: Change is coming to HBO, now that it is part of the AT&T corporate family. That much was clear to the 150 employees who attended a recent town hall meeting at the networks headquarters in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Dawn Sturgess, British Woman Poisoned by Novichok, Dies
description: LONDON  A 44-year-old British woman who was exposed to a nerve agent died on Sunday, bringing new urgency to a four-month-old diplomatic standoff in which Britain has accused Russia of sending the poison to a small city in southern England in a botched attempt to kill a former spy.

title: Martin Sorrell Is Gone From WPP, but That Doesnt Mean Hes Gone Quiet
description: Martin Sorrell reigned as one of the most influential leaders in the advertising industry for three decades as the chief executive of the marketing colossus WPP. After he abruptly resigned in April following an investigation into alleged personal misconduct, the normally sharp-tongued, frenetic 73-year-old slipped unexpectedly out of sight.

title: Exercise Regimen
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Probably the least favorite lesson Ive had to learn in my adult life is that, in order to lose weight, calories in have to be way less than calories out. In other words, it helps to eat less and move around more.

title: Beneath a Baby Grand
description: Dear Diary:

title: Sorry, Power-Lunchers. This Restaurant Is a Co-Working Space Now.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The bar at the Elite Cafe here was packed, but not a drink was being poured. The champagne stand sat empty and warm. The tap was covered in plastic wrap.

title: Town Grieves for a Father and His Four Daughters
description: TEANECK, N.J.  The seats in the last pew at the Church of St. Anastasia here were empty during Sunday Mass.

title: NATO Matters. This Is Why.
description: As Lord Ismay, NATOs first secretary general, somewhat cheekily observed, the trans-Atlantic alliance was created to keep the Soviet Union out, the Americans in and the Germans down. Seven decades later, those goals have largely been met (yes, the Germans have risen, but in the right ways), and many people  including, evidently, the president of the United States  wonder whether the alliance still has a purpose.

title: Trump Reeks of Fear
description: I can smell Donald Trumps fear from here. His panic. His anxiety.

title: 150 Cheers for the 14th Amendment
description: Why are some events forgotten while others loom large in national memory? The Civil War, the deadliest American conflict, is a formative part of our history. Lincolns Gettysburg Address and Mathew Bradys photographs of soldiers remain etched in the public consciousness. We remember the Emancipation Proclamation, which declared that slaves in Confederate-held territory were from that point free.

title: Government Work Done, Tax Policy Writers Decamp to Lobbying Jobs
description: WASHINGTON  Six months after Republicans pushed a $1.5 trillion tax overhaul through Congress, many of the most influential players who worked behind the scenes on the legislation are no longer on Capitol Hill or in the Trump administration.

title: Woeful Mets Flirt With Being No-Hit, but Settle for a Loss
description: After starting the season with a surprising 11 wins in their first 12 games, the Mets have discovered many different ways to lose. With 49 losses in their ensuing 73 games, the losing had become somewhat routine.

title: The Yankees Went to Extra Innings, but Still Knocked Off Early
description: TORONTO  With a tiny glint in his eye, Yankees Manager Aaron Boone smiled at the thought of a crab dinner in Baltimore on Sunday night. It would be a just reward for a well-executed victory, but it would not have been possible if ESPN hadnt relented and abandoned its plans to broadcast the game in the evening.

title: In Daring Underwater Cave Rescue, 4 of 13 Thai Are Freed
description: MAE SAI, Thailand  When the wail of the ambulance siren first reached the Thai village, people started cheering: The sound meant one of the boys trapped in a cave for more than two weeks was out at last and on his way to the hospital.

title: Scott Pruitt, Fallen E.P.A. Chief, May Rise Again in Oklahoma
description: BROKEN ARROW, Okla.  Scott Pruitts brief, tumultuous tenure as the head of the Environmental Protection Agency has left him disgraced in the eyes of many in Washington and across the country. But it may not have done him much harm in his home state.

title: The Affair Season 4, Episode 4 Recap: Desensitization and Reprocessing
description: The Affair takes the work of adulthood seriously. That is different than saying that adults on The Affair always behave in a serious manner, or what passes for it in narrative fiction. Alison, Noah, Cole, Helen and all their various relatives, friends and lovers rarely make the linear progress wed like to see from ourselves, or rise and fall in the more predictable arcs we enjoy from television characters.

title: SpongeBob Musical Will Close on Broadway and Plan for a Tour
description: SpongeBob SquarePants: The Broadway Musical, unable to find its sea legs, will close on Sept. 16 after less than a year on stage.

title: Sharp Objects Series Premiere Recap: Incorrigible
description: Camille Preaker cant separate the present from the past. She may have left her tiny Missouri hometown years ago, but the place still haunts her dreams. In the opening scenes of Sharp Objects, two girls roller skate past the towns border, then sneak into a Victorian mansion. But when they reach the second floor of the home, it transforms into Camilles cluttered St. Louis apartment. The older girl, who turns out to be a younger version of Camille (Sophia Lillis), awakens the woman they find asleep in bed by digging into her hand with a paper clip.

title: Sharp Objects: Jean-Marc Valle on the Series Premiere and Underdog Storytelling
description: For the HBO series Sharp Objects, which debuted Sunday night, the Montreal-born director Jean-Marc Valle brought viewers into a starkly different world from the coastal California portrayed in Big Little Lies, his last major project for the network. Based on the gothic thriller by Gillian Flynn, it trades the opulent mansions, private schools and bourgeois coffee shops of Monterey for the run-down houses and dive bars of small-town Missouri. In place of murder, new money and helicopter parents, its murder, old money and hog slaughterers.

title: Frank Ramsey, First Among Sixth Men in the N.B.A., Dies at 86
description: Frank Ramsey, the Boston Celtics Hall of Famer who pioneered pro basketballs sixth man role with hot shooting and savvy defense coming off the bench while playing on seven N.B.A. championship teams, died on Sunday at a hospital in Evansville, Ind., about 50 miles from his home in Madisonville, Ky. He was 86.

title: Quotation of the Day: U.S. Opposition to Breast-Feeding Resolution Stuns World Health Officials
description: What happened was tantamount to blackmail, with the U.S. holding the world hostage and trying to overturn nearly 40 years of consensus on the best way to protect infant and young child health.

title: No Corrections: July 9, 2018
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, July 9, 2018.

title: Xiaomis Weak I.P.O. Raises Doubts About Chinas Tech Boom
description: HONG KONG  Xiaomis public debut was supposed to value the Chinese gadget maker at $100 billion and set the stage for a global coming-out party for some of Chinas most successful technology companies.

title: At Wimbledon, Surprise Guests Arrive for Manic Monday
description: WIMBLEDON, England  After a week of results with little regard to the rankings, nearly half of the players who reached the second week of Wimbledon  15 of 32  are unseeded.

title: Mothers in Tennis Grow in Influence
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Evgeniya Rodinas daughter is always on her mind, but she was conspicuously out of sight Friday when Rodina upset Madison Keys in the third round at Wimbledon. Anna, a rambunctious 5-year-old, cannot sit still in the players box, and her movements can distract Rodina from her business on the court. Rodinas husband, Denis Shteyngart, is also her coach, so he has to watch her, not their child.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Monday: In a World  and The Workers Cup
description: In a World  imagines an industry with more female voice actors. And The Workers Cup centers on a soccer tournament for migrant workers in Qatar.

title: Why Your Brain Tricks You Into Doing Less Important Tasks
description: Heres a list of things I did before starting this newsletter: I filled out the documents to renew my passport; clipped my cats nails; bought some household items; responded to a few Instagram DMs; and ate a snack because I was hungry.

title: Case Against Reuters Journalists in Myanmar Moves to Trial
description: A judge in Myanmar ruled on Monday that two jailed Reuters reporters would face trial, a decision widely seen as a setback for free speech in a country led by the onetime democracy icon Daw Aung San Suu Kyi.

title: The Bizarre Theater of the World Cup Press Conference
description: MOSCOW  No one expects scintillating Socratic dialogue, or even normal reportorial discourse, at a World Cup news conference. But even by the tournaments relaxed standards, the opening remark to Russias coach the day before his team played Spain last week was unusually obsequious.

title: Stoppage Time Has Been Filled With Goals
description: There have been 23 goals scored in the 90th minute and second-half stoppage time so far in this World Cup, shattering the previous high of 14, set four years ago in Brazil.

title: Theresa May in Fight to Save Government Amid Brexit Rift
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain was battling to save her government on Monday after her foreign secretary quit in protest over her approach to withdrawing from the European Union. The resignation deepened a mood of crisis just eight months before the country is due to leave the bloc.

title: Overlooked Stories From Latin American Photographers
description: In the South Bronxs Melrose neighborhood, second only to Times Square as New Yorks busiest, residents may soon find plenty of reasons to stop and enjoy the view.

title: 8 Saved, 5 to Go in Thai Cave Rescue
description: This page is no longer being updated. Go here for the latest news on the cave rescue. The Times has reporters on the scene and will be providing updates regularly.

title: How to Recover Like an Elite Athlete
description: The best part of any exercise class is the few minutes of cooling down and recovery at the end. And, it turns out, it doesnt just feel great; there has been a slow sea change in how we view recovery.

title: Drink Up! Most of Us Could Benefit From More Water
description: I wonder how we all survived  and even thrived  in our younger years without the plethora of water bottles that nearly everyone seems to carry around these days.

title: Sometimes Patients Simply Need Other Patients
description: When Jodie Ofosuhene learned she had breast cancer at age 29 in 2016, she got more than standard medical care. She was connected with Noel Peters, a former patient who serves as a mentor to new ones. Noel helped me tremendously, Ms. Ofosuhene said in an interview. Every time I had a question about my response to treatment  whether it was normal  she had answers from her own experience.

title: The Memories Hiding in My Data Dump
description: The first message I saw when I downloaded my Facebook data referenced a long-forgotten encounter. Eleven years ago, two weeks before my senior year of high school, I had  apparently  written an angry note to a guy on a clunky Dell desktop (no iPhones yet) from the bedroom I shared with my sister at our parents home in Brooklyn.

title: What if the Government Gave Everyone a Paycheck?
description: GIVE PEOPLE MONEY How a Universal Basic Income Would End Poverty, Revolutionize Work, and Remake the World By Annie Lowrey 263 pp. Crown. $26.

title: In the Middle Class, and Barely Getting By
description: SQUEEZED Why Our Families Cant Afford America By Alissa Quart 320 pp. Ecco/HarperCollins Publishers. $27.99.

title: Once Colombias Deadliest City, Buenaventura Is Coming Back
description: At Stall 06 in the dilapidated temporary quarters of the Pueblo Nuevo market, Rosana Angulo was getting frustrated with my persistent queries about that days lunch options.

title: In Southwest Colombia, Treasures Are Forbidden No More
description: The morning my guide, Juliana Chvez, met me in Popayn, at the southern point of Colombias verdant Valle de Cauca, she warned me that the drive ahead of us that day would be rough and long. Our destination was San Agustn, home to some of South Americas most compelling archaeological finds that during the more than five decades of war here had been difficult if not impossible to visit  yet only 80 miles from Popayn, the nearest city.

title: Trump Chooses Brett Kavanaugh for the Supreme Court
description: President Trump selected Brett M. Kavanaugh as his nominee to replace Justice Anthony M. Kennedy on the Supreme Court.

title: Behind the Bar, Mixing Drinks With Aid for a Faraway Home
description: WASHINGTON  Sambonn Lek, bartender at the St. Regis hotel near the White House, has shaken and stirred for movers and shakers since the Carter administration. At 66, he leads a disappearing fraternity: barkeeps who know their regulars names and favorite cocktails, and when they drink so much of the latter that they forget the former, find them a ride home.

title: In Texas, a Decades-Old Hate Crime, Forgiven but Never Forgotten
description: [For more coverage of race, sign up here to have our Race/Related newsletter delivered weekly to your inbox.]

title: A Los Angeles Transplant Decides to Stay
description: Some eight years ago, Revalyn Gold sublet her apartment in Los Angeles to a friend and moved to New York to take care of her aunt Helen, who lived in Morningside Heights.

title: On a Colombian Savanna, Hawks, Caimans and So Many Stars
description: The pond-side trees appeared to be turning red as flocks of scarlet ibis flew in to roost, brilliant from their bills to their toes. They dueled with egrets over the best perches, squawking raucously. A squadron of chubby capybara  the worlds largest rodents  idled in the muddy shallows before suddenly charging off, churning the water, lunging and splashing. As darkness fell, the birds settled in, the wind died and the place became tranquil. A caiman slipped quietly into the muddy water. The first stars appeared low in the eastern sky, and night fell over the Colombian llanos.

title: Border Patrols Last Line of Defense? It Isnt at the Border
description: FALFURRIAS, Tex.  Human smugglers now charge vastly more for clandestine journeys into the United States than just a few years ago. Checkpoints like this one in Falfurrias, on the highway north from the border toward San Antonio, help explain why.

title: What Babies Know About Their Bodies and Themselves
description: We are accustomed to thinking about the importance of what even very young babies see and hear, but touch is the first sensory system to develop in the babys brain prenatally, and is quite well developed by the time the baby is born, said Andrew Meltzoff, the co-director of the Institute for Learning and Brain Sciences at the University of Washington.

title: Trumps Retreat From the West
description: When future generations look back to the first weeks in June 2018, the summit meeting in Singapore between President Trump and North Koreas president, Kim Jong-un, may well be remembered not so much for its impact on the threat of nuclear war in Korea, but for the dissolution of the West as a unified negotiating team driven by Western values. Along with that came Americas emergence as a go-it-alone superpower, with those values set aside in deference to Russia and China.

title: Thailand, Supreme Court, Brexit: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What Is a Southern Writer, Anyway?
description: NASHVILLE  From time to time, a debate resurfaces in Southern literary circles about whether there can still be a recognizable literature of the South in an age of mass media and Walmart. The 21st-century South would be unrecognizable to the Agrarian poets, whose 1930 manifesto, Ill Take My Stand, set out many of the principles that still cling like ticks to the term Southern writer. Far more urban, far more ethnically and culturally and politically diverse, the South is no longer a place defined by sweet tea and slamming screen doors, and its literature is changing, too. It is damn hard to put a pipe-smoking granny or a pet possum into a novel these days and get away with it, the novelist Lee Smith once said.

description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Deporting the American Dream
description: Mexico City  To hear the Trump administration talk about the immigrants it has deported back to Mexico, you would think they were all criminals and potential drains on the nations economy and welfare system, with no interest in participating in what used to be called the American dream.

title: Amid Japans Flood Devastation, Survivors Dig Out
description: KURASHIKI, Japan  As rain poured and the creeks and rivers that course through the city of Kurashiki began to rise, Miyuki Komada repeatedly tried to call her 70-year-old mother, who was home sick with a cold.

title: Nissan Workers in Japan Falsified Emissions Tests, Review Says
description: Nissan Motor has become the latest Japanese automaker to admit to falsifying product-quality data, dealing a further blow to Japan Inc.s reputation for dependable quality.

title: NATO Allies Prepare to Push Back at Trump (but Not Too Much)
description: BRUSSELS  NATO summit meetings were once ritualistic events, with the member nations assembling to proclaim that the alliance had never been stronger and pledging to work together on the security issues of the day.

title: Bicoastal Pairing of Curators for Next New Museum Triennial
description: The New Museums next Triennial, which focuses on emerging artists from around the world and will take place in 2021, is to be curated by Margot Norton of the New Museum and Jamillah James of the Institute of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles, the museum announced on Monday.

title: Mens and Womens Tours Join Forces for New Competition With Equal Pay
description: The PGA and L.P.G.A. tours are teaming with a global professional services firm to initiate a first-of-its-kind contest, a season-long risk-reward competition that will pay a $1 million bonus to the mens and womens winners.

title: A Black Man Wore Socks in the Pool. After Calling the Police on Him, a Manager Got Fired.
description: A white manager of a Memphis apartment complex was fired after she called the police on a black man wearing socks in the pool on the Fourth of July.

title: Romanian Prosecutor Who Took On Entrenched Corruption Is Fired
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  Romanias president dismissed the head of the countrys anticorruption agency on Monday, indicating that a court ruling had left him no choice. The move, while long predicted, raises concerns about prosecutorial independence in a country that ranks among the more corrupt in Europe.

title: How to Unlock Your Phone for Overseas Travel
description: Q. What does it mean for a mobile phone to be locked in regards to international travel? Does that mean it will not work overseas?

title: California Today: Jerry Browns $14.9 Million Campaign War Chest
description: Good morning.

title: What the Heck Is That?: IONA
description: The entry IONA has appeared in The New York Times Crossword a total of 326 times, but when clued as the small island off the coast of Scotland, solvers seem to lose their way. Perhaps they are getting it confused with the Isle of Ione Skye. In fact, we covered this a couple of weeks ago and people are still missing it, so we thought it would be a good idea to do it again.

title: John Isner Tries to Wring Happy Memories From His House of Horrors
description: WIMBLEDON, England  A plaque mounted to the exterior of Wimbledons Court 18 commemorates John Isners winning the longest match in tennis history there eight years ago.

title: Orcas of the Pacific Northwest Are Starving and Disappearing
description: SEATTLE  For the last three years, not one calf has been born to the dwindling pods of black-and-white killer whales spouting geysers of mist off the coast in the Pacific Northwest.

title: What to Cook Today
description: Good morning. It was crowded again this morning, no? Heavy traffic out on the road, in the tunnel, on the pier where the ferry docks, everywhere worker bees scurry after a light week bisected by holiday, everyone sad-anxious to get back to work. The festive spirit of independence is gone, drifted away like smoke. Its summer for sure right now, the bill coming due.

title: Tab Hunter, 86, 1950s Hollywood Heartthrob, Is Dead
description: Tab Hunter, the tall, blond, blue-eyed movie star who as a teenage idol in the 1950s was one of the last products of the Hollywood studio system  and who made an unlikely comeback in a very un-Hollywood film when he was almost 50  died on Sunday in Santa Barbara, Calif. He was 86.

title: Michele Roberts on N.B.A. Competitive Imbalance: Dont Blame the Players
description: Michele Roberts has heard the complaints about the N.B.A.s best team, the Golden State Warriors, signing an All-Star. She has heard the whining about the leagues best player, LeBron James, moving westward in the first week of free agency. She has seen fans and pundits proclaim the league isnt competitive enough, and has watched the blame for that land on the doorstep of the National Basketball Players Association and its decision three years ago to reject a league proposal to prevent the limit on player salaries from rising faster than ever before.

title: How A Different World Survived the Downfall of Bill Cosby
description: For many, The Cosby Show has become unwatchable since the dozens of sexual assault allegations against Bill Cosby entered the media spotlight. Some networks, such as TV Land, have pulled the show from their lineups. (Others, like Bounce TV, initially did the same, only to resume airing reruns up until the verdict came in this year. It remains available to stream on Amazon Prime Video.)

title: Chinas Taste for Soybeans Is a Weak Spot in the Trade War With Trump
description: XIAOWUSILI, China  For all its economic might, China hasnt been able to solve a crucial problem.

description: In our series My Detox, T asks creative people to share the homemade recipes they count on to cleanse and refresh.

title: Its Easy. Its Impressive. Its Dinner.
description: I always thought of my mom as an impressive home cook. When I was growing up in the San Fernando Valley, she made things that felt a bit fancy in a California-in-the-90s way, like steamed artichokes with lemon butter and toasted rice pilaf, sun-dried tomatoes scattered on everything.

title: A Fire Killed 32 at a New Orleans Gay Bar. This Artist Didnt Forget.
description: NEW ORLEANS  In 1973, the UpStairs Lounge, a bar in the French Quarter here, went up in flames one hot summer night. Thirty-one men and one woman died in what was then the largest mass killing of gay people in American history. (The Pulse nightclub shooting in Orlando, Fla., which killed 49 people, took that grim title in 2016.) Long considered arson, the case remains unsolved; the prime suspect, who was never charged, committed suicide a year after the fire. As time passed, little attention was paid to the victims.

title: Judge Rejects Long Detentions of Migrant Families, Dealing Trump Another Setback
description: LOS ANGELES  The Trump administration on Monday lost a bid to persuade a federal court to allow long-term detention of migrant families, a significant legal setback to the presidents immigration agenda.

title: Marine General Used His Aide as A.T.M., Laundry Service and Gym Attendant
description: A Marine general in charge of approving airstrikes against Islamic State fighters in Iraq violated ethics rules when he had a junior officer run personal errands for him and lend him cash, the Pentagons inspector general reported on July 5. The I.G. report found that Brig. Gen. Rick Uribe requested or allowed his aide, who was not named, to pick up his laundry, deliver meals and snacks, arrange for delivery of his prescription toothpaste to Iraq and handle his personal correspondence, among other tasks, while he was deputy commanding general of operations and director of joint anti-ISIS operations between May 2016 and June 2017. On multiple occasions, he also ordered her to stand next to and reserve gym equipment that he wanted to use, sometimes making her wait up to 40 minutes while he was called away.

title: Archies 700th Issue Moves the Riverdale Gang in New Directions
description: Archie Andrews, the seemingly eternal redhead from Riverdale, and his friends will be getting new creative teams later this year that will take some cues from the CWs Riverdale television series and explore new terrain for the characters.

title: Irans Shaming of Young Dancer Draws Backlash
description: TEHRAN  Like many teenage girls, Maedeh Hojabri liked to dance in her bedroom, record it and post clips to Instagram.

title: Review: Antigone Asserts Whose Lives Matter, With Modern Relevance
description: A makeshift shrine sprawls across the base of an imposing concrete facade  flowers, stuffed animals, deflating balloons, a profusion of glowing candles. The wall is chalked with graffiti, and placards lean against it: RIP Eteocles, say his name, black lives matter.

title: Where Trump Goes in Britain, Protesters Will Follow
description: LONDON  In London, a giant orange balloon depicting him as a baby having a tantrum will float over Parliament. There will be a wall of sound featuring mariachi music and the cries of children in detention centers calling out for their parents. In Scotland, a newspaper has demanded that he leave, and a Carnival of Resistance involving throwing rubber boots at a Trump doll is being planned.

title: Mastering Chinese-Style Ribs at Home
description: In any city,  a promising sign that youve arrived in a serious Cantonese food zone is a siu laap: a storefront dedicated to roasted and cured meat. For meat lovers, its a beautiful sight: racks of mahogany-skinned birds, sugar-shiny slabs of pork ribs, and all that thrillingly saturated, sticky redness.

title: Facebooks Push for Facial Recognition Prompts Privacy Alarms
description: When Facebook rolled out facial recognition tools in the European Union this year, it promoted the technology as a way to help people safeguard their online identities.

title: Women Set Londons Stages Ablaze
description: LONDON  The schoolteachers choice of color is a promise and a warning. Portrayed with a vitality that sears and illuminates by a truly incandescent Lia Williams, the title character of the Donmar Warehouse production of The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie is first seen amid a world of subdued grays in an alarmingly red dress.

title: The Rape Jokes We Still Laugh At
description: In this video Op-Ed, Rodney Roussell tells his painful story for the first time on camera. In 2004, Rodney was incarcerated in Orleans Parish Prison for 8 months. Later, he was convicted of check fraud, and spent several years in prison in another Louisiana parish. Rodney claims he was raped and sold into sexual slavery for $20 in commissary items during his confinements.

title: New Jersey Woman on Oxygen Dies After Electric Company Shuts Off Her Power
description: New Jersey officials said on Monday they were investigating why a utility company shut off power last week at the Newark home of a woman in hospice care who then died after her electric-powered oxygen tank stopped operating.

title: Frances Macron Defends His Business-Friendly Stance
description: PARIS  Faced with declining poll numbers and suspicions that he favors the rich, President Emmanuel Macron of France fiercely defended his business-oriented approach in a speech on Monday, declining to renounce policies that have seen decreases in taxes for the wealthy as well as in protections for workers.
