In a statement, the board said the decision had unfortunately become necessary to restore this unique cultural institutions ability to operate at full capacity.

title: How It Got Riskier to Own High-Quality Corporate Bonds
description: Bonds issued by United States companies with strong balance sheets have been delivering the weakest returns of all major American bond categories this year, adding to the headaches of fixed-income investors.

title: In a Tight Labor Market, Retirees Fill Gaps Their Previous Employers Cant
description: Soon after Ilana Benet retired from her job as a labor and delivery nurse, it hit her: She missed the babies. And her employer missed her.

title: Grilling of the F.B.I. Agent
description: To the Editor:

title: Rainbow Furniture, Nighties and More Things T Editors Like Right Now
description: About a decade ago, the Swedish designer Fredrik Paulsen began creating furniture from pine stained with impressionistic swaths of brilliant color, resembling a summer horizon on fire. The technique was labor intensive to the point that he began to think of himself as the anti-Ikea" because of the time it took to produce a single unique piece.

title: A Giant Iceberg Parked Offshore. Its Stunning, but Villagers Hit the Road.
description: It was a striking sight: a huge iceberg looming over a tiny Arctic village. Ice is ubiquitous along Greenlands coast, but this giant has put the inhabitants of the village, Innaarsuit, population 169, on edge.

title: Trump Invited the Russians to Hack Clinton. Were They Listening?
description: WASHINGTON  It was one of the more outlandish statements in a campaign replete with them: In a news conference in July 2016, Donald J. Trump made a direct appeal to Russia to hack Hillary Clintons emails and make them public.

title: The Real F.B.I. Election Culprit
description: In his testimony before two House committees on Thursday, the F.B.I. agent Peter Strzok testified that he could have altered the 2016 election  but didnt. The information about Russian election interference, he said, had the potential to derail, and quite possibly, defeat Mr. Trump. But the thought of exposing that information never crossed my mind.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: Young & Isolated
description: Feeling like an outcast doesnt mean that youre alone.

title: U.N. Imposes Arms Embargo on South Sudan as Atrocities Go Unabated
description: After nearly five years of war, mayhem, widespread hunger and recurring atrocities including mass rapes in South Sudan, the United Nations Security Council took the extraordinary step Friday of imposing an arms embargo on the African country, the worlds youngest.

title: Scarlett Johansson Withdraws From Transgender Role After Backlash
description: The actress Scarlett Johansson has withdrawn from her role in the newly announced movie Rub & Tug after facing a backlash, mainly from transgender actors, for taking on the role of a transgender man.

title: 12 Russians Charged: Major Highlights of the Indictment and Rod Rosensteins Statement
description: Rod J. Rosenstein, the deputy attorney general, on Friday announced new charges against 12 Russian military intelligence officers accused of hacking the Democratic National Committee, the Clinton presidential campaign and the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee.

title: What Fridays Indictments Mean
description: Today we learned that the special counsel, Robert Mueller, has obtained indictments charging that 12 Russian military intelligence officers engaged in a conspiracy to subvert our democracy. The indictments demonstrate that Mr. Mueller, the Department of Justice and a federal grand jury agree with a conclusion that the intelligence community, the Senate Intelligence Committee and a majority of Americans long ago reached: The Russian government was unambiguously responsible for the attack on our election. The direct and specific evidence of Russian interference laid out in the indictment  both by hacking into Democratic Party accounts and into actual state election commissions  is immensely significant.

title: Downloadable Gun Clears a Legal Obstacle, and Activists Are Alarmed
description: Learning to make a so-called ghost gun  an untraceable, unregistered firearm without a serial number  could soon become much easier.

title: I Didnt Want Co-Sleeping to End
description: Have you gotten used to sleeping alone?

title: Nawaz Sharif Is Arrested on Return to Pakistan, Amid Turmoil and Bloodshed
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif and his daughter and political heir Maryam were arrested at the Lahore airport Friday night on corruption charges as they returned to the country in an attempt to rally their beleaguered party days before national elections.

title: Democrats Say Trump Should Cancel Putin Meeting After Indictments
description: WASHINGTON  Leading Democrats called Friday for President Trump to cancel his upcoming meeting with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia after the Justice Department indicted 12 Russian intelligence officers accused of hacking Democrats emails and computer networks during the 2016 presidential race.

title: U.N. Agrees on Migration Pact, but U.S. Is Conspicuously Absent
description: The United Nations on Friday completed an agreement on improved ways to handle the global flow of migrants  a pact particularly notable because it was boycotted by a huge and influential member, the United States.

title: Remembering Oliver Knussen: The Week in Classical Music
description: [Read all of our classical coverage here.]

title: U.S. Lifts Ban That Kept ZTE From Doing Business With American Suppliers
description: The Trump administration on Friday lifted a ban on the Chinese telecommunications firm ZTE that had pushed the company to the brink of financial collapse by preventing it from acquiring parts and software from American companies.

title: The Hacking Indictments
description: To the Editor:

title: Cuomo Moves Closer to Marijuana Legalization in New York
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo took a step closer to voicing full-throated support for legal marijuana on Friday, embracing elements of a state Health Department report that favored legalization.

title: Bitcoin Funds Are Rare: They Sail Uncharted Waters
description: Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin are on their way to being the next big thing or yesterdays news. Their novelty makes it hard to tell which.

title: Was Russia 2018 the Greatest of All World Cups?
description: MOSCOW  Some time around Frances virtuoso victory against Argentina and Belgiums breathtaking comeback against Japan, the planet seemed to come to a decision. Russia 2018, it was universally decided, had not just been a good World Cup, and not just a great World Cup. It had, in fact, been the best World Cup.

title: Drug to Treat Smallpox Approved by F.D.A., a Move Against Bioterrorism
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday approved the first drug intended to treat smallpox  a move that could halt a lethal pandemic if the virus were to be released as a terrorist bioweapon or through a laboratory accident.

title: Russia, Trump, Migrants: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Totally Preventable: How a Sick Woman Lost Electricity, and Her Life
description: NEWARK  Linda Daniels had fallen behind on her electricity bills, her meter run up by medical equipment going around the clock and increasingly hot weather. But on July 3, her family said, they pulled together $500 to pay down her debts, believing it would maintain her service.

title: Cuomos Rivals Look to Tie Him to Corruption Convictions of Top Aides
description: ALBANY  The conviction of Alain E. Kaloyeros, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos economic development guru, on federal corruption charges on Thursday has provided a timely and powerful cudgel to a raft of critics and political opponents running to replace him.

title: When It Comes to NATO, Do Actions Count More Than Budgets?: the Canada Letter
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau was probably relieved, although not pleased, that his German and British counterparts were the targets of President Trumps wrath before and after this weeks NATO summit meeting in Brussels. As was the case in the aftermath of last months Group of 7 meeting in Quebec (when Mr. Trump called the prime minister weak and dishonest), the presidents brand of diplomacy in Europe provided a mix of bashing the United States closest allies, demands, ultimatums and threats  veiled and direct.

title: Nathaniel Reed, 84, Champion of Floridas Environment, Is Dead
description: Nathaniel Reed, an environmentalist who led conservation fights throughout Florida and helped turn the Endangered Species Act into law while serving as an assistant secretary of the Interior in the 1970s, died on Wednesday in Quebec City. He was 84.

title: Warning Lights Are Blinking Red, Top Intelligence Officer Says of Russian Attacks
description: WASHINGTON  The nations top intelligence officer said on Friday that the persistent danger of Russian cyberattacks today was akin to the warnings the United States had of stepped-up terror threats ahead of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

title: Richard Elden, Innovative Hedge Fund Investor, Is Dead at 84
description: Richard Elden, a journalist-turned-investment manager who was an early investor in a number of notable hedge funds, died on June 27 at his home in Chicago. He was 84.

title: Friday Night Music: Warpaint, Beetles
description: As someone whos done a lot of research and writing over the years, I always have mixed feelings when someone enthuses about a paper I published in, say, 1991. On the one hand, its great to know that people appreciate my work. On the other hand, couldnt they pick something a bit more, you know, recent?

title: Is Baby Powder Dangerous? Does Industry Even Care?
description: A St. Louis jury this week ordered Johnson & Johnson to pay $4.69 billion, one of the largest amounts ever awarded in a product liability case, to 22 women and their families who say the company failed to warn people that its talcum-based baby powder contained dangerous levels of asbestos. The plaintiffs argued that years of daily use caused the women to develop ovarian cancer; six of them have died from the disease.

title: FEMA Admits It Failed Puerto Rico. Can It Do Any Better?
description: A report by the Federal Emergency Management Agency has now confirmed, in brutal detail, what has long been evident: Its response to the killer hurricanes that struck Puerto Rico last fall was chaotic and tragically inadequate.

title: Paychecks Lag as Profits Soar, and Prices Erode Wage Gains
description: Corporate profits have rarely swept up a bigger share of the nations wealth, and workers have rarely shared a smaller one.

title: How to Meet Autistic People Halfway
description: One of the most widely held beliefs about autistic people  that they are not interested in other people  is almost certainly wrong. Our understanding of autism has changed quite a bit over the past century, but this particular belief has been remarkably persistent.

title: Friday the 13th, a Tattoo Holiday
description: Friday the 13th is the patron day of black cat crossings, devious witches, shattered mirrors, suspicious ladders  and cheap tattoos.

title: How Russian Spies Hid Behind Bitcoin in Hacking Campaign
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In early 2016, Russian intelligence officers obtained a new pool of the virtual currency Bitcoin. They quickly put the digital money to work.

title: In Brexit, Trump Finds a British Reflection of His Own Political Rise
description: WASHINGTON  The day after Britain voted to exit the European Union in 2016, Donald J. Trump landed in Scotland and promptly declared the referendum result a great thing.

title: Its Time to Depopularize Populist
description: Lets do away with the word populist. Its become sloppy to the point of meaninglessness, an overused epithet for multiple manifestations of political anger.

title: 2 Plead Guilty to Manslaughter in Gas Explosion That Killed a Fire Chief
description: Two men pleaded guilty on Friday to manslaughter charges in the death of a Fire Department battalion chief in an explosion of a Bronx house that had been used to grow marijuana, the authorities said.

title: Did Harvey Weinstein Admit to Trading Movie Roles for Sex?
description: A longtime London magazine columnist and friend of Harvey Weinsteins on Friday published  and then seemingly took back within hours  a bombshell piece that quoted Mr. Weinstein admitting to using his position of power in exchange for sexual favors.

title: Fake News Goes Global as Trump, in Britain, Rips the Press
description: He shouted down a question from CNN, calling the network fake news. He knocked NBC News for such dishonest reporting. He falsely accused the London tabloid The Sun of cherry-picking quotes from an interview and complained about a photograph in The New York Times that, he said, made it look like he had a double chin.

title: How Do You Say Witch Hunt in Russian?
description: You might expect that an American president, presented with the indictment of a dozen Russian military officers for engaging in a concerted, yearslong cyberattack on American democracy, would be outraged and demand justice.

title: From Truman to Trump, Queen Elizabeth Has Met 12 U.S. Presidents
description: WINDSOR, England  As a princess and the heir to Britains throne, she visited President Harry S. Truman in Washington and gave him a gift from her ailing father, King George VI. Later, as Queen Elizabeth II, she danced with President Gerald R. Ford and rode on horseback alongside President Ronald Reagan.

title: Its Like Each Day Is a Year: A Migrant Mothers Wait for a Reunion
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex.  The mother in Room 211 was separated from her 17-year-old daughter by Border Patrol agents after they had crossed the Rio Grande on a tire. Since then, it had been 40 days. The same number as her age.

title: U.S. Delegation and Mexicos Next President Aim to Reset Relations
description: MEXICO CITY  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo led a high-level cabinet delegation to Mexico City on Friday to gauge how Mexicos president-elect intends to reset the fractious relationship between the two countries.

title: How Russia Hacked the Democrats in 2016
description: An indictment from the special counsel investigating Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election explains how 12 Russian intelligence officers hacked the Democratic National Committee and Hillary Clintons campaign.

title: Losing Yourself in a Good Book
description: I am wistful for the days I spent reading as a child: passionate and obsessed, devouring books as fast as I could get my hands on them.

title: To Know Mixed Doubles Place in Tennis, Look at the Prize Money
description: WIMBLEDON, England  According to the authoritative new book The Birth of Lawn Tennis by Bob Everitt and Richard Hillway, when Maj. Walter Clopton Wingfield published the first set of rules for the sport in 1873, the lone illustration showed a mixed doubles match.

title: America First, America Hated, America Alone
description: Some near-forgotten anniversaries are worth commemorating. One hundred years ago   Bastille Day, 1918  Theodore Roosevelts youngest son, Quentin, was killed in aerial combat at the Second Battle of the Marne. Twenty-six years later, Quentins oldest brother, Ted, also died in France, after landing at Utah Beach on D-Day.

title: Gap Between Trump and Justice Dept. Officials Grows Starker
description: WASHINGTON  Strolling past red-uniformed guardsmen at Windsor Castle on a gloriously sunny Friday, the queen of England at his side, President Trump was savoring the moment, broadcast live to his supporters back home.

title: At Uber, New Questions Arise About Executive Behavior
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Barney Harford was hired late last year to help fix problems at Uber, the ride-hailing company. Instead, he has created new ones.

title: Man Tried to Burn Down Condo to Kill All Jews, Police Say
description: Walter Edward Stolper was facing eviction and stewing with anger at his Jewish neighbors in Miami Beach when he threatened to take revenge, the authorities said on Friday.

title: Nerve
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE   Kameron Austin Collins is a very architectural constructor  this staircase grid, for example   and todays pinwheel is geometrically unique among Times puzzles. I thought it difficult, maybe the hardest Saturday to dig into for the last few months. Without long stacks, it made for several discrete challenges; I solved it corner by corner, pretty much, and had the least trouble with the center diamond.  The northwest quadrant was my Waterloo  you may have felt different.

title: This Weeks Biggest Stories in American Politics
description: In a Monday prime-time special, President Trump named Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit to fill Justice Anthony M. Kennedys seat on the Supreme Court. A conservative stalwart of the Washington establishment, Mr. Kavanaughs nomination is the culmination of a three-decade push for a reliable conservative majority on the United States highest court.

title: Syndergaard Returns for Five Innings in Mets Win Over Nationals
description: In the seven weeks since pitcher Noah Syndergaard landed on the disabled list, the Mets lost their general manager to illness, lost more players to injuries, and sunk to the worst record in the National League.

title: Yankees, With No Lead to Protect Against the Indians, Get to Rest Aroldis Chapman
description: CLEVELAND  If the Yankees were seeking a silver lining after their 6-5 loss to the Cleveland Indians on Friday night, at least one was obvious. With no lead to protect, they had no need for closer Aroldis Chapman, whose balky left knee will keep him from pitching in Tuesdays All-Star Game.

title: Drought and Drone Reveal Once-in-a-Lifetime Signs of Ancient Henge in Ireland
description: It took an unusually brutal drought for signs of a 5,000-year-old monument to suddenly appear in an Irish field, as if they had been written into the landscape in invisible ink.

title: Quotation of the Day: Amid the Trumpian Chaos, Europe Sees a Strategy: Divide and Conquer
description: Mr. Trumps insults and his unpopularity among European voters make it harder for European leaders to do what he wants them to do, like increase military spending, even when they think they should do it.

title: Corrections: July 14, 2018
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Peeking Around Corners in the World Cups Provincial Cities
description: NIZHNY NOVGOROD, Russia  Olga B. Kalinina and Albina Marunova live in the so-called socialist town, a collection of low-rise Soviet cottages that sit along the highway that links the airport with the center of their city, one of 11 in Russia that hosted matches at this summers World Cup.

title: Trump Walks in Front of Queen Elizabeth, Causing Social Media Frenzy
description: Queen Elizabeth II may not have been amused, but the Twitterati certainly were.

title: Nancy Barbato Sinatra, 101, an Idols First Wife and Lasting Confidante, Dies
description: The church in Jersey City where they married held a portent in its very name: Our Lady of Sorrows.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Baby Driver and Short Term 12
description: The heist film of last summer airs on Showtime. And Short Term 12, with a young Lakeith Stanfield, is streaming on Amazon.

title: A Crisis Management Guru Bungles a Crisis
description: LONDON  When Sir Alan Parker was appointed chairman of Save the Children U.K. in 2008, he must have seemed like the perfect choice. As the founder and head of Brunswick Group, one of the most successful corporate public relations firms in the world, he had connections with chief executives, celebrities and media moguls as well as politicians on both sides of the political divide. Charming and boyishly effusive, he earned millions leading a business that now has 1,000 employees in 14 countries, all of them shaping narratives for companies in the public eye.

title: For a Moment, Underdog Croatia Basks in World Cup Joy
description: DUBROVNIK, Croatia  When Croatias national soccer team scored the goal that took it past England and into its first World Cup final, delirious fans lit flares and burned tires outside the towering limestone walls of the old city in Dubrovnik.

title: Emirati Prince Flees to Qatar, Exposing Tensions in U.A.E.
description: LONDON  The defection of an Emirati prince to Qatar has provided a rare glimpse into tensions among the rulers of the United Arab Emirates and added an awkward complication to its feud with Qatar, its regional rival.

title: In Todays Art Market, the Male Gaze Is Not a Good Look
description: LONDON  Taste is changing. When private collectors and public museums acquire works of art, these acquisitions are being made in a very different cultural climate from that which prevailed in the late 20th century, let alone the late 19th.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. If youre a sports fan this is going to be a good one, with tennis and soccer finals coming at you. If not, well, it might be a good weekend to sleep late and catch up on some Emmy-nominated TV or just to read some fantastic journalism.

title: Breast-Feeding or Formula? For Americans, Its Complicated
description: For as long as there have been babies, there have been debates over how to feed them.

title: These Ads Reveal How Women Candidates Are Changing Campaigns
description: Candidates like Abby Finkenauer are ditching ads showing them in pantsuits and instead focusing on their personal stories.

title: Feeling That Old Urge to Merge, but in a Vertical Way
description: Ive got the urge to merge  and couldnt be more excited.

title: A Second Life for a Saratoga Springs Showpiece
description: Rooms recently started at $384 a night. Prices spike during thoroughbred racing season in the second half of the summer, as they do all over town.

title: The Joe Beef Empire in Montreal Expands With an Appealing Newcomer
description: One can become fast friends with a stranger. The same can happen with a new restaurant. Mon Lapin, which opened in March, immediately puts one at ease, like slipping into a long-shared history. This magic is thanks to the particularly Qubcois qualities of generous hospitality and a spirit of pleasure that David McMillan, Frdric Morin and Allison Cunningham have cultivated in their Joe Beef family of restaurants.

title: In Town With Little Water, Coca-Cola Is Everywhere. So Is Diabetes.
description: SAN CRISTBAL DE LAS CASAS, Mexico  Maria del Carmen Abada lives in one of Mexicos rainiest regions, but she has running water only once every two days. When it does trickle from her tap, the water is so heavily chlorinated, she said, its undrinkable.

title: Forget Suits. Show the Tattoo. Female Candidates Are Breaking the Rules.
description: The guys at the union hall have just swapped out the first keg when Abby Finkenauer, Democratic candidate for Congress, arrives and immediately reveals the kind of vulnerability that campaign consultants have long told women to avoid.

title: Cleaning Toilets, Following Rules: A Migrant Childs Days in Detention
description: Do not misbehave. Do not sit on the floor. Do not share your food. Do not use nicknames. Also, it is best not to cry. Doing so might hurt your case.

title: These Women Were Told Not to Play Soccer. Instead They Formed a Team.
description: Away from the lights of the World Cup, on the African archipelago of Zanzibar, a group of Muslim women are challenging a culture that says only men can play soccer.

title: Sex Ed, for Grown-Ups
description: Dominick Quartuccio was concerned about his libido, which hed noticed was slowing down as he reached 40. The prevailing social narrative is that youre getting old, so go get a pill, Mr. Quartuccio said. An executive coach, he helps clients speak candidly about their anxieties  romantic and sexual, sometimes, as well as professional  and preferred to do the same.

title: Young & Isolated
description: Feeling like an outsider is one of the hallmarks of adolescence, but in todays episode we hear from two 16-year-olds who have cause to feel especially isolated. One girl is home-schooled and rarely leaves the house. When she does get out, shes crippled by social anxiety. A second girl feels disconnected from her best friend, who has suddenly become popular at school. Both letter writers wonder if theyll ever feel comfortable in their own skin.

title: The Impolite Pleasure of People-Watching
description: Before cellphones were fun, when the idea that anything may distract you from New Yorks never-ending street theater was unimaginable, I would watch the world happen around me. Observation is, in many ways, a glorified lack of activity, focused attention without a clear purpose. But then again, purpose is so seldom an explanation for behavior.

title: The Education of a Brotelier
description: Wearing a red vintage T-shirt, an Eric Church baseball cap and a backpack, Ben Weprin bound down a sidewalk of Roosevelt Island in New York, home of the Cornell Tech campus, a satellite of Cornell University, looking like a college student on the first day of class.

title: In Trumps U.K. Visit, Some See Infomercial for Money-Losing Golf Resort
description: GLASGOW  On Monday, President Trump will have a closely watched meeting with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, just days after the announcement that 12 Russian military intelligence officers had been indicted on charges of hacking Democratic organizations in an effort to affect the 2016 election.

title: Could You Make It Through Dinner Without Checking Your Phone?
description: When Marc and Kara Lyons take their family out for a nice dinner, they typically hand their two sons cellphones to play games and watch YouTube videos. Sometimes, the parents grab the devices back to check their own email and text messages.

title: At Summit Meetings, Kremlin Often Tried to Steamroller U.S. Presidents
description: Whether in Helsinki or elsewhere, a summit meeting held by any American president with a Kremlin counterpart has proved to be a momentous occasion, particularly during the Cold War when such talks held the promise of staving off Armageddon.

title: Death Toll in Pakistan Suicide Bombing Rises to 128
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The death toll in a suicide bombing that targeted an election campaign event in southwestern Pakistan rose to 128 on Saturday, the deadliest terror attack in the country this year.

title: Should Democrats Have Saved Their Filibuster for the New Court Fight?
description: WASHINGTON  In the days leading up to the vote on Judge Neil M. Gorsuchs confirmation to the Supreme Court in the spring of 2017, Senator Susan Collins approached Senator Michael Bennet on the Senate floor with an urgent plea.

title: A Romantic Turnaround for Two Political Scientists
description: Lauren Anastasia Wright and Jonathan Mummolo were married July 14 at the home of the brides parents in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif. Justin Grimmer, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion and is a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Long Distance Brought Them Closer Together
description: Marla Shane Becker, a daughter of Heidi D. Becker and Dr. Douglas A. Becker of Minnetonka, Minn., was married July 14 to Daniel Mark Thau, the son of Jill Cohen Thau and Clifford L. Thau of Quogue, N.Y. Rabbi Simeon Glaser led the ceremony at Temple Israel Congregation in Minneapolis.

title: A Full Member of FIFA, Kosovo Finds Its Flag Barred From World Cup Stadiums
description: MOSCOW  After years of trying and failing, Kosovos soccer association finally got what it wanted two years ago when FIFA granted it full membership, welcoming it into a club of more than 200 national federations.

title: 8 Critically Endangered Black Rhinos Die in Kenya
description: Eight black rhinoceroses died after being transported from a national park in Kenya to a sanctuary meant to help preserve their critically endangered species, the government said on Friday.

title: A Co-op Forgot to Send the Storage Bill  for Eight Years. Must the Resident Pay?
description: Q: I am the president of the board of a tight-knit, 15-unit co-op in Manhattan where residents feel like extended family. We recently discovered that one of our shareholders hasnt ever been charged for his storage space, which costs $40 a month. His eight years of missed fees add up to about $3,800. Board members are divided about how to proceed: Some think we should bill him for the whole amount; others think we should split it with him; and others think that he isnt liable since it was the buildings error. Ethics aside, what are our legal responsibilities?

title: Youth Soccer Participation Has Fallen Significantly in America
description: CHICAGO  With its gables, turrets and iron railing, U.S. Soccer House  as the mansion housing the U.S. Soccer Federation is known  looks more like a fortress than the headquarters of a major sports organization. It is fitting: The federation is on the defensive.

title: In India, a Missing Key to a Temples Treasure Vault Ignites a Furor
description: PURI, India  A group of men in loincloths assembled outside a 12th-century temple on a hot April day in Puri, India, preparing to venture deep inside to a pitch-black vault where piles of gold and silver jewelry were stored under lock and key.

title: Our Best Burgers, From Meaty to Meatless
description: A summer scenario: You plan a cookout around a wide variety of dietary requests, and youre prepared. The menu includes Sam Siftons diner-style smash burgers, Melissa Clarks ultimate veggie burgers (above) and Mark Bittmans salmon burgers. You consult Sam's burger guide and find all your questions answered. On the big day, plates are clean and the compliments roll in.

title: Dont Be Putins Puppet
description: A Ukrainian activist in exile warns President Trump about the modern Russian czar.

title: Dont Be Putins Puppet
description: In this video Op-Ed, the co-founder of the Ukrainian feminist group Femen, Sasha Shevchenko, urges President Trump to be wary of President Vladimir Putin of Russia when they meet in Helsinki on Monday.

title: Can You Guess These Three Surprising Energy Trends?
description: Conservatives argued that addressing climate change would send prices skyrocketing. Heres what actually happened.

title: Djokovic Outlasts Nadal, in a Mere 5 Hours and 15 Minutes
description: WIMBLEDON, England  A day after losing the longest semifinal match in Wimbledons history, John Isner signed off from the tournament on Saturday morning with a tweet expressing gratitude for the support he had received, and also issuing an apology.

title: The World Cup Final Is Upon Us. What Have We Learned?
description: Here we are. The final match of the 2018 World Cup has almost arrived, and it has been as thrilling a tournament as I can remember. As Maximus, Russell Crowes character in Gladiator, famously yelled, Are you not entertained?

title: Teachers Unions Scramble to Save Themselves After Supreme Courts Blow
description: ALBANY  The team of teachers pulled up to the school custodians house on a steamy summer day hoping to close the deal. They had been there twice with no luck, and Marsel Kovaci was proving to be a hard sell.

title: Influential Judge, Loyal Friend, Conservative Warrior  and D.C. Insider
description: When Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh introduced himself to the American people on Monday, with a beaming President Trump beside him, he had a lot to say about his mother, a former high school teacher and a Maryland judge. He accorded his father strikingly less attention  just 34 words, compared with 132 about his mother  mentioning his unparalleled work ethic while not saying exactly what work he did.

title: Embattled Russia Finds Unlikely Ally: English Soccer Fans
description: MOSCOW  A few English men surveyed the scene in Moscows World Cup fan zone, a pedestrian street lined with bars. In the deepening twilight on a recent evening, the streetlights twinkled on. Russian women turned up, wanting to practice English. In the balmy air, small droplets of condensation formed on glasses of chilled beer.

title: Before an Arrest, Officers Tossed a (Virtual) Coin
description: After police officers saw a woman speeding on a wet road in Georgia they pulled the driver over and conferred about whether to arrest her.

title: On a Path to Expand the View of Blackness
description: It seems like hardly a week goes by without a headline about the collision of race, politics and education on American campuses, as policymakers, students and activists battle over hot-button words like diversity and fairness. Often, they speak about groups of people  black students, Latino students, Asian students rather than focusing on individuals.

title: Variety: Marching Bands
description: VARIETY PUZZLE   We dont run Marching Bands that often, and I imagine theyre a time-consuming bear to construct.  Joel Faglianos sophomore attempt is pretty great; I confess that Im pretty sure its my freshman attempt to solve one of these imposing bricks of solid letters.

title: No Storybook Ending for Serena Williams. Instead, a Wimbledon Title for Angelique Kerber.
description: WIMBLEDON, England  The focus has understandably been on Serena Williamss comeback this season.

title: 13 Teams Over 16 Seasons, but He Is More Than a Journeyman
description: From the start, Edwin Jackson has known that a baseball career does not always go smoothly. It was the first lesson he absorbed as a professional, roughly half a lifetime ago.

title: Trump Opens His Arms to Russia. His Administration Closes Its Fist.
description: WASHINGTON  It was a jarring moment, even for an American leader whose curious attraction to Russia has often resulted in mixed messages from the United States.

title: We Need to Offer More Than Asylum
description: Money, love and fear.

title: We Are All Supreme Court Skeptics Now
description: Democracy is in peril. The majority no longer rules; a determined minority has the whip hand. The least accountable branch of government, the Supreme Court, has fallen into the hands of an aggressively counter-majoritarian faction, which intends to traduce self-government for ideological ends. The time has come to consider drastic countermeasures against our robed masters and their nascent tyranny.

title: Taking Away the Phones Wont Solve Our Teenagers Problems
description: Apple has introduced new software designed to help users restrict the time they spend on their phones  just change your settings and your favorite app will lock you out after a certain number of hours. Its been especially welcomed by parents who fret about the habits of their screenagers  young people who seem permanently attached to their mobile devices.

title: Trump, Having a Bawl in Europe
description: WASHINGTON  I had dinner with Vladimir Putin once. He made me lose my appetite.

title: Get Yourself a Giant Dog
description: When I got a puppy, I didnt put her photo on social media for weeks because I was afraid shed die or Id have to give her back.

title: Forget a Fast Car. Creativity Is the New Midlife Crisis Cure.
description: Remember those days? When a midlife crisis meant swapping your hatchback for a sports car, preferably red, or taking up a boozy, illicit affair?

title: Everyone Has an Accent
description: I have an accent. So do you.

title: Benefits, Work, and Poverty
description: Back in 2014 Paul Ryan declared that the War on Poverty had failed, so it was time to slash spending on anti-poverty programs. Last week the Trump Council of Economic Advisers declared not only that the War on Poverty has in fact substantially reduced poverty  which is what progressives have been saying all along  but that poverty is largely over. (Do these people ever visit the real world?)

title: The New York Yankees Are a Moral Abomination
description: Soberly considered, the New York Yankees and their fans present a moral dilemma. Our consciences, naturally abhorring everything abominable, tell us that such things simply ought not exist. And yet we also know that the evil they represent is one we would not really want eradicated. Somehow we depend on it, not because it appeals to some morbid subliminal fascination with the horrific in us, and not even because it teaches us about the worlds deep Darwinian laws, but because it answers to a psychological need.

title: What Adults Can Learn From Dutch Childrens Books
description: NIJMEGEN, the Netherlands  It is an often overlooked fact that one of the easiest ways to learn about a foreign culture is through the books it produces for its children. Shortly after my family moved to the Netherlands last summer, we discovered zoekboeks (pronounced zhook-book) the genre of kids picture books that invite you to search (zoek) for characters, objects or events obscured by visual busyness. English-language books for kids are hard to come by here, and we didnt speak or read Dutch yet, so the wordless zoekboek was a welcome find.

title: A Winning Strategy for Democrats?
description: To the Editor:

title: What Elon Musk Should Learn From the Thailand Cave Rescue
description: Silicon Valley moguls seem to believe they can fix most anything, and they appear befuddled when their attempts to do so arent met with unbridled enthusiasm.

title: 2 Killed in Gaza, 4 Wounded in Israel, in Most Intense Fighting Since 2014 War
description: JERUSALEM  Two Palestinians were killed in an Israeli airstrike and four Israelis were wounded by mortar fire from Gaza on Saturday as fighting in and around the Gaza Strip escalated to what the Israeli prime minister called the most intense level since the 2014 war.

title: See Ya Later, Suckas! The Obituary of a 5-Year-Old Boy in His Own Words
description: Garrett Matthias, 5, thought about what his funeral would look like one day. He didnt want a solemn gathering; he wanted a carnival-like atmosphere.

title: Complimentary
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE   In two respects, this puzzle brought to mind an expression we all know. You may have learned it in school or at a religious institution, but my earliest memory of it is here:

title: Judge Criticizes Trump Administration for Response to Family Reunification Order
description: The federal judge who ordered the swift reunification of thousands of migrant families sharply chastised the Trump administration late on Friday, after it said that complying with the judges order would increase the risk of harm to children.

title: Soon Only One Blockbuster Will Be Left in the United States
description: The Blockbuster video store in Bend, Ore., stands steely and determined, defending itself against the expanding forces of digital streaming services like Netflix and HBO, whose charm is that customers need not get up from the couch.

title: Croatians Savor the Present, but Keep One Fateful Foot in the Past
description: Does your father have a shrine to Boban?

title: Two Student Protesters Killed in Nicaragua Church Siege
description: MEXICO CITY  Paramilitary forces backed by Nicaraguas government killed two people early Saturday during a 12-hour siege on a Managua church where student protesters had sought refuge, a Catholic Church official said, in an episode that underlined the countrys escalating political unrest.

title: French President to Meet Russian Leader a Day Ahead of Trump
description: PARIS  The French soccer teams win in the World Cup semifinals this past week handed Frances president an unexpected opportunity to meet the Russian president face to face at a moment of tension between the Continent and the United States.

title: Mike Bryan, Without His Twin, Wins Mens Doubles at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  As is his habit, Mike Bryan walked into a news conference at Wimbledon on Saturday and identified himself to the stenographer, so he could be distinguished from his partner.

title: Tennis Coach Brad Stine Is Back in the Spotlight With Kevin Anderson
description: WIMBLEDON, England  It has been 25 years since Brad Stine coached a Wimbledon finalist. He was part of Jim Couriers team when Courier reached his last Grand Slam final, in 1993, losing at the All England Club to Pete Sampras.

title: Quotation of the Day: Forget Suits. Show the Tattoo. Female Candidates Are Breaking the Rules.
description: These different women who are running, and the way theyre running, is going to change politics forever. Theyre rewriting the playbook. But we dont know exactly what the new playbook will look like.

title: Carolyn Chuong, John Holgate
description: Carolyn Peysue Chuong and John Austin Holgate were married July 14 at the World Forestry Center in Portland, Ore. Sasha Susan Kraus Rosse, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: This Weeks Wedding Announcements
description: Lauren Wright was a new Ph.D. student in American government at Georgetown in the fall of 2011. She was instantly attracted to Jonathan Mummolo, a second-year Ph.D. student with casual good looks in jeans and rolled-up shirt sleeves, intently leading an orientation meeting.

title: Angelina Maravi-Foster, Robert Sackoor
description: Angelina Victoria Maravi-Foster and Robert Yunus Sackoor were married July 14 at the Garden City Hotel in Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Mark Giller, a minister ordained by the Sanctuary of the Beloved, a church in Conesus, N.Y., officiated.

title: Croatia, Cast in Underdog Role, Has the Look of a Champion
description: MOSCOW  Something was bothering Croatias players and staff members as they reflected on the game that had brought them to the brink of greatness, and on the month that may culminate in what would  by most estimations  be the greatest achievement in World Cup history.

title: Dana Burkart, Jason Radmacher
description: Dana Renee Burkart and the Rev. Jason Paul Radmacher were married July 11 in Cherokee Park, a public park in Louisville, Ky. The Rev. Richard Ryan, a Baptist minister, officiated.

title: Taylor Lustig, Sean Savett
description: Taylor Jaye Lustig and Sean David Savett were married July 14 at the Standard Club in Chicago. Rabbi Debra Nesselson officiated, with Rabbi Linda J. Holtzman, a maternal aunt of the groom, taking part in the ceremony.

title: Alexandra Shevach, Ajay Premkumar
description: Alexandra Leah Shevach and Dr. Ajay Premkumar were married July 14 at Lansdowne Resort and Spa in Leesburg, Va. Rabbi Deborah A. Reichmann officiated. Earlier in the day, Kosuri Shobhanadri, a Hindu priest, led the couple in a traditional Hindu wedding ceremony.

description: Lisa Blau Kahn and Michael Gene Giacomelli are to be married July 15 at the Aurora Inn, a hotel in Aurora, N.Y. Christopher Stanton, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate.

description: Marie Margaret Ternes and Micah Brook Boster were married July 14 at Stone Tavern Farm in Roxbury, N.Y. Rabbi Joshua Bolton officiated.

title: Caitlin Elfring, Shamisa Zvoma
description: Caitlin Elizabeth Elfring and Shamisa Zvoma were married July 14 in New York. Cindy C. Blakis-Bakhler, a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Sunset Terrace at Chelsea Piers.

title: Gary Giglio, Veronica Ruelas
description: Veronica Maria Ruelas and Gary Thomas Giglio were married July 13 at the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park. The Rev. Gino Vacaro, a minister with the Kingdom Life Church in New Port Richey, Fla., officiated.

title: Zoey Orol, Jonathan Yehuda
description: Zoey Frances Orol and Jonathan Yehuda were married July 14 by Rabbi Geoffrey Mitelman at Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Maisie Clark, Daniel Bilotti
description: Margaret Anne Clark and Daniel Kavanaugh Bilotti were married July 14. Thomas M. Barron, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the Family Farm, a retreat in Woodside, Calif., for a private San Francisco mens club.

title: Ryan Hanrahan, Paul Donato
description: Ryan Francis Hanrahan and Paul Daniel Donato are to be married July 15 at the Harbor Lounge, a cocktail lounge in Provincetown, Mass. Mark Ojakian, a friend of the couple who obtained a one-day marriage designation for the occasion from the state of Massachusetts, is to officiate.

title: Chicago Police Fatally Shoot Man, and Then a Crowd Confronts Officers
description: CHICAGO  A Chicago police officer fatally shot a man Saturday evening on the citys South Side, angering nearby residents who gathered at the scene in large numbers and confronted officers for several hours.

title: 1 Double and 2 Errors Later, Austin Romine Scores the Yankees Winning Run
description: CLEVELAND  Yankees Manager Aaron Boone may tout the sneaky athleticism of his backup catcher Austin Romine, but he cannot do it with a straight face.

title: Major Chain in Canada Pulls Ivanka Trumps Clothing
description: OTTAWA  Canadas largest full-line department store chain, the Hudsons Bay Company, has pulled clothing, shoes and other merchandise bearing Ivanka Trumps fashion brand from its website and said it would wind down their sale in its stores across the country.

title: Feinstein Has Advantages in California Race. De Len Now Has Party Leaders.
description: LOS ANGELES  The first rebuke to Senator Dianne Feinstein came in February, when the California Democratic Party delivered 54 percent of its convention vote to her opponent, Kevin de Len, a state senator  just short of the 60 percent he needed for the partys endorsement.

description: We have combined all 169 impassioned cries by Telemundo's announcers into one lung-bursting goal call.

description: ATLANTA  It has become the deplorables moment of the Georgia governors race.

description: No major candidacy has been announced yet in the Democratic Party, and the 2018 midterms are front and center. But the next presidential election looms large for the party.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1,000,000
description: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region:

title: Warren Is Preparing for 2020. So Are Biden, Booker, Harris and Sanders.
description: RENO, Nev.  During a campaign-style tour of the West late last month, Senator Elizabeth Warren did not announce she was running for president. But in private events and public speeches, her message about 2020 was as clear as it was rousing.

title: Just Sitting Down With Trump, Putin Comes Out Ahead
description: MOSCOW  When President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia sits down with President Trump in Helsinki, Finland, on Monday for a meeting he has long wanted, he will already have accomplished virtually everything he could reasonably hope for.

title: California Is Preparing for Extreme Weather. Its Time to Plant Some Trees.
description: MODESTO, Calif.  For years, there has been a movement in California to restore floodplains, by moving levees back from rivers and planting trees, shrubs and grasses in the low-lying land between. The goal has been to go back in time, to bring back some of the habitat for birds, animals and fish that existed before the state was developed.

title: Paul Ryan Says His S.U.V. Was Eaten by Animals. Heres How to Protect Your Vehicle From Wildlife.
description: Speaker Paul D. Ryan last week told the story of the undoing of his trusty Chevrolet Suburban.

title: World Cup, Trump, Putin: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Theresa May Says Trump Told Her to Sue the E.U. in Brexit Talks
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May on Sunday revealed the advice President Trump had given her on how to negotiate Britains withdrawal from the European Union: Go straight to court.

title: Sacha Baron Cohen Has Been Duping Politicians for Decades. Here Are Some Greatest Hits.
description: The premiere of Sacha Baron Cohens new Showtime series, Who Is America?, received a publicity push far wider than the network probably imagined  thanks in part to the pre-emptive public statements (and disavowals, and condemnations) by many of its American political subjects. In the days since the network released a trailer for the series featuring Dick Cheney, several other prominent figures have stepped forward to claim they were duped by Mr. Cohen, including Sarah Palin, Roy Moore, the former Arizona sheriff Joe Arpaio and Congressman Matt Gaetz of Florida.

title: Trump, on Eve of Putin Meeting, Calls E.U. a Trade Foe
description: HELSINKI, Finland  President Trump on Sunday spent the eve of his first summit meeting with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia finding fault with allies, Barack Obama and the news media while refraining from condemning Moscow for its meddling in the 2016 presidential election.

title: How France Won Its Second World Cup Title
description: MOSCOW  Frances first goal arrived off a Croatians head, and its second only after the intervention of the Argentine referee.

title: Watch New Yorkers React to the World Cup
description: The agony and ecstasy of watching the games at various bars and cafes in New York City.

title: Trump Has Yet to Award the National Arts Medals for 2016
description: For decades the United States has recognized its greatest artists  about a dozen each year  with a national medal, an award created by Congress and typically distributed each year by the president at a White House ceremony.

title: Parks Give Cambridge a Rural Vibe. But Cows Do It Better.
description: CAMBRIDGE, England  Some residents of Cambridge are so fond of their local cattle that only Latin can do justice to their feelings.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Childhood summers went so slowly, stretched out over months as if theyd never end. Now they flash. One minute youre restoring that old grill out on the deck, replacing a grate or a valve, painting a rust spot, locating some hardwood so you can cook over live fire, anticipating the warm and fragrant months to come. The next its the middle of July, strawberries gone and sour cherries on their way out, passable corn coming in from the farms down south, pretty good tomatoes, too, and before long therell be fireworks going for Labor Day and everyone back in hard shoes for those meetings with the senior VPs, the kind that end with resets and pivots, everyone laddering up toward deliverables, iterative releases, the language of woe.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Refugee Says, Call Me American
description: Abdi Nor Iftin was 6 years old when civil war broke out in Somalia, his home country. Violence and uncertainty became constants in his life. Another constant was Mr. Iftins obsession with American culture. He taught himself English by repeatedly watching action movies like Rambo and Commando. Eventually, he defied the odds to win the diversity visa lottery, which admits immigrants to the United States from countries that do not send many people here. Its a program that President Trump wants to end. In Call Me American, Mr. Iftin details his harrowing childhood in Somalia, his escape to Kenya and his ultimate move to America. He now lives in Portland, Me., where he works as a translator for other Somali immigrants. Below, he talks about the trauma of revisiting his memories, how his book  and his thoughts about the United States  changed after Trumps election and more.

title: F.B.I. Confidence in Leadership Fell in Year After Comeys Firing
description: WASHINGTON  One year after President Trump fired the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, agents say they have less confidence in the ethics and vision of the bureaus new leadership, according to internal survey data.

title: Seeking a Second Chance at Landmark Status, Aluminum Siding and All
description: Year after year for more than a decade now, Karen Karbiener has led summer-semester students from Columbia University along a side street in Brooklyn framed in the distance by the rusty-looking trestle of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway. They hoped to cross the threshold in the middle of the block that Walt Whitman crossed when he lived there, which was when he published Leaves of Grass.

title: With a Wimbledon Win, Novak Djokovic Reclaims a Place at the Top
description: WIMBLEDON, England  How far has Novak Djokovic come in 2018?

title: How Israel, in Dark of Night, Torched Its Way to Irans Nuclear Secrets
description: TEL AVIV  The Mossad agents moving in on a warehouse in a drab commercial district of Tehran knew exactly how much time they had to disable the alarms, break through two doors, cut through dozens of giant safes and get out of the city with a half-ton of secret materials: six hours and 29 minutes.

title: We Are United: Frances World Cup Win Brings Together a Nation
description: BONDY, France  The cheers could be heard all the way from Calais to Marseille when the final second ticked past and France was the indisputable victor of the 2018 mens soccer World Cup final on Sunday.

title: Review: Doctor Atomic Brings the Bomb Home to New Mexico
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  We must first devise a demonstration, a nuclear scientist sings in the opera Doctor Atomic. Where there wont be any people. Not on a city. Or a demonstration right here in the desert.

title: Review: In Marie and Bruce, It Takes Two to Do This Nihilistic Tango
description: Wallace Shawns 1979 play of marital discordance begins with a woman telling her sleeping husband that shes planning to leave him. In most stories, this would mark the end of the relationship. But Marie and Bruce, which is being revived at Brooklyns Jack, is considerably more perverse than most stories.

title: Design for Charleston Attack Memorial Draws on Pain, Strength and Forgiveness
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Three years after a racist blood bath in its fellowship hall  and 200 years after its defiant founding as one of the Souths first black congregations  Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C., unveiled designs on Sunday for a contemplative memorial to the nine victims and five survivors of the horrific attack.

title: Pussy Riot Members Detained After Running Onto Field at World Cup Final, Police Say
description: MOSCOW  Members of the political activist group Pussy Riot said they staged a disruption of the World Cup final between France and Croatia on Sunday by running onto the field while wearing police uniforms.

title: Chinese Billionaire Asks to Delay Prison Sentence Yet Again
description: When Ng Lap Seng, a Chinese billionaire, was sentenced to four years in prison in May in a wide-ranging bribery case, the judge gave him two months  until July 10  to begin serving his time.

title: Hotel Transylvania 3 Towers Over Skyscraper at Box Office
description: Dwayne Johnson can save cities, but he couldnt defeat a vacationing cartoon vampire at the box office. Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation made $44.1 million in domestic ticket sales over the weekend, easily besting Mr. Johnsons Skyscraper.

title: Man Arrested in Scotland After Paraglider Unfurls Anti-Trump Banner
description: LONDON  The police in Scotland have arrested a 55-year-old man in connection with a paragliding protest timed to coincide with President Trumps arrival on Friday night for a weekend of golf.

title: Banks Report Earnings, and Google Faces Antitrust Fines
description: Will big banks keep clocking big profits? JPMorgan, Citigroup and Wells Fargo kicked off earnings season for the largest United States banks on Friday, revealing another quarter of strong growth despite a relatively small increase in lending. Bank of America reports its second-quarter results on Monday morning, followed by Goldman Sachs on Tuesday and Morgan Stanley on Wednesday. Trading revenue won't be what it was during the busy beginning of 2018, but the banks are trying to make up for lackluster markets by cultivating other businesses like wealth management and consumer finance.

title: U.K. Poisoning Inquiry Turns to Russian Agency in Mueller Indictments
description: LONDON  The same Russian military intelligence service now accused of disrupting the 2016 presidential election in America may also be responsible for the nerve agent attack in Britain against a former Russian spy  an audacious poisoning that led to a geopolitical confrontation this spring between Moscow and the West.

title: Trump Takes His Best Shot
description: How will Donald Trumps tactics land?

title: Venezuela, the New Regional Crime Hub
description: MEDELLN, Colombia  Venezuela has become a regional crime hub, with profound consequences for Latin America and beyond. And with another Nicols Maduro term, the roots of organized crime in that country will spread further.

title: William McBride, Who Warned About Thalidomide, Dies at 91
description: William McBride, who was among the first doctors to sound an alarm about thalidomide, the sedative found to cause birth defects, but whose later career was marred by accusations of falsified research results and other misconduct, died on June 27 in Australia. He was 91.

title: Review: Sacha Baron Cohen Is Back. Should We Care?
description: This time Sacha Baron Cohen ambushed all of us. His new Showtime series, Who Is America?  his first television show since Da Ali G Show went off the air in 2004  was announced just last week and makes its debut on Sunday night, riding a short but intense wave of hype.

Barries 1904 play, spangled with Leonard Bernsteins neglected music.

title: Len Chappell, 77, College All-American and N.B.A. All-Star, Dies
description: Len Chappell, an All-American at Wake Forest who became an N.B.A. All-Star forward with the Knicks in the early 1960s, died on Thursday at a hospice in Oconomowoc, Wis., a suburb of Milwaukee. He was 77.

title: Inside the Mating Rituals of Brands and Online Stars
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Recently at the Anaheim Convention Center, about 50 people entered a room decorated as a stylish lounge for a speed dating event. They moved from table to table every 20 minutes, exchanging small talk and getting to know each other.

description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Henry Adamson is breaking up with his bookie.

title: Review: A Serious Look at the Life of Robin Williams
description: Despite its title, Robin Williams: Come Inside My Mind is a straightforward, conventionally assembled documentary biography of an eccentric, decidedly idiosyncratic comedian and actor. At times thats a limitation, but overall its a good thing. Simply watching Williams in action is probably more interesting than any concerted effort to get inside his head or dissect or approximate his method.

description: In Paris, Moscow, New York and Chicago, fans took to the streets to celebrate the World Cups champion.

title: Suspect Killed and Three Officers Wounded in Kansas City Gunfight
description: A man evading arrest and wielding a rifle shot and wounded three police officers during a lengthy search and firefight in Kansas City, Mo., on Sunday afternoon. The episode ended when the police killed the suspected gunman.

title: Doomsday Prepping for Another Round of Tariffs
description: A protracted, escalating cycle of trade tensions has begun. In the latest action, the United States has proposed a 10 percent tariff on $200 billion in Chinese goods. This follows a tariff on $50 billion of imports from China. Together, the value of targeted goods amounts to nearly half of all American imports from China last year, and countermeasures by China are expected.

title: Judge Orders Los Angeles Times to Delete Part of Published Article
description: LOS ANGELES  A federal judge ordered The Los Angeles Times to remove information from a published article on Saturday, a step that legal experts said was extremely unusual and conflicted with the First Amendment. The newspaper said it was appealing the order.

description: Put aside whatever suspicions you may have about whether Donald Trump will be directly implicated in the Russia investigation.

title: Cyrano Behind Bars

title: White House Orders Direct Taliban Talks to Jump-Start Afghan Negotiations
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Trump administration has told its top diplomats to seek direct talks with the Taliban, a significant shift in American policy in Afghanistan, done in the hope of jump-starting negotiations to end the 17-year war.

title: From Mind Games to Election Hacking: Russias Trolling Tactics Explained
description: Cyberattacks. Little green men. Frozen conflicts. These are just a few of the tactics Russia and its leader, Vladimir V. Putin, have used to try to disrupt the world order.

title: Review: Trainspotting Live Has (Gross) Humor but Not Enough Heart
description: Eating breakfast? Nibbling on anything at all? You might want to give this a skip until youre done. In the immersive British import Trainspotting Live, at Roy Arias Stages, the gross-out factor is gleefully high. Wouldnt want you to gag.

title: Aaron Boone Teaches the Yankees Accountability by Saying Sorry
description: CLEVELAND  As Aaron Boone sat in the visitors dugout Sunday morning, he did the things a manager does: He revealed his starting rotation for the coming games, allowed that he keeps an eye on the rival Red Sox (I see they win every day, he said with a smile) and laid out his own plans for the All-Star break  a trip to Six Flags and plenty of pool time and barbecue with his four kids.

title: Tracing Guccifer 2.0s Many Tentacles in the 2016 Election
description: The message from WikiLeaks in July 2016 to a group of Russian intelligence officers who prosecutors say were posing as a Romanian hacker named Guccifer 2.0 urged swift action before the opening of the Democratic National Convention that month.

title: Quotation of the Day: Seat at Table Gives Putin Upper Hand
description: He has to handle it right or else his Helsinki love fest could just blow up.

title: After Storm, Foreclosures in Puerto Rico Stopped. Theyre Starting Again.
description: The foreclosure machine that ground to a halt in Puerto Rico after the devastation caused by Hurricane Maria in September is slowly cranking up again. Island residents who fell behind on their payments are facing creditors ranging from Wall Street to the federal government.

title: Corrections: July 16, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: The Right Way to Lose the Kavanaugh Fight
description: The press never tires of the Democrats in disarray story line, but that doesnt mean its always wrong. Its latest manifestation concerns the pickle Senate Democrats are in with respect to the coming hearings for Brett Kavanaugh, President Trumps nominee for the Supreme Court.

title: $88 Million and Counting: Trump Amasses Huge Head Start for 2020 Campaign
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has raised more than $88 million for his re-election campaign over the last year and a half, giving him a dramatic head start on prospective Democratic challengers in the 2020 race.

title: Sharp Objects Episode 2 Recap: Magical Thinking
description: Detective Richard Willis is learning that his logic doesnt necessarily apply in Wind Gap, Mo. Early in this weeks episode of Sharp Objects, he visits the alley where Natalie Keenes body was dumped and notices that someone has been leaving fresh flowers there. Might be the sign of a guilty conscience, he tells an old-school barber, midway through a shave. Round here we just call it bein nice, says the man. The barbers theory is that the mystery mourner is superstitious: They figure if they honor the dead, maybe their kids wont end up like them two girls did.

title: Chinas Strong Economic Growth Figures Belie Signs of Weakness
description: SHANGHAI  On the surface, Chinas economy is humming along smoothly. Its the numbers behind the numbers that point to mounting challenges for the worlds other economic superpower.

title: Goldman Expected to Name David Solomon as Successor to C.E.O. Lloyd Blankfein
description: Goldman Sachs is expected to name its president, David M. Solomon, as its next chief executive early this week, according to people briefed on the plan. The announcement would formally establish Mr. Solomon as the successor to Lloyd C. Blankfein as one of the most powerful executives on Wall Street.
