description: To the Editor:

title: Tom Cruises Most Dangerous Stunts in Mission: Impossible
description: The older Tom Cruise gets, the more fun it is to watch him risk death in elaborate age- and gravity-defying ways.

title: A Poet Laureate Sends News From the End of Life
description: Donald Hall, who died on June 23 at 89, was not a particularly nimble poet. His verse had a homely, bucolic, beans-on-the-woodstove quality. He was more cabbage than tulip. To borrow an analogy from baseball, a sport he loved, he was the sort of batter who got on base thanks to walks, bunts, bloopers into right field and a good deal of hustle. He was a plugger.

title: Inside the World of Racist Science Fiction
description: As I watched the televised 2016 presidential debates, listening to the then-candidate Donald Trump arguing various points with Hillary Clinton, a chill went down my spine. I was in the middle of writing a new play, a comic parody of white supremacist fiction. With his hyperbolic attacks on immigrants and minorities  African-Americans living in hell, Latino gangs roaming the street and insinuations that a long list of Jewish philanthropists and politicians was conspiring against him  Mr. Trump sounded like a character straight out of my research.

title: An Astrophysical Approach to Our Environmental Crisis
description: LIGHT OF THE STARS Alien Worlds and the Fate of the Earth By Adam Frank 262 pp. W.W. Norton & Company. $26.95.

title: Good Restaurant Music?
description: To the Editor:

title: Josef Martinezs Scoring Spree Puts Atlanta United on Top of M.L.S.
description: Josef Martinez just keeps scoring.

title: The Publisher and the President
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: The D.I.Y. Joys of Making It
description: When The Great British Baking Show finally made its way to the United States in 2014, it was a jolt  and not just because everyone baked tidy shortbreads. Americans can do that, too. It was because everyone was nice. Jovial. Focused on their own work and not on sabotage or subterfuge. The judges were straightforward and fair. The hosts were funny and supportive. The material was appropriate for all ages. Why couldnt every show be like this? Why couldnt any show?

title: In My Iowa Town, We Need Immigrants
description: STORM LAKE, Iowa  Julio Barroso was not there last week as President Trump bellowed  during his visit to Iowa, closing a job-training round table with another tirade on immigration.

title: Build Border Wall or Government Will Be Shut Down, Trump Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump reiterated on Monday his threat to shut down the federal government this fall if Congress does not deliver on Republican demands to crack down on immigration by enforcing security on the border with Mexico and building his long-promised wall.

title: In Florida, Not All Politics Are Local, as Trump Shapes Governors Race
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  The Sarasota County Republican fair and rally last Saturday left little mystery about what is animating the party this year.

title: Minneapolis Police Officers Wont Be Charged in Fatal Shooting
description: Minneapolis police officers will not face criminal charges in the fatal shooting of an armed man who yelled Please dont shoot me last month as he ran through an alley, prosecutors said Monday.

title: Family That Lost 9 in Capsized Duck Boat Sues for $100 Million
description: Members of a family who lost nine relatives after a tourist boat sank in a Missouri lake filed a $100 million lawsuit on Sunday, saying that the accident was predictable and could have been avoided. They are represented by a lawyer who has sued operators of similar boats in the past and has called for them to be banned.

title: Herman Shine, One of the Few to Escape Auschwitz, Dies at 95
description: His best friend would not leave him behind.

title: Pat de Groot, Seascape Painter and Doyenne of the Dunes, Dies at 88
description: Pat de Groot, a painter who embodied an era when the beaches and dunes at the tip of Cape Cod were peopled with artistic geniuses and incorrigible eccentrics  often in the form of the same person  died on July 26 in Brewster, Mass. She was 88.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Violin Worth $200,000 Is Sold to Pawnshop for $50. The Catch? It Was Stolen.
description: A stolen violin valued at more than $200,000 has been returned to its owner after being sold to a Massachusetts pawnshop for $50, according to the police. The violin, which was designed by Ferdinando Gagliano, among the most prolific violin makers working in Naples, Italy, in the late 18th century, was stolen July 20 from the home of a couple who were sleeping.

title: A Toxic Tide Is Killing Florida Wildlife
description: Florida has an algae problem, and its big. This year, an overgrowth in the waters off the states southwestern coast is killing wildlife and making some beaches noxious.

title: Trump Doubles Down on Government Shutdown Over Border Security
description: The comments came a day after President Trump had threatened a shutdown on Twitter, to the consternation of some Republicans in Congress.

title: Trump Administration Mulls a Unilateral Tax Cut for the Rich
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration is considering bypassing Congress to grant a $100 billion tax cut mainly to the wealthy, a legally tenuous maneuver that would cut capital gains taxation and fulfill a long-held ambition of many investors and conservatives.

title: Three Shows to Watch This Week
description: Whats your mood? Whats your taste? Do you like Its Always Sunny in Philadelphia or Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt? The Times TV critic Margaret Lyons has recommendations below on what you should tune into this week.

title: Vanishing in the Wild, These Salamanders Found Refuge in a Convent
description: PTZCUARO, MEXICO  Atop the highest hill in this lakeside town sits the Baslica de Nuestra Seora de la Salud, built in the 1500s with whitewashed walls and red stone columns.

title: Im Ready to Meet, Trump Tells Iran
description: President Trump signaled his willingness to talk a week after threatening Hassan Rouhani, the president of Iran, on Twitter.

title: Trump Says He Would Meet With Iranian Leader, but Iran Rules It Out
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump, who walked away from a nuclear deal with Iran despite that countrys documented compliance, said Monday that he would meet with President Hassan Rouhani with no preconditions as soon as the Iranian leader agreed to do so.

title: Les Moonves Stays as CBS C.E.O. While Its Board Plans an Investigation
description: Leslie Moonves, the embattled chief executive of CBS Corporation, survived the meeting.

title: Maybe You Were Thinking About Eating Raw Centipedes. Dont.
description: Scientists in China now have hard evidence that eating raw centipedes is a really bad idea.

title: Ahead of Asia Trip, Business Lobby Gives Pompeo an Earful on Trade War
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo pledged on Monday to ramp up the Trump administrations diplomatic engagement with Asia in a speech that followed a blistering attack on the presidents trade policies by a usually stalwart Republican business ally.

title: Minneapolis Police Video Shows Moments Before Thurman Blevins Was Shot
description: The mayor of Minneapolis released the footage of the June shooting which shows the officers chasing Mr. Blevins. Prosecutors said they will not bring criminal charges against the officers.

title: A Richer Prosciutto Arrives in New York
description: The Italian cured hams generally called prosciutto, can come from many regions, most notably the Emilia-Romagna, the source of the best-known one from the Parma area, with a mild, sweet flavor. Go farther north, and theres somewhat more intense San Daniele. Toscana from Tuscany is more robust. Now, for the first time, prosciutto di Carpegna, mainly from the Marche region on the Adriatic coast east of Tuscany, is available in the United States. The rosy hams, aged 20 months, are cured with a rub of seasoned lard for a sweet richness, ready for seasonal wedges of melon or fresh figs.

title: Vaginal Rejuvenation Treatments May Be Unsafe, the F.D.A. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration on Monday announced that it had warned several companies to stop marketing laser devices for procedures billed as vaginal rejuvenation, saying they were dangerous and deceptive treatments.

title: Meet Caulilini, a Lacy New Cauliflower
description: You can see the cauliflower ancestry in Caulilini Sweet Stem Cauliflower, a new vegetable with a delicate, lacy ivory crown. Caulilini is grown by Mann Packing in Salinas, Calif., and is now in New York stores. Mild in flavor and acceptable raw, caulilini will be tender after a five-minute steam and an ice-water shock. Bathe whole clusters of the flower-topped stems in butter or marinate them in a vinaigrette. Use small clusters of the flower tops to garnish a soup, like a cold cauliflower velout.

title: Brexit Plans Raise Fears of Food Shortages and Jammed Ports
description: LONDON  Trucks parked along freeways or stuck in gridlocked ports. Food disappearing from supermarket shelves and stocks of medicines under strain. The military on standby, ready to step in to avert crisis.

title: A Curry Hot Sauce With Serious Kick
description: For American cooks, the simple route to India is curry powder; a spoonful  in chicken salad or lamb stew, and youre on your way. But you can take it up a notch or two with a splash of a new vindaloo curry sauce, which delivers pungency and serious fire. Vinegar, onions, coconut oil and honey temper the Moruga scorpion peppers in the sauce; those chiles are among the worlds hottest, according to the University of New Mexico, which keeps a record of such matters. A little of this mustard-colored seasoning will go a long way.

title: Manaforts Trial Isnt About Russia, but It Will Be in the Air
description: WASHINGTON  When they present their evidence in the financial fraud trial of Paul Manafort beginning this week, federal prosecutors have promised the judge, no government witness will even utter the word Russia.

title: Bigfoot Erotica Becomes an Issue in Virginia Congressional Campaign
description: Leslie Cockburn, a Democratic congressional nominee in Virginia, accused her Republican opponent, Denver Riggleman, on Sunday of campaigning with white supremacists and being the author of Bigfoot-themed erotica.

title: How to Fix Social Medias Big Problems? Lawmakers Have Ideas
description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines  and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

title: Dried Fruits With More Texture
description: Theyre not nose-to-tail, but the dried fruits from Rind follow the notion of no waste, as the  oranges, kiwis, apples, peaches and, unusually, persimmons still have their rinds. Only the pineapple is peeled. All make for good snacking, to serve with cheese, or chopped into biscotti or other baked goods.

title: A Mild-Mannered, but Sophisticated Midwestern Cheese
description: This hefty 20-ounce cheese wheel is labeled Monroe, after the town in Wisconsin where the company that makes it is based. Within the cheeses ruddy, slightly tacky rind is a pale, satiny interior. What is remarkable is that despite its penetrating barnyard aroma, this double cream, washed-rind wheel from the Roth cheese company tastes fruity and rather mild. Be sure to allow it to come to room temperature before serving; it merits a glass of Sauternes alongside.

title: ISIS Says It Killed 4 Cyclists in Tajikistan
description: MOSCOW  A car ran down a group of touring cyclists in the Central Asian state of Tajikistan over the weekend, killing four people from the United States, the Netherlands and Switzerland. On Monday, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

title: Turn Dinner Into an Odyssey
description: For the month of August, Ruffian  a pencil-thin wine bar with a 19-seat counter and not much else  will take you on a voyage to the ports of call in Homers Odyssey. Weve had great success serving Greek wines, and we thought this would be interesting and fun, said Moshe Schulman, a partner in the restaurant. Alexis Percival and Patrick Cournot, two other partners, have selected wines from places like Crete, Turkey, the Peloponnesus, Macedonia, Sicily, Sardinia and Majorca to pour by the glass. Joe Kozlinski, the bartender, has created an alluring vermouth-based Homeric cocktail called the Wine-Dark Sea. And somehow, from their shoe-box kitchen, the chefs Andy Alexandre and Josh Ochoa have managed to turn out succulent roasted lamb with a yogurt sauce, pickled tomatoes with coriander and pita dusted with lotus seeds (in homage to the Lotus-eaters) to accompany the wines. Three dishes, which serve two, are $45.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame to Celebrate a Catcher (and a Spy)
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  You dont become the subject of an exhibit at the Baseball Hall of Fame by being a catcher who never played a full season and finished with a career batting average of .243.

title: News From Your Neighborhood, Brought to You by the State of New Jersey
description: Like publications in the rest of the country, New Jerseys suburban newspapers pulled back as their business model vaporized, leaving fewer reporters to dig into local scandals or dispatch to neighborhood events. Tiny outfits like The Village Green, which covers two North Jersey towns, have sought to fill the void.

title: Sister Maureen Turlish, a Voice for Sex Abuse Victims, Dies at 79
description: Sister Maureen Paul Turlish, a tenacious advocate for survivors of childhood sexual abuse by Roman Catholic clergymen, died on July 18 in Cincinnati. She was 79.

title: California, Trump, CBS: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Precious and Few
description: Dear Diary:

title: Trump Repeats, and Inflates, Inaccurate Claims About NATO and Immigration
description: Since last Octobers truck attack in Manhattan, President Trump has claimed without evidence that an Uzbek man who was charged in the attack had sponsored 22 to 24 relatives who moved to the United States through chain migration, or family-based immigration.

title: Nick Saban Has Six New Assistants at Alabama  and Will Probably Still Win
description: The start of the college football season is mere weeks away, and fans begging for Nick Sabans Alabama Crimson Tide to backslide do not have a lot to pin their hopes on.

title: Alex Trebek, Saying He May Leave Jeopardy! in 2020, Suggests 2 Replacements
description: Alex Trebek, the host of Jeopardy! since 1984, stoked speculation on Monday that he could retire when his contract expires in 2020, telling a TMZ host that his chances of staying longer were 50-50, and a little less.

title: Mars Is Frigid, Rusty and Haunted. We Cant Stop Looking at It.
description: There it was: Glowering red on the dashboard of the sky like an astrological warning light next to the full Blood Moon Friday. Mars.

title: All That Matters Is Were Alive: California Fire Evacuees Crowd Into Shelters
description: REDDING, Calif.  Beneath thick clouds of smoke from the still-burning Carr Fire nearby, Ashley Myers and her family leaned on their small black Subaru on Monday as they ate a breakfast of biscuits and gravy from paper plates outside the CrossPointe Community Church. The family had been at the church, now a shelter, for three days already, after evacuating their home in Reddings Westwood neighborhood.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Firing Prompts Pushback in Hollywood
description: Deriding what they called mob mentality, Chris Pratt and his Guardians of the Galaxy castmates released a letter of support on Monday for the director James Gunn, who was fired from the Guardians franchise on July 20 after offensive jokes he wrote on Twitter were resurfaced by online vigilantes.

title: How Companies Are Making Customers Pay for Trumps Trade War
description: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines  and the power-brokers who shape them.

title: Trump Spurns Medicaid Proposal After Furious White House Debate
description: WASHINGTON  Hoping to head off a full expansion of Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, some senior officials in the Trump administration and Republican governors have been pushing hard for a smaller expansion to satisfy a growing political demand in their states.

title: Manchin Is First Democrat to Meet With Kavanaugh as Parties Intensify Feud
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia broke with his party on Monday to become the first Democrat to meet with Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, President Trumps Supreme Court pick, as the two parties escalated their feud over access to documents relating to the nominee.

title: Pedal-Assist Dockless Bikes Roll Out in the Bronx
description: For years, residents of the Bronx have looked at Manhattan and parts of Queens and Brooklyn with a bit of bike-share envy. Citi Bike was not an option in the borough.

title: A Rush to Block Downloadable Plans for 3-D Printed Guns
description: Gun control proponents and state officials are racing the clock to try to block blueprints to make guns from 3-D printers from going online Wednesday.

title: Gang Member Found Guilty in Crossfire Slaying of Bronx Mother
description: A man who prosecutors say belonged to a Dominican street gang was convicted on Monday of ordering a 2016 shooting that mistakenly killed Jessica White, a young mother struck in the heart as she watched her three children run around a playground in a Bronx public housing project.

title: Infighting. Political Brawling. The New V.A. Secretary Is Inheriting a Mess
description: The Department of Veterans Affairs has experienced five months of tumult. Its previous secretary got into a political brawl with his staff and was fired by Twitter message. His first proposed replacement was scuttled by allegations of drunkenness. Then the acting secretary who took charge was accused of making false statements to Congress.

title: The Rest of the Ivy League Comes to Harvards Aid in Admissions Challenge
description: The rest of the Ivy League closed ranks behind Harvard on Monday, defending the practice of including the race of applicants in the admissions process in the face of a lawsuit aimed at striking down Harvards system.

title: A Short List of Aviations Most Vexing Disappearances
description: Investigators examining the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 more than four years ago completed their inquiry on Monday without definitive conclusions on the cause. The flight, carrying 239 people from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, to Beijing on March 8, 2014, vanished after having inexplicably veered off course.

title: Holdout Over, Sam Darnold Begins Battle to Start for the Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  When Sam Darnold jogged onto the practice field Monday afternoon, his Jets teammates interrupted their stretching to begin a slow clap, followed by whoops and cheers and hugs.

title: T-Mobile and Sprint: How Fewer Competitors Could Increase Competition
description: There has been no shortage of opinions about the proposed merger of T-Mobile and Sprint. Just about the only person who hasnt said something is President Trump.

title: Migrant Families Have Been Reunited. Now, a Scramble to Prevent Deportations.
description: LOS ANGELES  The federal government last week completed reunifications of more than 1,800 migrant families separated under the Trump administrations zero-tolerance policy, but immigrant advocates were set to be back in court Tuesday to block what they said was another imminent threat: plans to swiftly deport up to 1,000 of the newly reunited families.

title: He Used Tinder to Hunt the Women He Raped and Killed, Police Say
description: Dating apps were created to help people meet each other and maybe fall in love. But law enforcement authorities say a Connecticut man used them to prey on women, including a nurse in Queens he met through Tinder who was strangled to death earlier this month.

title: The Third-Party Option
description: Is there room for a third party? If some independent mounted a presidential bid in 2020, would that person have a chance?

title: New York City Is Thriving. Why Is Transport Such a Nightmare?
description: New York is one of the most prosperous cities in the world, yet it has one of the worlds most dysfunctional transportation systems. Delays plague the subway a year after Gov. Andrew Cuomo and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority promised to fix that mess. The roads, especially in Manhattan, are in not much better shape. Average traffic speeds south of 60th Street have fallen nearly 22 percent in the past seven years, according to the City Department of Transportation. At the same time, many taxi and livery drivers say that they can barely afford to make ends meet  six of them have killed themselves in recent months. One shot himself in front of City Hall to protest officials whom he accused of flooding the streets with for-hire cars and driving him to ruin.

title: How Trump Allies Shifted Their Defense as Evidence of Contacts With Russians Grew
description: WASHINGTON  In the days after the 2016 presidential election, Donald J. Trumps advisers had an unequivocal message about contacts between Russians and members of the campaign team: There were none.

title: Quotation of the Day: Why Global Greening Isnt as Great as It Sounds
description: Plants are quietly scrubbing the air of one Chinas worth of carbon. What frightens me is knowing this cant go on forever.

title: With Trades, Yankees Pitching Staff Remains a Work in Progress
description: The Yankees continued the recent reshaping of their pitching staff, acquiring right-hander Lance Lynn from the Minnesota Twins and sending right-hander Adam Warren to the Seattle Mariners in separate deals Monday.

title: Review: In a New Orleans House, Wealthy Women Are Haunted by Slaverys Ghosts
description: When you hear a drum beat as youre watching Marcus Gardleys The House That Will Not Stand, which opened on Monday night at New York Theater Workshop, sit up and pay attention. Its likely to be the prelude to a flash of wondrousness.

title: Ex-FEMA Official Accused of Sexual Misconduct That Spanned Years
description: A former top Federal Emergency Management Agency official who recently resigned has been accused of what the agencys leader on Monday called deeply disturbing sexual misconduct that spanned years and warrants further investigation.

title: More to Come
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE   This one made me chuckle, mostly because of a rule in The New York Times stylebook that says that all initials must be followed by a period. Not everyone writes that way, but we are asked to, and thats O.K. (See what I just did there?)

title: Corrections: July 31, 2018
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Bob Woodwards New Book Will Detail Harrowing Life Inside Trump White House
description: Bob Woodward, the indefatigable Washington Post journalist who has chronicled several presidential administrations in best-selling books, has his latest subject: Donald J. Trump.

title: Four People, Including a 5-Year-Old Boy, Are Shot and Killed in Queens
description: Four people, among them a 5-year-old boy, were shot and killed at a small apartment building in Queens on Monday night in what investigators believe may have been a murder-suicide, the police said.

title: Ceramics Arent Enough. Bring on the Spaceships, Italian Town Says.
description: GROTTAGLIE, Italy  After racing down a two-mile runway, a van carrying top airport officials rattled onto a patch of asphalt overrun with tall swaying grass, wildflowers and herbs.

title: Philippine Bombing Kills 10, Showing Insurgents Remain a Problem
description: MANILA  Militants detonated a car bomb at a military checkpoint on Tuesday in the southern Philippine island of Basilan, killing at least 10 people in a brazen attack that underscored the continuing insurgent threat in the southern part of the country.

title: Brexit, Russia, Mars: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: If an N.B.A. Workout Isnt on Instagram, Does It Even Count?
description: Marcus Derrickson was preparing for a stint with the Golden State Warriors at N.B.A. Summer League when his friends urged him to show off his gains in the weight room. Derrickson, a 22-year-old forward who played at Georgetown, was  and remains  a social media neophyte. At the time, he had posted all of five photos on Instagram.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Please Like Me and Frontline
description: The Australian comic Josh Thomass series is available on Hulu. And PBSs Frontline dives into the ramifications of the Trump administrations border policies.

title: A Migrant Boy Rejoins His Mother, but Hes Not the Same
description: PHILADELPHIA  Before they were separated at the southwest border, Ana Carolina Fernandess 5-year-old son loved playing with the yellow, impish Minion characters from the Despicable Me movies. Now his favorite game is patting down and shackling migrants with plastic cuffs.

title: After Doctors Cut Their Opioids, Patients Turn to a Risky Treatment for Back Pain
description: WASHINGTON  An injectable drug that the manufacturer says is too dangerous to use along the spine is growing in popularity for back pain as doctors turn away from opioids.

title: Lassie Got Help, Would Your Dog?
description: Usually the title of a scientific paper leaves anyone without the appropriate Ph.D. scratching their head in puzzlement.

title: Recovering Lost Photos of Life Before the Chernobyl Disaster
description: Chernobyl.

title: What Do 525 Ventriloquists Do at a Convention? Ask Their Dummies
description: ERLANGER, Ky.  For years ventriloquism has held a reputation as being dorky at best, sinister at worst. Even now it summons up horror movies about a homicidal dummy, or a homicidal ventriloquist, or both. We are far from the golden age of the 1930s and 1940s, when Edgar Bergen and his puppet Charlie McCarthy were so beloved that Bergen was given an honorary Academy Award. (Bergen made his name as a ventriloquist on the radio. Think about that.)

title: Transaction Costs and Tethers: Why Im a Crypto Skeptic
description: Im still on vacation, hiking and biking in various parts of Europe. Im keeping up with the news, more or less, but am only occasionally and unpredictably in a place and condition where I can actually write something and post it.

title: Stephen Colbert Wants Accountability for His Accused Boss, Les Moonves
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: In Cambodia, Dissenting Voters Find Ways to Say None of the Above
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  One Cambodian voter defaced his or her ballot with a lively reference to a dogs anatomy. Others ticked every single box, or crossed out the entire ballot. Still others drew pictures of the sun, the symbol of the outlawed main opposition party.

title: How I Turned My Tiny Apartment Bedroom Into a Relaxing Retreat
description: When I moved into my apartment a few years ago, I had to choose  do I make the smaller of the two bedrooms my home office, or my bedroom? I chose the latter, assuming that I didnt need a ton of space to sleep and get dressed.

title: Work Is Weird. Alison Green of Ask a Manager Can Help.
description: When Alison Green started handing out workplace advice in 2007, she expected to focus on what she thought of as typical problems, like dealing with a micromanaging boss or landing more job interviews.

title: Two Views of Flints Water Troubles: One a Close-Up and One With a Wide-Angle Lens
description: WHAT THE EYES DONT SEE A Story of Crisis, Resistance, and Hope in an American City By Mona Hanna-Attisha Illustrated. 364 pp. One World. $28.

title: Five Places to Shop in New Orleans
description: For shopping or just a casual stroll, no place in New Orleans is quite like Magazine Street, one of the citys main thoroughfares. The six-mile-long stretch from the Garden District to Uptown, following the curving course of the Mississippi River, has some of the best antique stores, art galleries, craft shops and boutiques to be found anywhere in the city. Lined with mostly 19th-century buildings, including bright Victorian cottages trimmed in quirky gingerbread millwork, Magazine Street has the low-slung scale and mix of small stores  many with one-of-a-kind merchandise   that makes it an enduring hot spot for locals and visitors alike.

title: How One Agency Built a Multimillion-Dollar Business in Migrant Children
description: When 17-year-old Destani Williams ran away from an upstate New York residential treatment program in May 2017 and was found dead a week later, it was but the latest in a string of troubling incidents at Cayuga Centers, a 166-year-old child-welfare agency.

title: A Census Question That Could Change How Power Is Divided in America
description: A citizenship question on the 2020 census has already drawn challenges from states that fear an undercount of immigrants and a loss of federal funds. But demographers say there could be even deeper consequences: The question could generate the data necessary to redefine how political power is apportioned in America.

title: The Worst Drug Crisis in American History
description: DOPESICK Dealers, Doctors, and the Drug Company That Addicted America By Beth Macy Illustrated. 376 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $28.

title: New & Noteworthy
description: THE STRANGE CASE OF DR. COUNEY By Dawn Raffel. (Blue Rider Press, $27.) The use of incubators to save the lives of premature infants has its origins among the sideshows of Coney Island and Atlantic City. As Raffel recounts in this bit of forgotten but fascinating history, at the turn of the 20th century Dr. Martin Couney discovered a novel way to help sickly newborns while also making a few bucks displaying the little wonders alongside bearded ladies and strongmen. HOW SCHOOLS WORK By Arne Duncan. (Simon & Schuster, $26.99.) Obamas education secretary unpacks his thoughts about what is working and what isnt in our nations school system. He is looking to offer some straight talk, beginning with this opening line: Education runs on lies. A FUTURE OF FAITH By Pope Francis with Dominique Wolton. (St. Martins, $29.99.) The pope sat down for a series of interviews with a French reporter and this book collects the transcripts, revealing Francis thoughts on a wide range of contemporary issues, from immigration to globalization, making even clearer the revolutionary quality of his papacy. VALLEY OF GENIUS By Adam Fisher. (Twelve, $30.) The juggernaut of Silicon Valley now seems like a part of the economy that was always meant to be, but its worth remembering how young it is and how haphazard was its start. Fisher has interviewed over 200 people in this expansive oral history of the industry, which stretches from Atari to Facebook. MAEVE IN AMERICA By Maeve Higgins. (Penguin, paper, $16.) The Irish comedian and memoirist writes of her misadventures in the United States after moving here in her 30s and discovering the joys and pains of independence.

title: Trump Is Putting Indelible Conservative Stamp on Judiciary
description: WASHINGTON  With another judge confirmed Tuesday by the Senate, President Trump and Senate Republicans are leaving an ever-expanding imprint on the judiciary, nudging powerful appeals courts rightward through a determined effort to nominate and confirm a steady procession of young conservative jurists.

title: The 52 Places Traveler: Summer in France, in Two Very Different Ways
description: Our columnist, Jada Yuan, is visiting each destination on our 52 Places to Go in 2018 list. This dispatch brings her to two stops  France, Megve, near the Swiss border, and Arles, in Provence. Megve was No. 42 on the list, while Arles took the No. 28 spot; they are the 26th and 27th stops on Jadas itinerary.

title: Key Question for Les Moonves of CBS: What Were You Thinking?
description: The New Yorkers account of sexual harassment allegations against CBSs chief executive, Leslie Moonves, has many disturbing echoes of what has become a long list of predatory behavior by corporate executives.

title: What Happened When Fracking Came to Town
description: AMITY AND PROSPERITY One Family and the Fracturing of America By Eliza Griswold 318 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $27.

title: The City of My Birth in India Is Becoming a Climate Casualty. It Didnt Have to Be.
description: KOLKATA, India  I wanted to glimpse the future in the city where I was born. So, this summer I returned to India for a firsthand look at the way climate change is affecting Kolkata.

title: Rustic Yet Refined
description: The house they wanted was halfway between simple and elegant, with plenty of room for parents and friends. What they bought was far from it.

title: Mixing Generations and Styles in the Hamptons
description: In 2016, after seven years in the San Francisco Bay Area, Ian Ferguson returned to his native New York with the intention of putting down roots. A big part of the plan involved finding a weekend house in the Hamptons where he could spend some serious time not only with his soon-to-be husband, Ryan James Brandau, after a longtime cross-country relationship, but also with his parents, who live on the Upper West Side of Manhattan.

description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo continues to hold a dominant lead over Cynthia Nixon, according to a new Siena College poll of likely Democratic primary voters, outpacing the activist and actress by 31 percentage points with less than 50 days until the primary.

title: The Secret Ingredient to Chinas Aggression? Sand
description: One of the most dangerous confrontations between the United States and China is heating up. Warships are being deployed, bombers are taking wing and threats are being exchanged  all of it sparked by Chinas growing mastery of the use of the worlds most overlooked natural resource: sand.

title: Does Canada Need Better Gun Control?
description: TORONTO  Last summer I taught a course at the University of Toronto called American Tragedy: Guns and Mass Shootings in U.S. History. One memorable day, my 20 mostly Canadian students reflected on the frequency of mass shootings in America and how these calamities dont receive much public interest unless the gunman claims several lives. One student remarked: Reading about this stuff makes me so sad. It also makes me happy to live in Canada, where we dont have to worry about this kind of thing.

title: Review: Rubinsteins Demon Is Redeemed in a Rare Staging
description: ANNANDALE-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  Anton Rubinsteins Demon, a nearly forgotten Russian opera from 1871, was one of the most popular works of its day. And a crucial seduction scene in Act III suggests why.

title: The Politics of White Threat
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive the newsletter each weekday.

title: Afghan Army Takes Over After ISIS Attacks a Refugee Office
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The army will take over security in the eastern city of Jalalabad, Afghanistan officials said Tuesday, hours after attackers overran a government refugee office there, killing 15 people. It was at least the 10th such assault on civilian targets this year.

title: How to Stop Facebook From Bringing Up Bad Memories
description: Q. Yesterday I got a message from Facebook that it had put a slide show together of my photos. Specifically, it took all the photos of my mother, including those in which she was in a hospital bed and set them to music. How can I prevent this?

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
Judge Blocks Attempt to Post Blueprints for 3-D Guns
description: WASHINGTON  For years, Cody Wilson, a champion of gun-rights and anarchism from Texas, has waged a battle to post on the internet the blueprints for making plastic guns on 3-D printers, claiming the First Amendment gives him the right to do it.

description: EDIRNE, Turkey  A prominent Kurdish politician, Selahattin Demirtas once helped Turkeys leader come close to ending the decades-old conflict with Kurdish militants that has killed tens of thousands of people.

description: An experiment involving 34 dogs of various breeds tested whether they would push through a magnetically sealed door to save their owners.

title: Alan Alda Reveals He Has Parkinsons Disease
description: Alan Alda has been living with Parkinsons disease for over three years, the actor revealed Tuesday in an appearance on CBSs This Morning.

description: BANGKOK  Thailands military government is seeking the extradition of the countrys last elected prime minister, Yingluck Shinawatra, who fled to Britain rather than go to prison for five years on negligence charges.

description: Trumps personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani took viewers of Fox and Friends and CNN on a wild ride Monday morning. Heres his not-so-definitive guide to legal defense.

title: Need a Lawyer? Better Call Rudy
description: In the video above, we take a closer look at how Rudy Giuliani defended Donald Trump on cable news against the Russia probe.

title: Zimbabwe Elections, Mostly Peaceful, Bring Voters Out in Droves
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  Huge numbers of Zimbabweans turned out for the first elections since the fall of the longtime ruler Robert Mugabe, in voting that was largely peaceful, though marked by problems in the capital, Harare, election observers said on Tuesday.

title: Paul Manaforts Trial Is Donald Trumps, Too
description: The word collusion probably wont come up in the Alexandria, Va., courtroom where Paul Manafort sweats out much of this and the next few weeks. Its possible, too, that Donald Trump wont be mentioned, at least not often.

title: Men Outtalk Women 2 to 1 on the Big Screen, Study Finds
description: Women may make up more than half the population, but onscreen in the most popular films, female speaking characters are consistently outnumbered by men two to one.

title: Review: In Rendezvous in July, Young Parisians Are on the Move
description: Movies about young adults figuring out what to do with their lives are more than plentiful today, but they sure werent in 1949  which is when the great French director Jacques Becker made Rendezvous in July. The picture is having its official New York premiere this week as part of a retrospective of Beckers works at Film Forum (which is itself reopening after an extensive renovation project).

title: Local Media Needs Security. What Chance the Rappers Purchase of Chicagoist Means.
description: In mid-July, the 25-year-old Chicagoan Chancelor Bennett, known to the world as Chance the Rapper, released an unannounced batch of songs for social media and the blogosphere to feed on.

title: Review: Nico, 1988 Dramatizes the Singers Tormented Final Years
description: Almost the first thing we learn about the tortured title character of Nico, 1988  Susanna Nicchiarellis brilliantly unsentimental biopic of the German singer Christa Pffgen  is that she doesnt like to be called Nico. Nor does she appreciate being referred to as Lou Reeds femme fatale.

title: How Do I Stop Wanting to Cheat?
description: Dear Sugars,

title: Facebook Identifies an Active Political Influence Campaign Using Fake Accounts
description: WASHINGTON  Facebook said on Tuesday that it had identified a political influence campaign that was potentially built to disrupt the midterm elections, with the company detecting and removing 32 pages and fake accounts that had engaged in activity around divisive social issues.

title: As Chinas Woes Mount, Xi Jinping Faces Rare Rebuke at Home
description: BEIJING  Chinas top leader, Xi Jinping, seemed indomitable when lawmakers abolished a term limit on his power early this year. But months later, China has been struck by economic headwinds, a vaccine scandal and trade battles with Washington, emboldening critics in Beijing who are questioning Mr. Xis sweeping control.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Through Aug. 19 at 205 Hudson Gallery, 205 Hudson Street (entrance on Canal Street), Manhattan, 205hudsongallery.org; and Bertha and Karl Leubsdorf Gallery at Hunter College Art Galleries, 132 East 68th Street, Manhattan, 212-772-4991, leubsdorfgallery.org.

title: Largest King Penguin Colony in the World Drops by 90%
description: After three decades out of the public eye, a giant colony of king penguins has lost 90 percent of its population, according to a new study.

title: Would You Rather Have Mike Pence?
description: To the Editor:

title: A French-Trained Chef With an Eye for Fresh Produce
description: Alex Baker brings a bistronomie sensibility to Yves in TriBeCa.

title: On Prince Street, an Homage to Tuscany
description: At Coco Pazzo Trattoria in SoHo, the restaurateur Pino Luongo brings back some of the cooking that helped introduce New Yorkers to Tuscan cuisine.

title: A Tuscan Revival, a French Debut
description: Coco Pazzo is back.

title: Paul Manaforts Defense Team Opens Trial by Blaming Associates
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  Paul Manaforts trial on financial fraud charges opened on Tuesday with an effort by his defense team to deflect blame to the governments star witness in the case, Rick Gates, Mr. Manaforts longtime political consulting partner.

title: Long Forgotten, a Landmark Film in AIDS History Is Rescued
description: Philadelphia, Parting Glances, Longtime Companion and Tongues Untied are often cited as benchmark movies about AIDS. But long forgotten is Buddies, the first feature film about AIDS. An intimate two-hander from 1985, it was a snapshot of a terrible time for gay men in New York, made during some of the worst hours of the epidemic.

title: The Freshest Ideas Are in Small Grocery Stores
description: BALTIMORE  Maj. Gene Hogg, the Salvation Armys commander for central Maryland, organized mobile kitchens after the twin towers fell in Manhattan and the levees broke in New Orleans. He fed protesters and police officers during the riots that erupted here in 2015 after a young man named Freddie Gray died of injuries he received while in the back of a police van. More than 200 businesses were destroyed, many of them places where people bought food.

title: They Stole a Shark in a Baby Stroller and Briefly Got Away With It
description: Miss Helen, a 16-inch-long horn shark in the San Antonio Aquarium in Texas, lives in a tank where visitors are encouraged to touch the animals. Three people took the encouragement too far this past weekend, lifting the shark out of the tank and plopping her into a baby stroller, the police said.

title: Review: In No Date, No Signature, a Doctor Seethes With Guilt Over a Boys Death
description: An absorbing illustration of how minor actions and bad decisions can amplify one another (and have ripple effects of their own), No Date, No Signature is a sturdy morality play from the theater-trained Iranian director Vahid Jalilvand, making his second feature.

title: Getting Into the Ivy League
description: To the Editor:

title: How Influential Is Film Forum? Christopher Nolan and Others Explain
description: Any day of the year, New Yorkers can catch foreign films, indies or classics at Film Forum, the art house and repertory cinema in Lower Manhattan.

title: Theyre Blood Brothers With Israels Jews. But Druse Call New Law a Betrayal.
description: DALIYAT EL-KARMEL, Israel  On the edge of this Druse village, perched on a quiet green ridge above the Mediterranean, is a national monument to more than 420 Druse soldiers and security force members who have fallen in battle for Israel.

title: Catholic Church Faces Reckoning in Chile as Sex Abuse Scandal Widens
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  The 20 men and women rose quietly from their pews during Mass at the Cathedral of Santiago one day last week, unfurled a banner and held up signs. All Bishops Resign, one read.

title: Sharing a Parents Bed
description: To the Editor:

title: Urgent Care Centers for Addicts
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Stephen F. Austin Defended Slavery. Should the Texas Capital Be Renamed?
description: Among the larger-than-life people in Texas history, only one can claim the title Father of Texas: Stephen F. Austin, the Virginia-born businessman who reluctantly accepted his fathers dying wishes to turn the Mexican-controlled territory into an American colony.

title: Ample Hills Opens Its Red Hook Factory
description: Delays in opening a restaurant are common in New York. And the roadblocks are compounded when a place to eat also involves a fully equipped ice cream factory and bakery, as in the case of Ample Hills Creamery Factory and Museum. The location was one of the complications that pushed the opening back the best part of a year. Brian Smith and Jackie Cuscuna, the owners, who founded the company in Prospect Heights seven years ago, were dealing with raw space. We had to build the infrastructure from scratch, Mr. Smith said. They also had to switch architects midstream. The new 15,000-square-foot facility, with a scoop shop and counters in front and behind it, a playroom and an interactive museum of ice cream, is built into Beard Street Warehouses. Part of a series of brick storerooms from the mid-19th century, the warehouses were once used to hold goods like cotton and coffee. The space has allowed Ample Hills to improve production with the capacity to churn out 500,000 gallons a year (right now theyre at 50,000). In place of batch freezers, there is now a continuous system. Mix-ins like cookie pieces made in the bakery are added automatically and pints are filled by machine, not by hand. Mr. Smith said that, if anything, this industrialization should enhance the ice creams texture. And though the company is now able to deliver pints to many more retail shops, Mr. Smith said they would keep opening scoop shops, adding, We dont just want to be pints in grocery stores. Los Angeles will have an Ample Hills in the fall, followed by another one on Prospect Park West, to bring the total to 13.

title: From TripAdvisor, a Program to Help Refugees Get to Know the U.S.
description: TripAdvisor wants refugees to the United States to explore and get to know their new homeland, and the hospitality companys yearlong Welcome Home campaign aims to do just that: launched last week, Welcome Home gives recently resettled refugees in New York City and parts of Northern California the opportunity to book a tour or activity of their choice through TripAdvisor Experiences, a category that offers travelers things to do in around 1,900 destinations globally.

title: N.B.A. Makes MGM Resorts International Its First Gambling Partner
description: The N.B.A. announced Tuesday that MGM Resorts International would be the leagues official gambling partner, the first partnership of its kind with a major sports league in the United States.

title: Meet the YouTube Stars Turning Viewers Into Readers
description: When Christine Riccio was a teenager growing up in New Jersey, she and her sister would upload videos to YouTube of the two of them being silly, dancing to Britney Spearss Piece of Me or attempting a back flip. It wasnt until Ms. Riccio was in college in 2010 that she actually talked to the camera for the first time and decided to upload a video book review of Suzanne Collinss The Hunger Games.

title: Europe Says Greece Is a Comeback Story. The I.M.F. Isnt Convinced.
description: As Greece prepares to end nearly a decades worth of international financial bailouts next month, European policymakers have been eager to promote the countrys economic comeback story and the symbolic end of the regions punishing debt crisis.

title: The Next Wave of Dance Films, Made on Your Phone, Is Here
description: We live in the age of the smartphone camera, aware that the everyday devices in our hands and pockets are increasingly able to record professional-quality images. Dancers and those who film dance know this too, as they keep showing the world on Instagram.

title: Ordinary Iranians on Trump Talks Offer: Why Not Try the Americans?
description: TEHRAN  Irans leaders cannot stand the thought of talking to the United States and say President Trump cannot be trusted. But Jamshid Moniri, a 45-year-old building contractor sweating under the Tehran summer sun, summed up what many ordinary Iranians think.

title: How Trump Could Be Like Reagan
description: President Trump won a victory for freer trade last week when he and the president of the European Commission, Jean-Claude Juncker, agreed to find ways to lower tariffs and other barriers to each others exports. The outlines of the deal are still sketchy, but it calls for the Europeans to buy more American petroleum, soybeans and manufactured goods and for Mr. Trump to reduce his auto and steel tariffs.

title: A Syrian Refugee Lands in Ireland in From a Low and Quiet Sea
description: From a Low and Quiet Sea, a new novel by the Irish writer Donal Ryan, recently longlisted for the Booker Prize, begins with a story snatched from life. When a group of fundamentalists in Syria crucify a small boy, a local doctor, Farouk, and his family decide to flee, taking to the sea in the custody of human smugglers. Catastrophe ensues. Farouk eventually settles in Ireland, and his narrative is braided with the stories of two other shattered men there: Lampy, young and lovelorn, and John, frantically expiating for a life of violence. They are all, in different ways, locked in the silent, gentle frenzy of grief when a tragedy (yet another) brings them together.

title: The Social Hygiene Campaign That Sent Thousands of American Women to Jail
description: THE TRIALS OF NINA McCALL Sex, Surveillance, and the Decades- Long Government Plan to Imprison Promiscuous Women By Scott W. Stern 356 pp. Beacon Press. $28.95.

title: San Francisco Officials to Tech Workers: Buy Your Lunch
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The corporate campuses of the Bay Areas technology companies have become independent fiefs with dry cleaning, gyms, doctors, shuttle buses and bountiful free meals, made by the best chefs poached from the regions famous restaurants. Now, local officials are knocking at the gates.

title: If You Thought the Wedding Was Fun, Youll Love the Movie
description: Weddings can come and go so fast they might sometimes seem like one big blur to the newly married couple, their guests and families. With so much going, too, its often easy to miss some of the days more noteworthy happenings.

title: Ex-Penn State Fraternity Member Sentenced to House Arrest in Hazing Death
description: A former fraternity brother at Penn State University was sentenced on Tuesday to three months of house arrest for his role in the hazing death of a pledge.

title: My Sister Disowned Me on State TV
description: On Friday, my sister publicly disowned me on prime-time Iranian television.

title: Drawing Center Names New Executive Director
description: The Drawing Center, a small, non-collecting museum in Manhattans SoHo district, has announced that its new executive director will be the longtime New York curator Laura Hoptman.

title: Tony Cloninger, Pitcher Remembered for His Bat, Dies at 77
description: Tony Cloninger, who assured himself a page in the rich lore of Major League Baseball when he became the only pitcher to hit two grand slams in a game, died on July 24 in Denver, N.C., where he had been a high school standout. He was 77.

title: Mary Jane McCaffree Monroe, Protocol Authority, Dies at 106
description: Mary Jane McCaffree Monroe, who as social secretary to Mamie Eisenhower helped organize countless White House functions, then went on to set down the protocols for reception lines, state dinners and more as co-author of a pivotal reference book, died on July 23 in Juno Beach, Fla. She was 106.

title: MOCA Chooses MoMA PS1 Director to Lead Museum
description: Even as the art world in Los Angeles has grown more vital over the last decade, the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles has often appeared to be on life support  struggling with financial problems and leadership turnover. Now the institution is betting its future on Klaus Biesenbach, the charismatic  sometimes controversial  director of MoMA PS1 in Queens, who will become its next director. It is the third time the museum, known as MOCA, has picked a leader from New York.

title: Facebook, China, Paul Manafort: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: John Kelly Tells Aides He Will Remain White House Chief of Staff Through 2020
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps embattled chief of staff, John F. Kelly, told his senior aides on Monday that the president had asked him to stay on in his job through 2020, and that he had accepted, according to three senior administration officials.

title: Alex Jones, Pursued Over Infowars Falsehoods, Faces a Legal Crossroads
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  In the five years since Noah Pozner was killed at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., death threats and online harassment have forced his parents, Veronique De La Rosa and Leonard Pozner, to relocate seven times. They now live in a high-security community hundreds of miles from where their 6-year-old is buried.

title: Streaming Orphan Films, Courtesy of Nicolas Winding Refn
description: Not content to be known as the director of Drive and The Neon Demon, Nicolas Winding Refn has quietly started a side career as a collector, preservationist and streaming service provider. He estimates that his library has grown to more than 200 titles. They include orphan films by one-time directors; movies that never showed beyond regional drive-ins; and Shanty Tramp, a 1967 exploitation picture that Mr. Refn calls the ultimate political film.

title: Tracking MoviePasss Bumpy History
description: Like many film plots, the story of MoviePass has been filled with monumental peaks, contentious rivalries and plenty of confusion. Amid plunging stock prices and widespread criticism, the subscription-based movie service has resorted to a dizzying array of stopgap maneuvers over the last year to keep the final credits from rolling. Heres a timeline of events to keep track of it all.

title: New York Times Names Cliff Levy as Its New Metro Editor
description: The New York Times said on Tuesday that Clifford J. Levy, a two-time Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter and a leader of the newsrooms digital initiatives, will be its next metropolitan editor.

title: How College Sports Killed Summer Vacation
description: The day began for the Clemson mens soccer team at 7 a.m., with workouts focused on improving agility, sprinting and technique. A weight room session followed. Next came classes. In the evening there was finally time to kick back with friends and video games, and to rest up for the next morning.

title: New York Office to Address Discrimination by Taxis and For-Hire Vehicles
description: New York City officials on Tuesday announced the creation of a new office to address bias-related refusals by taxicab and for-hire vehicle drivers.

title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater Set to Celebrate Its 60th Anniversary
description: Sixty years after Alvin Ailey and a group of African-American dancers performed for one night only at the 92nd Street Y in Manhattan, Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater will celebrate its anniversary with Ailey Ascending, a season featuring its first two-act ballet, a festival, an international tour and a month of performances at City Center.

title: Patricia Cohen, Who Tracked Mental Health of Children, Dies at 81
description: Patricia Cohen, a researcher who tracked the mental health of a large group of children as they grew to adulthood, detailing the natural history of psychiatric problems and helping to create a framework for future long-term studies, died on July 16 in Marlborough, Mass. She was 81.

title: Apple Could Soon Be Worth $1 Trillion as Profits Pour In
description: Apple reported another strong quarter of profits on Tuesday, as consumers kept buying iPhones and paying more for them, news that could soon help make the Silicon Valley giant the first public company to be worth more than $1 trillion.

title: At This Avant-Garde Fashion Designers Dinner Party, Footwear Is Optional
description: The characters that the fashion designer Zoe Latta invites onto her runway are unfailingly diverse, ranging from fellow artists to striking, silver-haired septuagenarian women and the occasional very pregnant friend. As one half of Eckhaus Latta, the American label known for its creative, gender-fluid ready-to-wear designs, Latta has a professional practice that slips between conceptual art, high fashion and provocative marketing. Her approach to entertaining is no less fluid.

title: How Healthy Is Your Office?
description: For decades, many developers and architects worked to ensure that their buildings were kind to the planet. Now, their focus is on the effect that buildings have on the people who work in them.

title: The Best Movies and TV Shows New to Netflix Australia in August
description: Every month, Netflix Australia adds a new batch of movies and TV shows to its library. Here are the titles we think are most interesting for August, broken down by release date. Netflix occasionally changes its schedule without giving notice.

title: Aeromexico Plane Crashes in Mexico, but Officials Say Everyone Survived
description: MEXICO CITY  An Aeromexico jetliner carrying 103 people crashed in stormy weather shortly after takeoff on Tuesday in Mexicos north-central state of Durango, according to Mexican officials. But in what appeared to be a remarkable survival story, the authorities said none of the occupants had been killed.

title: Temporary Treasure
description: Dear Diary:

title: Video Purports to Show Tajikistan Attackers Pledging Allegiance to ISIS
description: A day after claiming its first attack in Tajikistan, the Islamic State released a video on Tuesday that purports to show the five attackers joining hands and pledging allegiance to Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the terrorist groups leader.

title: Migrant Detention Centers Are Like a Summer Camp, Official Says at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  Not until the day it was announced did senior officials from three key agencies learn of the Trump administrations zero tolerance policy to deter migrants from illegally entering the United States by threatening jail sentences and separating children from their parents.

title: The Carr Fire, the 7th Most Destructive in California History, Rages On
description: The Carr Fire is the largest of 17 wildfires now raging in California. It is heading west after tearing through Redding, a city about 200 miles north of San Francisco, killing six people and displacing tens of thousands. The fire is now considered the seventh most destructive in the states history, according to Cal Fire, the state agency responsible for fire protection.

title: Facebook, Manafort, Homemade Guns: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Studying the Mechanics of Comedy With 525 Ventriloquists
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Trumps Crony Capitalists Plot a New Heist
description: It seems that last years $1.5 trillion tax-cut package, despite heavily favoring affluent investors and corporate titans over workers of modest means, was insufficiently generous to the wealthy to satisfy certain members of the Trump administration. So now Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin offers an exciting plan to award an additional $100 billion tax cut to the richest Americans.

title: Trump Promotes Diplomatic Gains, but North Korea Continues Building Missiles
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has consistently touted the results of his North Korean diplomacy, insisting since his June summit meeting with Kim Jong-un that Pyongyang is no longer a nuclear threat and noting that its missile tests have stopped.

title: After Top Executive Leaves, Billboard Confronts Its Internal Culture
description: During a recent lunch hour, staff members of the music trade publication Billboard were summoned to a conference room in the magazines Midtown Manhattan office. There, managers gave a PowerPoint presentation about corporate values, detailed the results of an employee survey and promised to improve the office culture.

title: Nikolai Volkoff, Soviet Villain in the Wrestling Ring, Is Dead at 70
description: Nikolai Volkoff, a massive ex-weight lifter who played a Soviet villain in the professional wrestling ring and battled the likes of Bruno Sammartino and Hulk Hogan, died on Sunday at his home in Glen Arm, Md. He was 70.

title: Charles Koch Takes On Trump. Trump Takes On Charles Koch.
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has given Republicans good reason to tolerate his unruly leadership style. His tax cuts, deregulation push and nomination of conservative judges amount to the most orthodox Republican agenda any president has pursued since Ronald Reagan.

title: How the Koch-Trump Rift Could Shape the Midterms
description: Charles G. Koch, one of the Republicans biggest donors, has been critical of President Trumps protectionist trade policies. Mr. Trump is hitting back, creating tensions that could affect the party in the midterm elections.

title: Can Mexico Run on Clean Energy?
description: Mexican voters elected Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador president on July 1 largely based on his promises to solve the countrys most devastating domestic problems: rampant violence, economic inequality and widespread corruption. Mr. Lpez Obrador, however, also has the chance to catapult his country into a leadership role on an issue that will benefit both Mexico and the rest of the globe: climate change.

title: Live Jazz: 3 July Standouts, From Thumbscrew to Nabat Isles
description: Welcome to The Month in Live Jazz, a column highlighting three standout performances from the past month on stages across New York City.

title: Online Lenders and Payment Companies Get a Way to Act More Like Banks
description: The federal government began clearing a path on Tuesday for online lenders and payment companies to more easily and directly compete with traditional banks, a change that one regulator said would allow innovative businesses to expand nationwide.

title: Quotation of the Day: North Korea Keeps Building Missiles Despite U.S. Overtures
description: The South Koreans have said the North Koreans have agreed to give up nuclear weapons. Trump has said they have agreed to give them up. But they have never said it.

title: 3 Russian Journalists Killed in Central African Republic
description: MOSCOW  Three Russian journalists investigating the activities of a private security company with murky Kremlin connections have been killed in the Central African Republic, the Russian authorities said Tuesday.

title: Queens Killings Stemmed From Custody Dispute in the Netherlands
description: To some friends and neighbors, James Shields seemed to be a gregarious man who loved to throw parties in his backyard in Queens. But in private he had been seething for months over a battle with his ex-wife to win custody of their 6-year-old son, police officials said.

title: With No Attractive Offers, the Mets Stand Pat
description: WASHINGTON  It was clear long ago that this Mets season was lost. Entering Tuesday, they had the third-worst record in the National League.

title: Pakistans Likely New Leader Could Complicate Afghan Peace Talks
description: WASHINGTON  The rise of Imran Khan, a former cricket star who is Pakistans likely next leader, could complicate new talks between American diplomats and the Taliban about ending the war in Afghanistan, officials said, fraying an already strained relationship between the nuclear-armed Islamic nation and the Trump administration.
